loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dressmaking business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

During festive season, the month of December, the demand for dresses is very high compared to other months when demand is low. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of cloth materials for dressmaking business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of cloth materials for dressmaking business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde este año. Ellas son mujeres que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Felipa, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de termos forrados en cuero y también hace trabajos de manicura a domicilio. Ella nos cuenta que gracias a su sacrificio, sumado a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su grupo puede salir adelante y generar los ingresos que necesita para aportar en su casa. Su meta es crecer como comerciante y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.  
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de termos para ser forrados y también cuero. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en:
This group arose from a contact between one of the members and the Fundación.  The group is in its third cycle and operates with the Fundación since this year.  They are women who strive to the maximum to help their families through their teamwork.

One of the members of the group is Felipa.  She makes and sells leather covered thermoses and also provides in-home manicure services.  She tells us that thanks to her sacrifice added to her work and the help from the group she’s able to get ahead and generate income she needs to contribute to her household.  Her goal is to grow as a merchant and continue to help her family this way.

She’s asking for the loan to buy thermoses to be covered and also to buy leather.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to buy thermoses and leather.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 29-year-old, hardworking lady with 4 children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. She has been selling charcoal for the last 4 years. She started with capital of 100,000 UGX and now has over 1,000,000 UGX as working capital. Her major hardship is customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of hiring employees to help expand her business. The purpose of the loan is to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La socia Esther continua con su negocio, ella sigue adminitrando y atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes y tambien sigue vendiendo cosméticos. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, leche, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Esther still runs her general store and she also continues to sell cosmetics. At this time, our member needs the loan to purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, cooking oil, and other basic need items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, cooking oil, and other basic need items.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,75 hectares  d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The 10 members of BENKADI IV are married women. They are 28 years old on average, and they have an average of 3 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, one of the villages in the Guegneka district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali). 

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their business at the beginning of the off-season. They grow millet and peanuts. This is their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this new loan, MAMOU, the person in the center of the front row, would like to pay for farm inputs, equipment, and plowing fees to maintain 1.75 hectares of peanuts.

They sell their crops after the harvest to men and women in the city of Fana. She would like to earn an average income of 280,000 FCFA per farming season. This income will let her repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and equipment.

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
Gulmurod was born in 1978 year. He is a farmer who has a plantation. He has been in agricultural business since 1999 year. He sells his agriculture products at the local market. He has a lot of clients who prefer his good because he grows vegetables with good quality. He hopes that during some future years he will develop business and to do more income. He also has additional income from animal husbandry. 

Gulmurod has acquired a loan of 900 USD to buy mineral fertilizers and crops. He awaits your support and believes that your supporting will make his living condition better.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and crops

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en: Sadaqat , is 45 years old, married woman. She is running business selling garments to provide for her family. She purchases variety of children garments from the market at low prices and then sell it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. The garment selling business has allowed Nusrat to help earn money for the household thus easing the expenses and improving the standard of living for the family. For the improvement of her business, Sadaqat  has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase winter collection of garments to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase winter collection of garments to meet customers’ demand consistently

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Mrs. Christine E. is the mother of four (04) children. She has lived for some twenty years with her two (02) sisters in the house she shares with her husband. A blacksmith by trade, her husband has difficulty meeting the family’s needs. This is why Mrs. E. covers more than 70% of the household expenses using the income from her business of selling generic products. She has been in this business for 5 years and has completely mastered it. During the day, Mrs. E. walks from neighborhood to neighborhood with her products before displaying them on the side of the road in the evening. Dynamic and honest, Mrs. E. has proven herself to be a capable manager and a trustworthy woman by receiving and successfully paying back her first two credits of $100 and $200 respectively without any incidents. In order to expand her selection and increase her business, Christine is asking for a new credit of $750, which will allow her to buy medicines directly from wholesalers. This will make it possible for her to increase her revenue and better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Christine est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle vit depuis une vingtaine d’année avec ses deux (02) sœurs au domicile conjugal. Forgeron de métier, son mari subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille. Aussi, intervient-elle à plus de 70% dans les charges du foyer à travers les revenus issus de ses activités de vente des produits génériques. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et en a une maîtrise totale. Pendant la journée, Madame E. Christine se promène de quartier en quartier avant de les exposer le soir au bord de la route. Dynamique et honnête, Madame E. Christine fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire et d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $100 et $200 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident. Pour élargir son étalage et accroître son activité, Christine sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui lui permettra d’acheter les médicaments directement chez les grossistes. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling generic medicines

loans.name: Aghayeva

texts.en: N. is a resident of Beylagan town. She is 27 years old and started her business two years ago. She rents a shop in the center of town where she sells different food stuff. In the beginning of her business she borrowed first $300 then $500 for increasing the stock of goods. Thus she developed her business and now she needs $600 to buy a refrigerator to store diary, meat and other products.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her inn Business

loans.name: Achu Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and has six children. His ambition in life is to raise and own his own capital, and to see all his children become responsible citizens tomorrow.  As small steps towards these goals, he joined GHAPE and requested $40 as take-off capital. With previous loans he started a pig farm. Gardeners in his community have benefited from his  manure. Given a loan of $500, Moses plans to restructure his piggery and buy piglets, 160kg of feed and vaccines. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Reconstruction of pig sty and buying of piglets

loans.name: Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena is a married woman with four children: two sons, 15 and 7 years old respectively, and two grown daughters who are married and no longer live with her. Macarena’s husband works as a carpenter but his earnings are not sufficient to maintain the family. For that reason Macarena decided to begin her own business in order to bring income to her family and above all education to her young sons. She began to sell women’s undergarments by catalogue to her neighbors, friends and family. Little by little, her sales have increased. The business has been in operation between 6 and 7 years, and Macarena wants to continue with it.

Macarena is asking for a $925 loan in order to buy merchandise and to be able to offer better products. She is offering to repay the loan in 5 months. She and her family thank you for your support in helping her business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Macarena es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos hijos de 15 y de 7 años respectivamente, y dos hijas mayores que ya son casadas y no viven con ella, su esposo trabaja como carpintero y los ingresos que él tiene no eran suficientes para mantener la economía de su hogar, fue por ello que ella tomó la decisión de empezar con su negocio para poder aportar ingresos a su hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos que son pequeños. Ella empezó a vender ropa interior de dama por catálogo entre sus vecinos, amistades y familiares y poco a poco han ido creciendo con sus ventas, teniendo ya entre 6 a 7 años con su negocio y desea continuar con el mismo.

Macarena está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer mejor sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth Maria has been selling kids', men's and women's clothing such as shirts, trousers, shorts, socks and towels etc for 14 years. She started by investing her savings of many years of $2,000, and with this she started to travel to the capital (Managua) to buy merchandise in bulk.

She started as a wandering merchant, walking through the streets of Leon with a suitcase full of clothes, through the markets looking for clients. She had a huge desire to overcome her circumstances and decided to receive credit so that she could establish her business, and she rented a stall in Leon's central market.

Ruth has received 5 loans and has now been working with our organization for 14 months, and her testimony follows:

"Thanks to the great advice about managing my loans I have been able to move forward. My husband has not found a job so it is up to me to support our family and I do all I can so that my son can have a good education - he is the youngest but I hope he will overcome and become a professional. Each loan that I have received I have invested in increasing my merchandise with seasonal clothing."

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth María tiene 14 años desempeñando este trabajo, vende ropa interior para niños, damas y caballeros, blusas, pantalones, camisas, short, calcetines, toallas...etc. Inició invirtiendo sus ahorros de muchos años U$2,000 (dos mil dolares), con esto ella comenzó a viajar a la capital(Managua) para coprar la mercaderia al por mayor.

Ella al inicio como comerciante ambulante, caminaba con la maleta de ropa por toda la ciudad de León y los mercados buscando clientela, pero con los buenos deseos de superarse decidió adquirir los créditos para poder establecer su negocio, alquilando un módulo en el mercado Central de León.

Doña Ruth ha recibido 5 créditos y actualmente está cumpliendo 14 meses de trabajar con nuestra organización, su testimonio es el siguiente:

"Gracias a los buenos consejos para saber administrar mi crédito he logrado salir adelante, mi esposo no ha encontrado trabajo, así que por el momento es a mi a quien me toca mantener a la familia y hago todo mi esfuerzo para que mi hijito logre tener una buena educación, el es menor de edad pero deseo que se supere y sea un buen profesional. Cada crédito que recibo lo invierto en la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio con ropa de la temporada".

loans.use: To buy merchandise (Children's, women's and men's clothes) / Compra de Mercadería (Ropa para niños, damas y caballeros)

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy K. C., 35, works making wine and raising pigs, earning around $10 per day of income. Her husband is a farmer who grows crops and collects palm juice to produce palm sugar. He makes about $4.80 a day in revenue.

Mrs. Dy K. C. has three children. Two are students and the third is too young to attend school.

Recently, she has applied for a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more rice and adding more piglets in order to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to produce wine and also buy more piglets for her livestock.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in León for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Rodrigo R. has been selling fruits and vegetables in León for the past 27 years. He began his own stall with his hard earned savings as he had allways wanted to be an entrepeneur.

Rodrigo began selling in La Estación market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall

Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Rodrigo is a father of four young children that are in school. Ceprodel has provided 27 microloans over the past three years to Rodrigo and he has paid back these loans. He needs another loan to expand the business and to help provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Fayzullo Hafirov lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 55 years old, married and has no children. He has secondary education. He is in the agriculture and sowing of wheat. This business is the main source of income for Fayzullo and helps him support his family. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing of wheat. He has three years of experience in this field. The development of agriculture allows to provide wheat and flour to the local residents. Fayzullo plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хафизов файзулло житель района Хуросон. 55 лет ,женат, детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством, посевом пшеницы.Этот бизнес позволяет обеспечить свою семью, т.к этот он является основным источником дохода. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку зерна и удобрений для посева пшеницы.Опыт работы в данном бизнесе 3 года.Развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zaina K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry birds. Zaina is 42 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Zaina makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet her basic needs like food and shelter. Zaina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zaina is joined in her small group by Harriet A., Rehema A. and Zaina M.. Harriet A. has a business milling maize and wants to stock more maize. Rehema A. is currently operating a business selling raw food and wants a loan to add capital. Zaina M. operates a poultry farming business and sells clothes and wants to construct a poultry house.

loans.use: To boost and expand poultry business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 37 years old. She is married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. She and her husband also take care of another child, age five.

Mariam is a charcoal and food seller, a business she started in 2000. She works from 6am to 9pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $47 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti Z. sells young coconut ice everyday. The distance from her home to her business is not that far as she can still walk. She usually goes by motorbike, but the motorbike is often used by her husband who works as a construction worker. Her business is quite promising although the profit is just decent. She plans to use the loan to build a pushcart. In addition the loan is going to be used for more working capital to buy more young coconut from the nearby market. She lives with her husband and two children at Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Siti Z. adalah sebagai penjual es kelapa muda. Jarak tempat usahanya dari rumah tidak terlalu, masih bisa dijangkau dengan berjalan kaki. Sarana yang dipergunakan biasanya sebuah sepeda motor, tetapi lebih sering dipakai suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Usahanya saat ini cukup menjanjikan, meskipun keuntungan tidak terlalu besar. Rencananya pinjaman yang didapat kali ini akan dipakai untuk membuat rombong sebagai sarana berjualan. Selain itu juga, sisanya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli kelapa muda dari pasar terdekat. Bersama suami dan kedua anaknya, saat ini mereka tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

loans.use: to build a pushcart and add more working capital

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vu, 31 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 9 years. Before joining the Fund she worked in the fields like many other women in the region. In 1999, she started planning with her husband to join the Fund for seed money to go into business and improve their family’s finances. Everyday her husband uses the money borrowed to go buy baby pigs in town and surrounding areas to sell to retailers with freezers. Mrs. Vu buys wheat from farmers and resell it to processors who grind the wheat. In the first few funding rounds, since they were new to their respective businesses, the couple only borrowed a small amount. After some time the couple became familiar with their businesses and bravely increased their loan amounts. The businesses have increased the family’s income day by day; currently the family’s income ranges from 3,500,000 VND to 4,500,000 VND per month. Thanks to this improvement the children are better off in their daily lives and their schooling. Mrs. Vu would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more stock for her business without having to pay a high interest rate with credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Tuyết năm nay 31 tuổi và đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương được 9 năm.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị chỉ làm ruộng như bao người phụ nữ khác tại địa phương. Năm 1999 chị đã bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào quỹ tình thương vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng ngày chồng chị đã sử dụng vốn để đi mua lợn con trong xã và các vùng lân cận về bán cho các nhà máy đông lạnh, chị Tuyết đi thu mua lúa của nhân dân về bán cho các đại lý say sát gạo .Những vòng vốn đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán nên anh chị chỉ dám vay mức vốn nhỏ. Sau một thời gian anh chị thấy công việc buôn bán đã quen dần và thấy cách hoàn trả theo tuần của Quỹ rất phù hợp vì thế anh chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn lớn hơn.Với công việc buôn bán hàng ngày thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng dần, hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt từ 3500000 đến 4500000 đ/ tháng. Nhờ đó các con của chị đã được đầu tư hơn trong cuộc sống và học tập. Chị Tuyết mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn để đi mua hàng không phải mua chịu với giá cao.

loans.use: Business, Resale

loans.name: Ngoc Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngoc Thi T. is a 37 year old woman. She has 2 children, who are going to school. She participated in TYM program in 2004 and used the first loan to raise pigs, but was not successful. As she could see that cow raising was more beneficial, the next loans were invested in breeding cows. At the moment, in family’s stable, there are 4 cows. In order to improve the family budget and support their children’s education, her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. The family’s income is 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to borrow the next loan of 8,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more cows and food for them

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị TrầnThị Ngọc năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Vòng vvốn đầu tiên chị sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn nhưng nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi bò thịt tại địa phương đang phát triển và cho thu nhập cao hơn nên các vòng vốn sau chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bà thịt. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 4 con bò. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và có điều kiện đầu tư cho con cái ăn học, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm nghề xe ôm. Thunhập hiện nay của gia đình chị đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Để có vốn mua thêm bò và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 8.000.000đ

loans.use: Buy cow and invest in raising

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
Tojinisso Colieva is a citizen of the area of Vahdat. She is married and has eight children. She owns a small store in the Vahdat area in which she trades food products. This trade is the only source of income for her large family, because her children do not work yet since the are in school. In the current moment Tojinisso wants to increase the assortment of her goods, for which she needs to receive a loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Солиева Тоджиниссо жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Клиентка имеет небольшой магазин в районе.Торгует она продуктами питания . Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Дети Тоджиниссо еще не работают.Так как учатся в средней школе. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент товара. Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Salama's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Salama is 32 years old, married, and has a child, age 7. Since last year, Salama has been earning income selling clothes. Every day, she works from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$60 from the sales.

Salama is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and thereby improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with food and bites sales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es: Don Wuilman tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un bario que se llama Laureles Norte, casado y con dos hijos mayores de edad, de 23 y 25 años, que ya son independientes, su esposa es comerciante, por la mañana se levanta a preparar el desayuno a su esposo ya que desde horas muy tempranas esta listo para salir a trabajar, ya que su trabajo es de taxista y tiene que chequear el carro ante de salir, ya tiene catorce años en este negocio que abecés le resulta cansado por que la situación esta mala y lo clientes no quieren pagar lo que vale la carrera, pero también hay días buenos, pues el inicio con recursos propios cuando compro su carro. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro. Zinc, para un anexo en la parte de atrás de la casa. A largo plazo es poder tener otro taxi para dar mejores servicios y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Wuilman is 42 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 23 and 25 both of whom are independent. His wife is a merchant and she gets up in the mornings to prepare breakfast for her husband who has to get ready for work early as he works as a taxi driver and needs to check his car before leaving. He has been in this business for fourteen years and the job can sometimes be tiring because the situation is bad and clients do not want to pay what the trips are worth. However, there are good days. He started his business by buying his car with his own funds. He is asking for this loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and zinc to build an addition to the back of his home. In the long run, he hopes to have another taxi to be able to offer a better service and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build addition to  home.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has a restaurant at Uselu Motor Park. He is standing next to his wife in the picture. He sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yam, eba, etc. He also sells drinks in his restaurant. His restaurant is always busy with his customers. Travelers always stop by his restaurant to buy cooked foods. He manages the restaurant with his wife. They buy drinks from distributors in Benin City.

Gabriel needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to his customers. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He and his family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Sinignèsigui Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sinignèsigui ( 7 femmes,  6 mariées et 1 célibataire) vivent dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 5 enfants et  42 ans dans le  village de Bougoula Hameau situé à environ 3 km de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers notamment les condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe, les chaussures et les céréales. 
Se faisant mutuellement confiance et dans le soucis de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel le groupe est à son 2 ème  du prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 sacs de tomate, 10 sacs de piment, 10 sacs d’oignon, 10 sacs d’aubergine, 10 paquets de maggie, 10 boîtes de concentré tomate, etc. Les marchandises sont achetées au grand marché de Sikasso et vendues vendues au comptant et à crédit au marché du quartier et à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine. 
Elles envisagent augmenter subtentiellement leur profit en réalisant chacune un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignèsigui group ( 7 women: 6 married and 1 single) live in polygamous families with, on average, 5 children and an average age of 42, in the village of Bougoula Hameau, situated 3 km from the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They retail various small items, notably condiments, firewood, shoes, and cereals. Trusting each other and hoping to better satisfy their ever-growing clientele, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second group loan (solidarity loan). The previous loan was correctly reimbursed.

With this second loan, they intend to buy 10 sacks of tomatoes, 10 sacks of hot peppers, 10 sacks of onions, 10 sacks of eggplant, 10 packets of Maggi, 10 boxes of tomato concentrate, etc. The merchandise is bought in the big open-air market of Sikasso and sold, for cash or credit, in the neighborhood market and out of their homes, to a local clientele consisting of women.

They expect to substantially increase their profit, each of them making an average profit of 10,000 F CFA per month which will be used to make repayments on the loan and cover family expenses, with the remainder invested back into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, rice, shoes, and firewood

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mao H. was born in 1982, and she now lives in Por Steang village in Kampong Cham. She is a duck breeder. Her ducks are getting bigger and bigger, and she does not have enough money to buy duck food to feed them. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey Mao H. decided to ask for a loan buy duck food.

Her husband, Mr. Chaom Cheng Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srey Mao H. has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are only one and four years old. Her husband is presented next to her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Nodira started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nodira has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last four years, IMON International has provided ongoing assistance to Nodira’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nodira has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase more clothing for selling. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months. The well being of Nodira’s family and her business are in your hands. Nodira and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy started her business selling provisions, drinks and foodstuffs in 2000. She hopes to increase her profits as the demand for her goods is increasing. Joy has applied for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more merchandise. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a police officer. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Жена Рустама раньше являлась активной клиенткой Микроинвест несколько лет. Сам Рустам ранее был на заработках в России, после приезда стал помогать жене по бизнесу. Жена Рустама занималась куплей продажей сухофруктов, затем стала продавать рис. Посоветовавшись супруги решили арендовать маленький киоск посреди рынка и включили в ассортимент растительное масло, макароны, рис и чай. Теперь торговля пошла лучше и стало много постоянных клиентов. Сейчас Рустам планирует получить новый займ и прибрести оптом рис, так как цена на него сейчас приемлема.
texts.en:
Rustam's wife was an active Microinvest client for several years. He himself previously traveled to Russia for work, but after his return, he began helping his wife with the business. She worked in dry fruit sales, and later switched to selling rice. After some discussion, the couple decided to rent a small stall in the market and expand their inventory to include oil, noodles, rice, and tea. Now sales have improved and there are many regular customers. Rustam plans to obtain another loan and buy rice wholesale, since the price is currently fair.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of rice

loans.name: Lissassi

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’agoè minamadou, adjavou lissassi exerce la restauration, sa spécialité est le plat de riz, il y a des écoles primaires dans son quartier, à la pause les élèves viennent acheter chez elle, aussi les jeunes célibataires de son quartier ont pris l’habitude d’aller déjeuner chez elle. Son stock de riz mou est épuisé, cliente de WAGES, elle s’adresse à l’institution pour obtenir un crédit et acheter 08 sacs de riz. Adjavou est mariée et à 05 personnes à charges
texts.en:
A resident of the Aagoè Minamadou district, Ms. Adjavou Lissassi works in the restaurant business. Her speciality is rice plates. There is a primary school in her district. During breaks, the students come to buy from her. Also, young unmarried people in the area have gotten into the habit of having lunch at her place. Her stock of (soft) rice is exhausted. A client of WAGES, she's inquiring with that institution to obtain a loan to buy eight sacks of rice. Adjavou is married and has five people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice for catering

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Fatuma M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single. Fatuma has been running a women's handbags and clothes business since 2001. She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week. Fatuma currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes and handbags for her business. In the future, she plans to establish the same business in another place. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and handbags for her business

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. no aparece en la imagen pero su esposa la señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo es a la persona que se le tomo ya que le señor trabaja y no se encontró.
 Felipe y su esposa quieren construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio y vivir cómodamente. Sus hijos ya están creciendo pero en un futuro querrán tener su propio espacio, la casa es muy pequeña es de interés social por lo que el señor piensa en comprar el material para comenzar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. does not appear in the photo but his wife, Señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo is the person that we have photographed as Señor Felipe is at work and we couldn’t meet him. Felipe and his wife want to build a room on the front part of their home, in order to have more space and to live comfortably. Their children are already raised, but in the future they want to have their own space. The case is very small as it is public housing, so Señor Felipe thought to buy the materials to begin his project.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tienen 20 años, es una joven madre muy tranquila, vive con su pareja en una casa alquilada, es madre de una niña de 3 años, que es el motivo de su esfuerzo. La compra, crianza y venta de cuyes es el negocio que realiza diariamente, la carne de sus cuyes es muy solicitada en las ferias dominicales, ya que se encarga de alimentarlos bien y se preocupan de que desarrollen un buen tamaño; por ello, todos los días se levanta muy temprano  para cortar el pasto fresco para que se alimenten y no consuman las avenas ni alfalfa almacenada para los meses de sequía. Nelly cuida con mucho cariño a sus animalitos, ya que sabe que gracias a ellos captará el dinero para cubrir sus necesidades. Los 2 años que lleva en este negocio le enseñaron a criar y desparasitar a sus roedores oportunamente para ofrecer carne sana y saludable a todos sus clientes. Para más adelante, Nelly espera incrementar la cantidad de cuyes que posee, asimismo construir unas jaulas adecuadas, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es escoger la mala hierba de entre el pasto con que los alimenta, porque si no lo hace significaría la muerte de los cuyes que la coman. Nelly muy orgullosa, nos muestra a sus cuyes en la foto. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y en este crédito hace compromisos de cumplir sus pagos en las fechas programadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a construir jaulas para sus numerosos cuyes, y de ese modo seleccionarlos de acuerdo el tamaño, también comprará alimentos concentrados para el desarrollo y engorde de sus animalitos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 20 years old, and is a very tranquil young mother. She lives with her partner in a rented home. She is the mother of a 3 year old girl, who is the motivation for her efforts. Her business is the purchase, care and sale of guinea pigs. The meat from her guinea pigs is in high demand at Sunday fairs because she feeds them well and ensures they grow to a good size. To do this, she gets up very early each day to cut grass to feed them. She prevents them from eating oats and alfalfa which is stored for months when there is drought. Nelly cares for her little animals with a lot of love, as she knows that it is thanks to them that she brings in money to meet her needs. The two years she has spent in this business have taught her to care for her animals and keep them parasite free in order to offer healthy meat to all her customers. In the future, Nelly hopes to increase the number of guinea pigs that she has, and to build appropriate cages for them. She finds that the most difficult part of her work is to root out bad weeds in the grass that she uses to feed the animals, because if she doesn't the guinea pigs that eat them will die. Nelly proudly shows us her guinea pigs in this photo. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making payments on the dates scheduled by her loan advisor. The money that she is requesting will be used to have cages built for her many guinea pigs. With this she will be able to select them according to size. She will also purchase concentrated feed for the development and fattening up of her little animals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and construction of cages

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952 (no. 010102080014). She has 4 children. She sells clothes in the market. Her husband raises pigs and grows vegetables at home. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to expand her business. She needs 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy more clothes to sell in the market. Besides Huyền, Ms. Thuận Thị Nguyễn also attends this group.

Thuận Thị Nguyễn was born in 1970 (no. 010102080015).  She has 2 children. She is a dressmaker. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy material to make clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard A. is the leader of Buramba Tewtungye, a group in Bushenyi. He is a determined and dedicated 46-year-old man, who is married with three children aged 12 – 18 years. He also helps to care for two orphans. All of the children are in school. 

Richard has a bakery business that he inherited from his father 20 years ago. His market area is in the Ishaka suburbs,  with Mitooma secondary school and the University nearby. His main challenge has been the constant increase in price of the raw materials, such as flour and oil. He uses his motorcycle to supply the products to his customers and this makes his work a bit easier. 

His kind of products include doughnuts, cookies, brown bread, pancakes, kebab and chapattis and luckily he has customers for all his products. Richard had a dream of opening up a store in the suburban town with a van to expand in the market, as well as have all his children educated up to the university level. He needs a loan to help with buying firewood and flour for baking purposes.

loans.use: Buying firewood and flour for baking purposes.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hăng Nguyễn Thị (1816071341) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has a school-aged child.

Hăng owns and operates a food stall, selling poultry products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hăng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hăng is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tamidayo

texts.en: Tamidayo sells drinks, sachet water and palm oil in her house. She has been in business for the past ten years. Tamidayo lives in Lagos and she is very happy with lapo and Kiva for their financial support. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells fruit and canned juices, water and drinks. She even sells rechargeable cards. The majority of her sales are to retailers who in turn sell to final consumers. Those who sell along the highways also buy from her because her shop is close to a major road. Buying in large quantity enables her to get a better price and increases her profit on each sale, so she is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell.	Florence lives in Lagos with her family. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto vive en Villa San Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La paz con sus hijos, percibe una renta de jubilación que le permite cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación, el crédito que solicita es para la refacción de su vivienda que esta un poco deteriorada por la antigüedad además que sus hijos necesitan mayor comodidad. 

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto lives with his sons in Villa San Antonio Bajo in the city of La Paz. He receives a retirement payment that allows him to pay for their food costs. He is asking for a loan for the refurbishment of his house, which is a little deteriorated due to old age. Furthermore, his sons need more comfort. He is a member of Impro and repays very well, therefore he can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House refurbishment

loans.name: Yeliboya Group

texts.en:
This is Hawa C., Emma K. and Kadiatu S.. They call their group Yeliboya. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. Previous loans have helped these entrepreneurs’ businesses and personal lives a great deal.  Having completed repaying their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,000,000 for each to help them further strengthen their businesses. 

Hawa C. on the right is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Freetown about fifty-five years ago. She now lives in Magburaka town, where she is married together with her five children. Two of Hawa’s children are already grown-ups, one is in college and two are in secondary schools. Hawa sells dried fish which she buys from a village called Yeliboya. She has been in the dried fish business for over eighteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hija, en su casa propia. Cuando la visitamos la encontramos en los ajetreos de tapar apresuradamente la pachamanca (plato típico que consiste en la cocción de los alimentos en un horno bajo tierra). Esta actividad suele realizar en cada cosecha de papas para compartir con sus peones y asimismo celebrar la buena producción de sus chacras. Rosmery se siente feliz de su actividad agrícola, ya que desde niña realiza tal labor, por ello no le parece pesado, su dificultad es cuando hay lluvia excesiva, pues este clima atrae a las plagas y a los gusanos, que con mucha facilidad perjudican sus sembrios. En el caso de los gusanos los contrarresta con la compra de fungicidas, pero hay plagas que no puede controlar y eso la apena muchísimo porque pierde sus cosechas.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ella ha venido cumpliendo la labor de secretaria de su banco comunal eficientemente, por lo que los demás integrantes le tienen mucho cariño. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang M., a 47-year-old married woman with two children, lives with her family in Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, where she typically earns approximately US$5 per day. Her husband, Ouk Sovan, meanwhile, is a construction worker (he builds houses), which normally allows him to earn approximately US$4 per day.

Leang is now seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,100 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her grocery business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana R. es una dama que muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así proporcionarle a su familia buenas condiciones para su desarrollo.

La señora Juana atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda y para ello ha solicitado el crédito ya que lo invertirá directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la obra de reconstrucción de su casa porque es de mucha necesidad para ella y al recibir el crédito e invertirlo en esta obra logrará hacer realidad su sueño de ver su vivienda en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Juana R. is a woman who works strenuously to bring home enough money to support her family and provide good conditions for their development. Juana needs to invest in her home. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will be invested directly in construction materials to remodel her house, because there is a great need for it. To receive this loan and carry out this work would make her dream of having a house in perfect condition become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo N. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Falelima. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Logo is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Logo has just started operating this business and earns approximately 150 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Logo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Logo is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Logo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester S. is from the village of Gud. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Ester owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Ester joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 45 years old, married, and has adult-aged children.

Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture into raising pigs for sale. During the selling season, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B., 57, is married and lives in Prk Pag-asa, Brgy Zone 1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental in the Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store.

Irene’s husband, Rodrigo B., is  61 years old and works as carpenter and welder, and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. They have four children, who are between 32 and 38 years old, and six grandchildren. Three of the children have their own families, but still help their parents with some of the household expenses. The remaining single child also works and helps with the household expenses.

Irene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family's income by operating a general store and fruit vending. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP from her business activities.

Irene is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 14th loan, the amount of 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store and fruit vending business. Irene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “CARITA D. ANGEL” esta ubicado en la Pampa todas son del mismo Barrio, las socias son responsables, es un grupo muy organizado, es su 1º ciclo son personas dedicadas a trabajar para engrandecer su negocio, Rosa  es la Presidenta es una persona muy responsable ella se dedica a la venta D. puertas y ventanas, Karina es la Secretaria, y Josefina es la Tesorera. Todas las socias del Banco Comunal tienen negocio, como ser: Venta D. Comida, Venta D. ropa, Venta D. Cosméticos, Venta D. empanada y joyas. Específicamente cada socia se desempeña en las siguientes actividades: Rosa gloria  como mencionamos anteriormente es la presidenta y venD. puertas desD. hace 8 años atrás, Lusmila se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesa recién desD. hace 1 año, Harry tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa americana (ropa usada) esto lo hace desD. hace 6 años, Pura leny se dedica a la venta D. joyas plata esto desD. hace 1 año, Maria elena es costurera y su especialidad es la costura D. sabanas desD. hace 2 años, Jorge se dedica a la venta D. pan tiene experiencia en el negocio D. 2 años, Ana consuelo tiene un puesto D. venta donD. ofrece chips D. teléfono celular D. una compañía D. comunicaciones esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 2 años atrás, Irma se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año, Karina es promotora desD. hace 1 año, Josefina se dedica a la carpintería desD. hace 15 años atrás y por último la socia Elsa se dedica a la venta D. dulces y tiene una antigüedad D. 2 años en el negocio. Las socias indican D. que si tienen mucha competencia pero ellas siguen adelante con su trabajo debido al esmero que pone cada una en que su negocio crezca poco a poco. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan para hacer crecer su negocio, aumentar su capital. Y comprar más cosas para el mismo. En su mayoría trabajan con otras Instituciones financieras y nuestra Instrucción pero ellas muestran un antecedente crediticio bueno, además que son responsables con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “CARITA D. ANGEL” is located in La Pampa. All the members are from the same neighborhood. They are very responsible and very organized. This is their first application. They are dedicated to working to increase their business. Rosa is the president, she is a very responsible person. She sells doors and windows. Karina is the secretary and Josefina is treasurer. All the members of the communal bank have businesses such as: selling meals, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, selling pastries, and jewelry. Specifically, the various members engage in the following activities: Rosa Gloria, as we mentioned previously, is president and has been selling doors for 8 years; Lusmila has been selling hamburger for one year; Harry has a stall selling used American clothing, which he has done for 6 years; Pura Leny has been selling silver jewelry for 1 year; Maria Elena is a seamstress, her specialty for 2 years has been sewing bedsheets; Jorge has sold bread for 2 years; Ana Consuelo has a stall selling cellular telephone chips, which she has been doing for 2 years; Irma has been selling prepared meals for 1 year; Karina has been a promoter for 1 year; Josefina has been doing carpentry for 15 years; and lastly Elsa has been selling sweets for 2 years. The members state that they have a great deal of talent, but that they get ahead in their work due to the care and dedication given by every member to see their business grow little by little. The loan will be used, in general, to increase their businesses and their business capital, and to buy more things for the business. Most have worked with other financial institutions as well as ours, and they have good credit history and have repaid responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
J. Simon sells bread and tea in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and soda to sell. Simon is 40 years old and is divorced. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to live.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Sovannary's Group

texts.en: Six people are made a group loan who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sovannary K. is a group leader who has been selected by all the members they will use a loan in different purpose. She is house wife and her husband, Mr. Vo Nhean, is a laborer construction. This couple has seven children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, another is a sewer, another is in mobile phone repair, and the others are attending a local public school. However this family tries to work hard, so they can earn more income. Thus, in order to improve condition family living, Mrs. Sovannary K. decided to ask for a loan to buy telephones to re-sell for starting her new business.

loans.use: To buy telephones to re-sell for starting her new business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Chepito Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de pantalones desde hace mas de cuatro años. Ella nos comenta que se animó a empezar este negocio debido su esposo trabajaba como agricultor y los ingresos que percibía no eran permanentes. María del Carmen se contactó con un comerciante mayorista que le hace diversos pedidos de acuerdo a la campaña del año (actualmente se encuentra confeccionando pantalones escolares), el va a recoger la mercadería para luego manufacturarla y venderla en diversas zonas de la serranía del país.

Adicionalmente ella ha empezado un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella piensa valerse de este negocio para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. El negocio está teniendo muy buena acogida entre sus clientes y vecinos debido a que la zona en donde vive queda alejada del pueblo y no tienen acceso a productos de consumo diario. María del Carmen desea ampliar este negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada en la comunidad donde vive. Su mayor anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su bodega para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chepito Alto settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been making pants for a living for over four years. She states that she decided to launch this business because her husband works in agriculture and does not have a steady income. María del Carmen got in touch with a wholesaler who fills special orders depending on the season (they are currently making school uniform pants). He picks up the merchandise and sells it throughout the different areas of the country's mountainous region.

She has also started her own small general store. She plans on using this business to help her family get ahead in life. This business has welcomed many customers and neighbors due to the fact that they live in a rural area that is far from town, so they do not have access to the products that they consume on a daily basis. María del Carmen would like to expand this business, which is why she needs to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the very first time. She will invest this money in purchasing goods for her general store.

She is a well-known and respected person in her community. Her greatest wish is to keep making her general store grow so that she can continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for in-home general store

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salinah S., 45, is married to Benjamin Ossen who is 54yrs old and an employee of Kuda (Kerio Valley Development Authority). They live in Kaptimbor Village and have four children who are aged between 7 and 27.

Salinah sells groceries in Kabarnet Market. Her clients are residents of Kabarnet. She started this business four years ago and normally makes a profit of Kshs 4,000 per month. 

Salina was introduced to Kadet Limited by an existing client. She has a credit history with another microfinance institution. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 20,000 which she will use to purchase sugar and other goods for sale and to purchase second-hand clothes for sale. If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra profit to open a wholesale shop. 

She hopes to open a self selection shop in future and she describes herself as hardworking

loans.use: to purchase groceries and second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: No Mistake Group

texts.en:
Zainab K., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group called “No Mistake group”. The 38-year-old woman lives in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and two children. Her children attend primary school. Zainab has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells groundnuts/peanuts. 

Zainab has requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva field partner SMT, in order to expand her business by buying bags of groundnuts to add to her stock. This is the first loan members of the “No Mistake group” have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 59 años, vive en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, es viuda y todos sus hijos están casados, cuando su esposo murió ella invirtió sus ahorros con arroz, azúcar y bebidas para poder sustentar su hogar. 

Poco a poco con unos cuantos víveres en su casa y vendiendo a sus conocidos ella logro readecuar su casa para construir un local en la sala de su casa, ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 19h00pm todos los días en compañía de sus nietos(aparece uno en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesa, arroz, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente.
texts.en:
59-year old Alicia lives in Guasmo (part of the Guayaquil suburb in which small business owners live). She is a widow and all her children are married. When her husband died, she used their savings to buy rice, sugar, and drinks so she could earn enough money to live on. Over time by earning money selling these items to her acquaintances, she managed to alter her house, turning her living-room into a store. Now she works from 6:30 am to 7:00 pm every day with her grandchildren alongside (one of them appears in the photo). Alicia plans to use the loan to buy a table, rice, and drinks for the store. Her hope for the future is that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a table and products for her store

loans.name: Genith Deidania

texts.es:
Genith de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella construyo en una parte de su casa un local para tener una papelería. 

Comenzó a vender cuadernos y papeles en su pequeño local, poco a poco fue incrementando su papelería y también vendiendo dulces para los niños que iban con sus padres, ahora trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar caramelos, carpetas y plumas para su papelería. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su papelería y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Genith, age 42, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban landscape that was originally more varied, with hills, streams and lakes that still appears as the remains of a dissolving ecology). In order to help her family with the household expenses, she built up a part of her house as a paper goods shop. She began to sell notebooks and paper in her small shop; little by little her paper store grew, and she also sold sweets for the children that came along with their parents. Now, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day. With this loan, she plans to buy candies, folders and pens for her paper shop. In the future, she wants to stock her shop more and in that way have security in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies, folders, and pens

loans.name: Beloy

texts.en:
Beloy L. is from the village of  San Juan, Gingoog City. He is 42 and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Beloy provides a motorcycle service to transport passengers. Beloy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beloy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beloy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Beloy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy Cabaros Group

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and has one infant child. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nancy C. Group. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month. 

In 2008, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: St. Gozanga Women's A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
N. Rose has been selling new garments from Mubende trading centre for ten years.  She also sells clothes in monthly and weekly markets in the area.

From her clothes sales, Rose earns 400,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  This has even inspired her to invest more into the business. Having had a dream to own a clothes business, it is for this reason that she wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects by restocking her business with attractive materials.

By her own account, the future of her business is promising and this will see her earn more revenue as she manages to maintain her customers by doing timely shopping for them. With the loan, she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease of life, which will improve her sales revenue and enable her to take care of her family.

Rose belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase of bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita N. is from the village of Mother Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Nenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Poderosa Luz

texts.es:
Poderosa de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil. ella es vendedora de ropa y bebidas (en la foto aparece en la ventana de su casa donde vede bebidas). 

Una amiga la inscribió para que vendiera ropa por catalogo, poco a poco con la motivación de mantener a su hijo comenzó a vender también bebidas para tener otro ingresos adicional, con esto se estabilizo económicamente ya que no esta casada. Trabaja en horarios rotativos en la mañana vende ropa y en el resto del dia vende las bebidas.  

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para que en un futuro pueda tener su tienda de ropa y tambien bebidas para un ingreso extra. En el futuro quiere tener un local.
texts.en:
Poderosa, who is 52, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She sells clothing and beverages (in the photo, she appears in the window of her house, where she sells beverages). A friend signed her up to sell clothing through catalog sales, and little by little, with the motivation of supporting her son, she began to also sell drinks. With this activity she became economically stable even though she is not married. She splits her work day: in the morning she sells clothing, and for the rest of the day she sells beverages. With the loan, she wants to buy clothing so that in the future she can have her own shop with clothing and beverages as a source of extra income. In the future, she wants to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 42 year old married mother of seven children. She runs a retail shop in Jomvu that has been in operation for two years. It is doing well.
