This loan marks Elizabeth's first borrowing from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets. Her clients are the area residents, who enable her shop to reap a profit of Ksh. 15,000 a month.

She hopes to expand her business greatly in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is a married woman who lives in Labogon, Bgry. 1, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and food vending. Her husband, Lemuel, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 8 to 19 years old. Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14000, which she intends to use to as revolving capital for her fish-vending activities. She plans to continue to save for future home repairs and the education of her children. Liza D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund fish-vending business

loans.name: Dorethy

texts.en: Dorethy A. is married and lives together with her husband and two children. She has received junior high education. She cooks rice for sale at Abura. She helps her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Dorothy will use the loan to purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.  She plans on using the new profit to buy a shop to be able to sell in.

loans.use: purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia N. is 21 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda.  Scovia has a business of selling food and charcoal, which she has had for one year.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food and charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits allowing her to pay school fees.  In the future, Scovia hopes to expand her business.   Scovia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be careful with her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and charcoal.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos y con grado de instrucción de educación secundaria completa.
Mary Luz se dedica a la artesanía, tejido a mano de chompas, chalecos y miniaturas en general. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.500. 00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para comprar lanas para  tejer.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es tener una pequeña empresa de tejidos.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es todo tipo de actividades realizadas en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the communal bank “San Salvador”, located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 25, married, with two children and she completed secondary school.

Mary Luz works in arts and crafts, knitting sweaters by hand, jackets and miniatures in general.  She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years.  Her first loan was for 500 news sols which she used to buy wool for weaving.
The lady is asking for a  loan of 1500 new sols.  This loan will allow her to increase her working capital.
Her dream is to have a small knitting business.
What she likes about the communal bank is all the different activities that take place in the meetings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Edith Marielita

texts.es:
Edith es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo en el sector La Huaca del distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y comercio.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario con un trato amable. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio su negocio cuenta con una clientela fija y se vale de el para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a la economía diaria.

Edtih desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Edith es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las persona que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Edith is 32 and a mother who lives with her husband in La Huaca section of  Olmos district, a rural area of mostly agriculture and business.
She sells general merchandise and groceries from a store in her house.  She sells everyday products to her neighbors in a friendly manner.  Since she has had the business for a while, she has regular customers and she depends on them to help her and her husband  get ahead with their daily expenses.  Edith would like to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can fulfill her customers’ needs.  That is why she is requesting a loan of 1300 new soles form Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve her goal.

Edith is a calm and responsible woman and her main objective is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can offer her family a better quality of life.  The people who know her show her great respect and esteem.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise and groceries to expand the products in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: B. Ruth is an individual client from Mubende. She is 44 years old and married with six children. She has had a boutique that sells clothes from Kyenda for 10 years and is able to make enough sales in a week to live on. Now she needs a loan to buy more clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season. Ruth was inspired to start her business by the demand in the area and she does not regret it.

loans.use: Buy clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
Ana Karen P. García es originaria del  poblado de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 21 años de edad, ella concluyó la educación básica, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos se llaman Leyla de 4 años de edad esta e preescolar, Iker de un año tres meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo y va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar zapato para niño y niña y zapatos para dama y caballero. Inicio en los préstamos por una amiga que la invitó a invertir en un negocio a través de un préstamo. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 meses la invito la prima de su esposo con las ventas por catalogo con las ganancias fue comprando zapatos y los pone en exhibición, Le prestan una vitrina en una farmacia de la localidad para mostrar sus productos.
Su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene, que principalmente destina para comprar más mercancía y para los gastos de su casa. La parte que más le gusta de su negocio es salir cada día a ofrecer sus productos y que le encarguen pedidos de calzado. En promedio visita de cinco a ocho personas por día. Su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de las inclemencias del tiempo, sobre todo cuando llueve, además de que enfrenta la competencia de personas que también venden por catálogo en su localidad. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina en mayor parte a comprar más zapatos. Tiene como meta a corto plazo meter productos diferentes como bolsas de dama, blusas y esto lo va lograr con el préstamo primero y después con las ganancias de la invierte. Su negocio es muy importante porque le va a ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia económicamente y además de que en el futuro hacer mejoras a su vivienda como ponerle puerta a su casa, ventanas, echarle el piso de cemento y los vidrios. A ella le gustaría desarrollarse más en el campo de las ventas y crecer más profesionalmente. Con respecto al préstamo se siente contenta porque va a poder invertir más en su negocio. La señora Ana Karen quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con estos préstamos para crecer más en los negocios”.
texts.en:
Ana Karen P. García is from the town of Moyotepec, a municipality in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, México.  She is 21 years old and finished basic education.  She‘s married and has two children: Leyla, 4, who is in preschool and Iker, who is a year and 3 months old.  Her business is catalogue based shoe sales for boys, girls, women and men.  She will use the loan to buy shoes for boys, girls, women and men.  A friend of hers invited her to join the loans to invest in a business through the loans.  She started the business five months ago.  Her husband’s cousin invited her to join the catalogue shoe sales.  She has used profits to buy shoes to display.  They lend her a display case in a local pharmacy to display her products.

Her business is important thanks to the profits it earns which she used primarily to buy more merchandise and to meet household expenses.  The part she likes best about her business is going out daily to offer her products and receive orders for footwear.  On average, she sees between 5-8 customers daily.  Her business faces challenges like the inclemency of the weather, especially when it rains besides facing competition from people in her community who are also into catalogue sales.

She uses profits from the business primarily to reinvest in more shoes.  Her short term goal is to add other items to her inventory like ladies’ purses and blouses.  She hopes to accomplish this first with the loan and then with profits from the investment.

Her business is very important to her because it will help her support her family economically as well as make improvements to her house in the future like installing a door, window frames, cement flooring and glass windows.

She would like to develop further in sales and grow professionally.  With respect to the loan, she feels happy because she will be able to invest more in her business.  Ana Karen would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for supporting us with these loans so that we can grow more in our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy shoes for boys, girls and women.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter, and they live in Abura. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Esi sells Fante kenkey [kenkey is a fermented maize dough. The Fante people typically sell their kenkey wrapped in banana leaves]. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her kenkey business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to educate her children.

In the photo, Esi’s hand is holding a sample of Fante kenkey. The pot on the ground in front of her is full of the maize she uses for the production of kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her kenkey business

loans.name: Lucero Liliana

texts.es:
Lucero es una madre de familia, tiene de 34 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío  sector Vallecito el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, ella los cría en el corral de su domicilio. Ella se encarga de alimentarlos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Lucero desea ampliar negocio con la compra de más animales de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir incrementando sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lucero is a 34 year old mother.  She lives with her family in the rural community of Vallecito.  It is an agricultural district in Tambogrande, which is in the Piura region.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises sheep in a pen at her house.  She takes care of feeding them.   When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the general public and to the businessmen who usually visit the area.  With the income from this business activity she helps to financially support her family.

Lucero wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals.  That way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand and continue to increase her sales.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativea.

She is a person with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To get animals in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Lazar's Group

texts.en:
Lazar is a hardworking lady and operates a dairy business at her home. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home. Her clients trust her for her good quality milk  They give her a good number of orders, which helps her to earn a good profit. 
She is 35 years old, married to J. B., and has 4 children.  All of the children are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education. 
Her husband started an animal sales business 5 years ago. He buys animals at an early age, raises them, and sells to butchers for a profit. 
Lazar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner,  Asasah, to help her husband in expanding his business. With the loan, he will buy goats to sell at a good profit.  
Lazar is very confident that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him more profits than before. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah.  This is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for animal sales business

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amparo madre soltera, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, ella vela por que sus hijos salgan adelante. Mujer trabajadora, responsable y honesta inicio su propio negocio de ventas por catálogos y encargos fue con ahorros propios por tal compro pequeñas cantidades y poco variedad.  Por falta de financiamientos no invertía más en su negocio siendo unas de las dificultades. Sus planes son aumentar su inventarios e incrementar sus venta mediante la compra de mayores cantidades y ingresar otros productos, con el préstamo comprara: bisutería, perfumes de dama, caballero y niños, también blusas, pantalones, talco, cremas, entre otras mercadería.
Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad de ingresar en el mundo del crédito obteniendo ganancias para ser invertido.
texts.en:
Amparo is a single mother although her children are grown and they help her with the household expenses. She prays that her children will find success. She is a hardworking woman, responsible and honest. She started her own business with her own savings selling by catalogue and taking orders. She was only able to buy in small quantities and in limited variety. Her plan is to increase her sales through the purchase of greater quantities of products and to introduce new products, including pants, talc, skin creams, and other merchandise.

She is thankful to the financial organization for the opportunity to take part in the world of personal credit in order to obtain earnings to reinvest.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products for resale

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a married woman who lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Rodolfo, who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have four children who are 23 to 29 years old. Nemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase a fishing net so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and to expand her fishing activities. Nemia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs seeking a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each to invest in their business. 

Aminata K. is the leader of this group. Aminata is 36 years old, and married with two children who both attend primary school. Aminata sells slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items. She has been running this business for fifteen years. With the help of this loan, Aminata will buy items in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items in bulk

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive en compañía de su esposa y tres hijos de 10, 9 y 7 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace 15 años en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, aprendió con su padre todo el proceso de la agricultura.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes agrícolas, este préstamo le ayudara a que cuente con lo necesario para realizar las labores agrícolas y pueda realizar la siembra de este año, sus riesgos son la intensidad del invierno que puede afectar el crecimiento del maíz. 
Él quiere sacar adelante a su familia, educarlos y puedan tener una carrera universitaria con la cual puedan defenderse en el futuro.
texts.en:
José lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the San Miguel department, with his wife and three children ages 10, 9 and 7. He has worked for 15 years in the cultivation of corn and beans. He learned the entire agricultural process from his father.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure and agricultural fertilizers. This loan will help him to have everything necessary for agricultural labour and to sow this season. The intensity of winter poses a risk that could affect his corn crop.

He wants to get his family ahead and educate them so that they can have a university career with which to provide for themselves in the future.

loans.use: to purchase manure and agricultural fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 48 años y es madre D. familia D. tres niños que tiene a cargo en su pequeño hogar, ubicado en la zona urbana D. La Victoria, distrito D. la provincia D. Chiclayo. 

DesD. hace 5 años el patio trasero D. la casa D. Norma se ha convertido en un corral, donD. Norma se dedica a criar patos y pequines (raza D. patos) para comercializarlos.

Norma desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más patos para criar y así  darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y esto lo conseguirá  expandiendo sus ventas  hacia mercados mayoristas y  restaurantes. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo D.  500 nuevos soles  a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Norma, 48, is a mother of three children that she cares for in her small house located in the La Victoria urban zone, a district in Chiclayo Province.

Since about five years ago Norma’s back yard has become a corral where Norma raises ducks and “Pequines” (a breed of ducks) to sell.

Norma wants to expand the business with the purchase of more ducks to raise in order to proviD. her children with improved quality of life.  She will attain this expanding her sales into wholesale markets and restaurants.  Because of this she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Alvaro Eliecer

texts.es: Álvaro Eliecer, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la  asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con la propiedad y la experiencia en este cultivo y lo que hará es asistirlo para así en la próxima cosecha que está por venir tener un alza en la producción y en la calidad. El lo que pretende es generar ganancias para seguir adelante con su café y también así ofrecerles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Álvaro Eliecer is 46 married and lives with his 4 children and wife. With this credit, he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to care for his coffee plantation. He has both the property and the necessary experience in raising coffee, and will use the needed products to increase his crop yield.  With better profits, he hopes to provide for his family's needs and assure a better quality of life in the future.  This is the second credit Alvaro has received from FUDECOSUR. Rather than seek credit from state-owned banks, he feels that FUDECOSUR offers him better terms of credit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children. Annet has a salon business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build a house of her own.
Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with an 18-year-old daughter. Yuliya lives in Energodar and sells seeds, agricultural chemicals and other farming products in the central market of her hom town. She owns a big vending location and is an experienced vendor who offers a reasonable pricing policy to her customers. She has learned many tricks of her trade in the past eight years.

Currently, Yuliya has already invested 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. Yuliya has big potential and is full of business ideas and projects. She is hoping to generate sufficient income to reinvest it in further expansion of the range of items she offers for sale, e.g., irrigation units and sprayers.

Yuliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, seeds and sprayers. She can quickly respond to different new trends in her business which, in addition to high demand on these types of products, has benefited her venture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and sprayers.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is married to Mr. Sun, 53, who works as a military policeman in the Ministry of the Interior in Battambang Province. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are still attending public school. 

Mrs. Sok, 42, is a fresh fish seller.  She has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for five years. She sells fish that she gets from her wholesale supplier and from fishermen. 

Mrs. Sok is running her fish business well, as she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Sok is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en: Mavis, 43, is a widow with three children aged between 15 and 24, one of whom attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Mandini in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. She has been in this business for three years, selling red meet and spices. She also receives income from the government via a child support grant. She requested this loan from WDB and Kiva to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet. Mavis says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house for her family and to send her child to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet for resale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Fernando has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, snacks & rice per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

Fernando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió por iniciativa de él, no tiene horario fijo atiende el negocio de tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo el cual le ayudara en la compra de granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, sal, azucar, jabón, refrescos y más mercadería que es demandada por sus clientes, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio y tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se casen y ampliar su negocio, para mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives with his wife and two children.  He is married, and runs a shop  that provides every day items.  This business came about on his initiative.  He has no fixed schedule, and serves in the business full time.

He is requesting a loan which will help in the purchase of basic grains, rice, beans, salt, sugar, soap, soft drinks and other merchandise that is in demand by his customers. This acquisition will allow him to expand his business and have more merchandise to offer his customers.

His biggest dream is that his children marry, and that he expands his business to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, soap for his business.

loans.name: 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phúc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Phúc is 60 years old and she is married with two children. Phúc is the group leader of the 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Phúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

 Phúc hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby  cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chocolate.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through senior high school.

Esi sells charcoal at Abura and has done so for 4 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Esi will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Esi plans to plow back her new increase in income.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy serving plates, rice, maize flour and bunches of bananas. Her major challenge includes the ever increasing prices of foodstuffs and transportation. 

Mary's goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant, to build rental houses and also build her own restaurant. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bananas, rice, serving plates and maize flour

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Rebecca has been in this business for four years.  Rebecca also earns income from motorcycle transport.  Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities with the help of the loans from NWTF.  Her dream is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Renefe

texts.en:
Renefe is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Renefe has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing like shirts & blouses. 

Renefe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Renefe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing like shirts & blouses

loans.name: Kulziya

texts.en:
Kulzya is a widowed woman who lives with her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her eldest son is an entrepreneur and the younger two are college students. 

She started her craft business in 2000 by making small accessories like purses, wallets, and small bags. 

In recent years, the tourists are increasing therefore her demand for her products is increasing. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says "I will not rest until my kids get educated". She is requesting 800,000 to buy more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Charlo

texts.en:
Charlo is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Charlo is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline.

Charlo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es:
Don Juan, de 54 años de edad, originario de San Juan de Limay municipio de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad ambos están estudiando. 
El se dedica a la compra, venta y almacenamiento de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol, lleva 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad ya que en su experiencia anterior fue como jefe de brigadas de enfermedades transmisibles por mosquitos pero vio quela comercialización de granos básicos se le ganaba mejor y se dedico a vender y almacenar maíz y frijoles.
El requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos. Ya que el crédito le brindara la oportunidad de poder adquirir granos básicos al por mayor y a buen precio para comercializar fue de Estelí e ir a comarcas fuera de su pueblo que necesitan abastecerse de este producto. Entre sus expectativas primordiales esta los estudios de sus hijos, cancelar su crédito, incorporar la venta de sorgo que un producto que se vender y poder comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 54 years old and originally from San Juan de Limay in the town of Estelí. He is married and has two children, ages 18 and 15, who are both studying. Juan is a merchant who buys, sells, and stores dry goods such as corn and beans. He has been in business for 15 years. His previous job involved directing public health teams that prevented communicable diseases transmitted by mosquitoes. Juan discovered that he could make a better living by selling dry goods, so he decided to sell and store corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan to buy dry goods. The loan that will be granted to him will provide the opportunity to acquire products in bulk and at a good price. He will sell his products in Estelí and in the regions outside of the city that are in need of these items. His main expectations are to provide for his children’s education, repay his loan, add sorghum to his inventory of products to sell, and buy a vehicle for transporting his goods.

loans.use: to buy dry goods (corn and beans).

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, у него взрослые сыновья. Виктор живет и работает в Приветном. Он, как и многие его односельчане, занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур: кабачков, помидор, перца, капусты и баклажанов. На 144 сотках Виктор выращивает 10 000 кустов помидор, 7 000 кабачков, 15 000 перца, 12 000 капусты и 12 000 баклажанов. Выращиванием овощей Виктор занимается уже 21 год. На данный момент в хозяйство уже вложено 160 000 гривен.  

Виктор планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен в закупку удобрений, пленки, семян и химикатов для следующего сельскохозяйственного сезона. Виктор надеется удовлетворить спрос покупателей, эффективно реализовав свою продукцию и получив дополнительный доход от реализации овощей. Виктор планирует и в дальнейшем развивать свое дело, так как это не только дает ему возможность содержать семью, но и приносит массу удовольствия.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Victor is married and has grown-up sons. Victor lives and works in Privetnoye. He, like many of his fellow villagers, grows early crops such as zucchini, tomatoes, peppers, cabbage and eggplant. On the 144 acres Victor grows 10,000 tomato bushes, 7,000 zucchini, 15,000 peppers, 12,000 cabbages and 12,000 eggplants. Victor has been growing vegetables for 21 years. At this point he has 160,000 hryvna invested in his business.

Victor plans to invest the 20,000 hryvna Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, film, chemicals and seeds for the next agricultural season. Victor hopes to meet the demand of buyers, effectively sell his products and generate additional revenue from the sale of vegetables. He plans to further develop his business as it not only allows him to support his family, but also gives his enormous gratification.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, film, seeds, and chemicals for the upcoming agricultural season.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie  is 44 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is  single and  has seven children from 4 to 27 years old. Two are in school and live at home, while the oldest ones are in school and living on their own.

For the past thirty-two years, she has been selling red oil (palm oil)  in the market,  She enjoys the independence her income gives her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business. Her plan is to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (Sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Elsa tiene 71 años edad y es soltera, ella es jubilada y trabaja brindando servicio de hospedaje y alimentación a extranjeros que viene  al Perú para hacer voluntariado. Ya son varios años que brinda el servicio y le va muy bien.  Elsa también ayuda a su sobrina que tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida a pedido del cliente. En esta oportunidad Elsa requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa y para comprar cosas que faltan como por ejemplo toallas y otras cosas más. . 

Elsa es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Elsa was born in the city of Ollantaytambo ( an archeological Inca site, capital of the Ollantaytambo district (Urubamba province), located in the southern part of Peru, about 90km northeast of the city of Cuzco).

Elsa is 71 years old and single.  She is retired and works at providing lodging for foreigners that come to Peru to volunteer.  She has been providing this service for various years and is doing well.  She also helps her niece who has a small business of selling food made to order.  At this time, Elsa needs the loan to be able to do maintenance on her house and buy items that she needs such as towels and other items.

She is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" (Always Ahead) group, which is made up of 12 members that live in the city of Ollantaytambo and perform their financial activities there.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house and purchase supplies.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
Doña Maria continua trabajando como conserje, dando el apoyo a sus hijos es los estudios, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo economico de su ex esposo, para ella, no es facil ya que todo esta altos costos, pero sigue trabajando para poder cubrir sus necesidades.
Es atraves del financiamiento que hara mejoras a su casa, comenzando un cuarto, el cual solo tiene el aranque y desea levantar de concreto, en la parte de alado de su terreno. Para esto comprara materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
María continues working as a caretaker supporting her children’s schooling since she gets no support from her ex-husband.  For her, it’s not easy because everything is so expensive but she continues working to be able to cover her needs.

Through the loan she’ll do some home improvement starting with a room which currently has only started; she wants to erect concrete on the side of her lot and to do so will buy building materials and supplies and start the project.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Uman

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Uman from Masuba, Northern area, in Sierra Leone. He is married with one child aged 3 years. He started this business to improve his standard of living. 

Uman runs a general stock business. He sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2000. He works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week. Uman says that the main challenge to his is business is slow sales during Ramadan month.

Uman has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Riaz  to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Riaz  is 46 years old married woman and a mother of 6 children. In order to support her husband( also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Agustina started selling cosmetics to have an income as she was widowed 16 years ago. She also provides house cleaning and little by little, with her efforts as her foundation, she started increasing her cosmetic sales. Her strongest motivation has been the great love she feels for her four children. Despite the difficult times she face when her husband passed away, she aged to keep going and fought for the sake of her family.

Now Maria Agustina requires a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase a display cabinet for her products. You can become a fundamental part of her effots and those of her family. Do not hesitate, remember that they need you and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Agustina empezó a vender cosméticos por la necesidad de tener un ingreso ya que enviudó hace 16 años. Ella también se dedica a hacer limpieza en casas particulares y poco a poco con base a su esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos con su venta de cosméticos. El principal impulso de ella ha sido el gran amor que le tiene a sus cuatro hijos. A pesar de los difíciles momentos que enfrentó cuando su esposo falleció ella supo seguir y luchar por su familia.

Ahora María Agustina requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de una vidriera de exhibición para la presentación de sus productos. Tú puedes convertirte en parte fundamental de los logros de ella y su familia, no lo sudes más, recuerda que ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase cabinet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Angela would like to buy 7 young steers for her new business

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is an IDP from Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has three children. He started his business in 1995, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $700. Now he would like to borrow  an additional $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old has a small bakery in the Kirkuk market. He has a big family with a poor income. He is applying to get $1200 to purchase a new oven for his bakery. He wants to increase his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new oven

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is 38 years old and is a mother of 2 young boys that are still in school. When she realized that her husband's income as a taxi driver was not covering the basic necessities of her home, she decided to support him, and started to prepare and sell ice cream. In order to excel in this endeavor, she repurposed a space in her humble home and at first only catered to her neighbors using a small wheelbarrow that her husband built for her business. Today, after having dedicated endless hours of work and much effort, she has obtained a small ice cream cart. The small business she has built has also allowed her to offer employment to three young people in her city.

Her hopes are to better the quality and variety of the products she offers, with the purpose of increasing customer preference and satisfaction. In order to fulfill this goal, she is asking for a loan of $500 that she will use to acquire a freezer to preserve the quality and taste of her delicious ice cream. Lets contribute to this young woman's effort.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

Elena tiene 38 años de edad y es madre de 2 pequeños niños que se encuentran aún en etapa escolar, al observar que el ingreso económico que obtenía su esposo con su labor de mototaxista no cubría las necesidades básicas de su hogar, decidió apoyarlo e inició su incursión en la preparación y venta de helados, para el buen desempeño de su actividad habilitó un espacio de su humilde morada y en principio sólo los ofrecía a sus vecinos en una carretita que elaboró su esposo para este trabajo. Ahora, después de haberle dedicado interminables horas de trabajo y esfuerzo ya cuenta con una pequeña distribuidora de helados; con esta microempresa que consolidó también puede ofrecerle empleo a tres jóvenes de su ciudad. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad y variedad de los productos que ofrece con el propósito de incrementar la preferencia y satisfacción de sus clientes y para llevar a cabo este proyecto esta solicitando un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que utilizará para adquirir una congeladora donde podrá preservar la calidad y sabor de sus deliciosos helados.Colaboremos con el propósito de esta joven madre.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Lilia Merlinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Lilia is twenty-nine years old and has completed her primary education. She has no children, lives in Caserío Canchachugo, a town in the Usquil district of the department of La Libertad, and is a member of the communal bank, “Canchachugo.” Mrs. Lilia runs her business out of her home where she sells groceries, drinks, motor oil, grains, and so on, but she also travels to sell her products at nearby markets. She began her business with an initial credit of S/.300 ( approx. $100) that she obtained in her communal bank. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000.00, which will be paid back in four months, she will purchase rice, sugar, preserves, candles, and more to stock her store, and also grains wholesale to sell in markets. Mrs. Lilia dreams of going to live on the coast of Trujillo and opening a large business there, where there are more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lilia tiene 29 años, su grado de instrucción es primaria completa, aún no tiene hijos; ella vive en el Caserío Canchachugo en el Distrito de Usquil departamento de La Libertad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Canchachugo”. La señora Lilia tiene su negocio en su propia casa vende abarrotes, lubricantes para motos, bebidas, cereales, etc, pero además viaja a vender sus productos en las ferias cercanas a su comunidad. Ella inició su negocio con su primer crédito de S/. 300 ($ 100) que obtuvo en su bancos comunal. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 664) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró arroz, azúcar, conservas, velas, etc. Para surtir su bodega y además compró cereales al por mayor para llevar a vender en las ferias. La señora Lilia sueño con ir a vivir en la costa (Trujillo) y poner allí un gran negocio considera que en esa ciudad se tiene mayores oportunidades.

loans.use: Purchase highly needed goods, including preserves, wholesale grains, and other groceries.

loans.name: Malae Tiumalu

texts.en: Malae is 53 years old and married with 8 children. Every week, she works on the plantation and sells her taro pancakes. She is a very hardworking mother, which she believes is the key to long life. Through years of hard work, she managed to start with her pancake business and to be able to sell every day from her home. She is earning good money and is developing some of the things in her home. She is very thankful for SPBD's support which allows her to develop her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business and plantation

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Abdusalom V., 20, is single and has no children. He sells winter clothing and sweaters for men at one of the central markets of Qurgan-Tube, Tajikistan. Abdusalom has been in this business for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase an inventory of winter clothing. Local residents would then be able to purchase warm clothing from Abdusalom without the need to travel 100 km to the nearest clothing market. Abdusalom plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобов Абдусалом, возраст – 20 лет, образование среднее, неженат, детей не имеет. Абдусалом занимается торговлей на одном из центральных рынков города Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. В настоящее время основным его товаром являются мужские зимние вещи, а именно мужские свитера. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для увелечение товарооборота, а именно приобретение нового товара и увелечение ассортимента продаваемого зимнего товара. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям города Курган-Тюбе и прилегающим к нему районам приобретать необходимые им зимние вещи, так как близлежащий вещевой рынок находится на расстояние 100 км. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Lukoto East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Scovia G.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal store and increase stock. Scovia is 25 years old and is married to her husband who is a commercial motorcyclist. She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Scovia makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost her business. Scovia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Scovia is joined in her small group by Jesca N. and Mariam N.. Jesca N. has a business selling vegetables and wants to add more working capital. Mariam N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to purchase more hotel equipment like food, furniture and soft drinks.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru:
Sanobarhon A.lives in the village of Bohtar. She is 54, married, and has 2 children. Sanobarhon A.is a house wife and she maintains a small cattle farm. Sanobarhon A.plans to use this loan to purchase a milk cow to sell milk and thus improve her family’s financial standing. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдукодирова Санобархон проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 54 года. Замужем , имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. имеет небольшое хозяйство, где имеются бычки. Хочет приобрести дойную корову ,для того чтобы получаемое молоко продавать и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.Кроме того у населения всегда пользуется спросом молочная продукция , поэтому продавать молоко всегда выгодно. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jafari

texts.en: Jafari S. is thirty-five years old, a father of two, and a resident of Mbagala. He has been in business for the past six years. Jafari owns a welding and fabrication workshop. He welds door and window frames and other special items. He also runs a grocery store. He is in need of a loan to help expand him both his businesses.

loans.use: To expand his welding shop and grocery store

loans.name: Mansata

texts.en: Mansata Baldé resides in Velingara, Senegal.  She is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children and 5 nieces and nephews under her care.  She has been a member of Centre II village bank for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase "Thioub" fabric in Senegal which she plans to export in the region.  This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy special tinted fabric for resale.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi D. is 47 years old. Before, she and her husband took building materials to other areas to sell. However, this activity required them to be away from home, making it difficult to take care of their children who were still going to school. In 2005, she joined the TYM Fund. She sold her boat and combined the profit with the borrowed money to sell coals to local people. Because of her experience in selling building materials, she uses the borrowed money effectively. Every day, Mrs. D. and her husband buy coals from wholesale people, then sell it to local people. Her income from this activity is approximately 200 USD/ month. She wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Duyên năm nay 47 tuổi. Trước đây hai vợ chồng chị làm nghề chở vật liệu bán nhưng công việc này luôn phải đi xa nhà dài ngày ảnh hưởng đến công việc chăm sóc, dạy dỗ con cái đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào quỹ Tình thương, chị đã bàn bạc với chồng bán thuyền và vay thêm vốn của Quỹ để buôn than phục vụ nhân dân. Do đã có nhiều kinh nghiệm trong công việc buôn bán vật liệu xây dựng trước đây nên gia đình chị đã sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Hàng ngày anh chị thu mua than từ các thuyền sau dó bán lại cho nhân dân . Thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán than của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới gia đình chị muốn có thêm vốn để đầu tư vào công việc buôn bán than vì vậy anh chị đã bàn bạc và quyết định vay mức vốn 9 triệu đồng.

loans.use: coal business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of Z. A., a daily wage laborer, and has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 25 years. The mother of three sons, Razia baji has a milk business. She successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business; Najma baji wants to buy more material for her grocery shop; Haleem baji wants to repair her auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle), while Bashiran baji wants a loan to purchase animals to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Tâm 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004 trước đây chủ yếu gia đình chị làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, cá nhưng phát triển chậm. Để tăng thu nhập gia đình đã quyết định thuê địa điểm buôn bán kinh doanh thu gom phế liệu  hiện nay đang làm ăn tốt. Số vốn vay lần đầu gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi kết quả cho thu nhập tuy nhiên là không cao. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị diễn ra thuận lợi. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày . Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., aged 39, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2004. Back then, her family’s main source of income came from farming, breeding pigs and fishes, but they didn’t generate a lot of income. Consequentially, Mrs. T. decided to rent a place to start buying and selling wastes. Mrs. T. used the loan of the first round to invest in poultries, but she didn’t make much profit. Learning the mistake, Mrs. T. since then has invested the loans from TYM in her business, from which she earns about 200000 VND per day. The business has aided her family financially a great deal. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. would like to ask for 9.000.000 VND ($550) to expand her business. Her family’s monthly income is about 6.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She processes them by smoking (a form of preserving the fish) and then later sends the fish to the market for sale at Elmina. Mary has received no formal education. She is a widow and has 7 dependents. Mary has been selling fish sale since 2002. She is responsible for paying for food, utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Hace más de 4 años, Fabian trabaja como agricultor en una hacienda, donde también vive con su familia, los dueños de esta hacienda les otorgan a sus trabajadores  una vivienda.  Junto a otras personas, pasa todo el día dedicado a la producción de los terrenos asignados, como también seleccionan los productos y los embarcan en los camiones  rumbo a la capital y diversas ciudades del país.  Sin embargo los deseos y ambiciones de Fabián es empezar su propia producción, gracias a su trabajo lograron  obtener un terreno donde cosechar, y a la par de su trabajo en la hacienda, don Fabián  con ayuda de su pareja trabajan en la producción de papa.  Ellos requieren de un préstamo para la compra de abonos y semillas, para así incrementar su producción  y poco a poco independizarse y trabajar  en sus propios terrenos, con ello aumentará las expectativas de  crecimiento y desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
For more than 4 years, Fabian has been working as a farmer on a ranch, where he lives with his family. The owners of the ranch provide their workers with housing. He, along with other people, spend all day cultivating their assigned fields, as well as picking crops and loading them on to trucks headed to the capital and to different cities in the country. Nevertheless, Fabian aspires to start his own crop business. Thanks to his work, he was able to obtain a plot of land for cultivation. In addition to his job at the ranch, Mr. Fabian, with the help of his spouse, works growing potatoes. They need a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer so that they can increase production and become independent little by little. Thus, they can work their own fields, and their family’s growth and development can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng T. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kiet Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to make a living. A 46- year old widow, her only child helps support the family by selling chickens. Even though they both have jobs, they do not earn enough income to support themselves. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Neng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow. She hopes to increase their income by selling bred cows in addition to rice.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Parveen Nazir Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 34-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. She has one son who is 12 years old and reads in 4th standard. Parveen baji’s husband's name is N. M., and he works in a factory. Parveen baji is involved in a livestock business. She buys animals specifically (goats and sheep) from Lahore and sells in her native city of Vehari. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more animals (goat and sheep) to expand her animal selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members. Safia baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Farida baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Shamim baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit selling businesses. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal selling business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two children. She sells various decorations at the market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her monthly gross income is 26,000 UAH, and her profit is about 3,000 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124 USD).

Nataliya has been in this business for 15 years. She enjoys selling decoration articles. She treats her clients well and always offers them a large variety of products. She has many repeat clients, which makes her business very sustainable.

Nataliya would like to receive a loan to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales during the holiday season and make more money for her family. Nataliya's business goal is to open her own little store.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Khasanboy

texts.en:
Khasanboy B. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Khasanboy, from his early years, has been engaged in livestock raising; he helped his father to take care of their animals. Today Khasanboy has a livestock business where his wife and children help him. He has a milk cow and 4 sheep.

Khasanboy has special skills; he knows animals' specialities and the way of taking care of them. Khasanboy is asking KIVA for financial help: a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 10 months for purchasing pedigreed sheep. He wants to start up a serious business raising sheep to increase his business turnover and to have a big livestock farm in future.

loans.use: purchasing pedigreed sheep

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella es socia nueva del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la transformación de la papa en tunta; para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir materia prima (papas) para trasformarlo en tunta y venderlo en las ferias de Puno y Arequipa. 
Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the community bank "Ciudad Blanca" in Chijichaya, district of Ilave, in the province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has one son. She completed elementary school. She is a new member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos; she dehydrates potatoes. She needs a loan of 500 soles which she will repay in three months. She will use the loan to buy raw materials - potatoes - and transform them into "tunta" [dehydrated potato] and sell them at the markets of Puno and Arequipa. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes to dehydrate and then sell at market

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mary S. from Mwanza. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 9 years old. Mary S. has been running a beauty salon since 1999. Her business is Beauty Salon, a place where you can buy hair extensions in different styles--long, short, curly, straight, red, blue--and have it woven, cut, or braided. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mary currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase weaving tools, long hair extensions, clothes, and shoes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase weaving tools, long hair extensions, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Tenning

texts.fr: Madame Tenning  D. est une vendeuse ambulent de bissap et du mil ; elle habite à Bambey dans la région de Diourbel ; elle est mariée et a 6 ans d’expérience sur le métier. Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité  surtout pour le bissap qu’elle compte revendre à Dakar la ville capital. Et elle soutient beaucoup son mari  qui n’a pas de moyen avec les revenues qu’elle gagne sur son petit commerce .
texts.en:
Ms. Tenning D. is an itinerant vendor of bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) and millet. She lives in Bambey, in the Diourbel region. She is married and has six years of experience in this trade. With this loan, she wants to bolster her business, especially in bissap, which she plans to resell in Dakar, the capital city. And she does a lot to support her husband, who lacks funds, through the revenues she earns from her little business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina owns a grocery store in the city of Chisinau. Her store carries a lot of food items, such as milk, meat, grain, sweets, vegetables, fruit, and many other products needed daily for human nutrition. There are no other stores in the region, so business goes quite well. Galina has borrowed a loan from Microinvest to supplement the stock of goods, and needs an additional loan to continue to expand.

loans.use: To increase the stock of grocery-store goods.

loans.name: Muhammad Qasam Group

texts.en:
Muhammad Qasam is the leader of the Muhammad Qasam group. There are two members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to expand their businesses. Muhammad Qasam wants to take a loan for his general store. Pare Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's general store.

They want to take a loan for 28000 Afghanis for the term of eight months. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his general store.

loans.name: Silvia Melany

texts.es: Silvia Melany A. D. A. resiD. en Zaragoza departamento D. La libertad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero desD. ya hace siete años. Ella posee una venta D. verduras en las calles D. Zaragoza, su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico ya que mucha gente transita por el lugar. Silvia solicita un préstamo para que D. esta manera obtenga el dinero necesario para comprar más verduras y así poder mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo su condición económica ya que gran parte D. los gastos del hogar se suplen gracias a las ganancias D. dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Melany A. D. A. lives in Zaragoza, La Libertad. She lives together with her two children and her husband, a carpenter with 7 years' experience. She sells vegetables in the streets of Zaragoza. Her stand is located in a very strategic place having many people come through there. Silvia requests a loan to obtain more vegetables and to improve her sales. She will enhance her financial status because a large part of the household expenses are covered thanks to her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Samaddin

texts.en:
Samaddin A. is a hardworking business owner from Agsu, Azerbaijan, who has a business selling men’s clothes. He has been running his business already for eighteen years and has gained much experience. Samaddin is married and has two sons. His business has become the main source of income for his family.

Samaddin has requested a loan of $1,500 to add to his working capital. His business is growing and the financial assistance will help him to continue operating successfully and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Equator Mutabazi Jane Group

texts.en: M. Jane is a married businesswoman, age 48, blessed with eight children in school and looking after three more children going to school. She has been rearing poultry for two months. She is using this loan to purchase chicks, chicken feed, etc. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to open up a shop in Kasese town.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela vive en alquiler en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, convive con su pareja el cual trabaja en una imprenta; ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina y los ingresos que perciben son muy bajos por lo tanto iniciaron un negocio de venta de víveres (arroz, azucar, harina, etc.), y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y continuar con el negocio y hacerlo mas estable.

No fue un cliente de Impro anteriormente, pero por la actividad y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabriela lives in a rental property on May 4 Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. She lives with her common law partner, who works in a print shop. Sra. Gabriela works as a kitchen assistant. Since her income is not sufficient, she decided to start a business selling food (rice, sugar, flour, etc.). The loan she is requesting will be used augment her capital and continue her business so that it remains stable. She had not worked with IMPRO previously, but her business activity and character enabled her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products for her retail store

loans.name: Amanda Magdalena

texts.es: Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Paz. Amanda vive con su esposo quien es empleado D. una fábrica y su hija Lisseth D. 7 años D. edad estudiante D. básica.  Con 35 años D. edad Amanda ya es administradora D. su propio negocio  posee una tienda ubicada en su casa con la que obtiene ganancias para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, pero Amanda como toda mujer salvadoreña emprendedora también se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo donD. genera ingresos extras. El destino del crédito que Amanda solicita es para surtir su negocio y así seguir ampliando con mayor variedad D. productos  para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. lives in the Colon municipality of the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works in a factory, and her 7-year-old daughter Lisseth, who attends elementary school. At 35 years of age, Amanda now has her own business. She has an in-home general store with which she earns an income to help her husband with the family expenses. However, Amanda—like all Salvadoran enterprising women—also sells products by catalog, thus earning an extra income. Amanda will use this loan to re-stock her shop and expand it with a greater variety of products to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Kuka

texts.en:
Kuka T., a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Faga, is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Kuka raises crops, mainly vegetables. Kuka has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2009, Kuka (01025002-05) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Kuka is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD. Her previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Kuka is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST. This loan will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be Kuka's third loan from SPBD. Kuka plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding an agricultural business

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi A. est un homme âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants. Il habite à Womé, un village situé à 12 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur de café et cacao. Son activité consiste à acheter du café et cacao auprès des agriculteurs et les revendre aux exportateurs internationaux. Avec ce prêt, Kokouvi voudrait augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup de café et cacao afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec ces bénéfices, il espérait bien s’occuper de la santé et de la scolarisation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A. is 40 years old, married and father of eight children. He lives in Womé, a village located about 12 kilometers from Kpalimé. He sells coffee and cocoa. His business activity involves buying coffee and cocoa from farmers and reselling it to international exporters. Mr A. would like to use this loan to increase his trading capacity by purchasing large amounts of coffee and cocoa to satisfy his clientele. He hopes to use the profit to pay for health care and schooling for his children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his trading capacity

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 27, lives with her husband and young child in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer who is able to make less than US$1 each day. Pen was not available for the photo and so her husband is shown instead.

Pen is a professional who decorates women’s dresses. Since 2003, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically make US$3 each day. Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear them during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year.

It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so they are expensive. Most of the people prefer hand-made rather than machine made designs. Pen said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has operated her business since before she was married.

To earn an additional profit, Pen has requested a loan of US$500 to raise ducks for eggs.

loans.use: To raise ducks for eggs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of San Juan in Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, married, and has one adult-age child. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the "services" sector. More specifically, she provides manicure and pedicure services to local community members. In addition, she operates a food vending business. Elvira has been engaged in her business ventures for over a year, and she earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Elvira has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elvira is now requesting another loan through HSPFI, also in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to invest in expanding her businesses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses as a result of the loan to supplement the income of her family and to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business ventures

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Janina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Janina de 25 años de edad, es soltera y  vive junto con sus padres el cual ayuda con los gastos de luz, agua y alimentación, por pocos recursos dejo de estudiar la universidad es uno de sus anhelo el poder concluir su carrera universitaria para lograr un mejor futuro, comenzó trabajando en una bodega en un mercado el mas visitado por los Nicaragüenses por ser el mas barato y donde se encuentran todos productos. Por gracias de Dios le ofrecieron otro trabajo donde gana mejor y lleva dos años laborando ya. Ahora que tiene mas recursos económico desea construir su cuarto propio para una mejor privacidad es por eso opta por el crédito para comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y comenzar hacer el arranque para tener un inicio y poder terminarlo poco a poco que gracias al apoyo de la institución hará posible. Estoy estudiando ingles ya que es una puerta grande hablar el idioma y así poder ir escalando y poder ganar mejor y poder terminar sus estudios, a si como ayudar a sus padres a que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
