Janina is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She helps them pay their electricity, water and grocery bills, which leaves her with little left over for university. Janina wants very much to finish her studies and improve her future, so she started working in a market frequented by Nicaraguans, where products are cheap and plentiful. Thankfully she found a new job with better pay, and she has been working there for two years. Now that she has a better income, Janina wants to build her own room so that she can have more privacy. She needs credit for building materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and zinc. This loan will allow her to begin her project and finish it gradually. Janina says she is studying English because language opens doors that will allow her to improve her station in life, earn a better living, and help her parents so that they'll want for nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials (stone, cement, sand, iron)

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La señora Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 03 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Vedith, se dedica a la venta de pollos a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, donde sus principales clientes son moradores, vecinos y amigos. Ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, realiza sus ventas a partir de las 6:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como pollos en javas; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vedith belongs to the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 44, married, and has three children. Two are still dependent upon her and go to school. Vedith sells grilled chicken in a well equipped place, which is in her own house. She tells us that she has very good daily sales because of the delicious seasoning she gives to her prepared food. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors, and friends. She is very well known, and she is very well received. She currently continues in the same business. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She starts selling at 6:30 p.m. She personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy food preparation supplies like crates of chicken, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, vegetables, and also some utensils for her business to give her customers better service. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She is well equipped. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of chicken and sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Oddo's Group

texts.en:
K. Oddo is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 38 years old and married with 4 children, all in primary school, as he takes care of his elderly parents. He has been a farmer in Kifunjo parish for 7 years and it is from this that he is able to support his family and expand his business.

Currently, Oddo has a challenge of shortage of farmland plus the diseases that attack his crops although he still wants to expand. He works hard to educate his children for a better future. Oddo needs a loan to help expand his business by buying farming equipment like hoes and 'panga's plus seeds and pesticides and others.

loans.use: Buying farming equipment like hoes, 'panga's, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn S. M., 34, is a widow and lives with her four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. To make a living, she sews and designs clothes for new and existing customers. She has been in business since 2002 and earns $4 per day.  Vorn and her family seek to improve their standard of living and want to generate a better income.  S. M. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.  She thinks this loan will reduce public transportation expenses.  This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  She hopes to improve her business.  She wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une jeune femme de 33ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle veut renforcer son capital de commerce de carburant et de denrée alimentaires. Son objectif est  de subvenir aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a young woman, who is 33 years old and married with four children. She would like to strengthen the capital of her fuel and foodstuffs business. Her aim is to provide for diverse family needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fuel and diverse foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona B., age 59, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Danilo B., a businessman, and they are blessed with five offspring who already have families of their own. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own ornamental plant business for quite some time.

Simeona has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 5 times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her plant business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buy raw materials needed to produce her wares.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mr. Ros T. and his wife, Mrs. Men Meach (pictured together), were married in 1984 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Ros raises ducks at home and his wife has been selling fish and eggs for more than 20 years. He wants to buy a cow to raise so he will get extra income from selling cows when they grow big enough. 

Ros is asking for a loan of $700 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es uno de nuestros clientes mas antiguos con los que contamos en esta agencia, es una persona muy trabajadora, Vive en el Barrio Bolivia tiene casa propia y vive con su esposa y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el solo mantiene el hogar por lo que tiene que trabajar duro, es una persona responsable y dinamica.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la de mototaxista  y la actividad de motosierrista, con la primera actividad hace unos tres años que trabaja y con la segunda ya viene trabajando hace unos 5 años.

El sr. Esta muy agradecido con la institución por que gracias a Emprender, el actualmente cuenta con sus herramientas de trabajo. El dinero del credito es para la compra de repuestos y arreglo de su motocicleta.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hard-working person and one of this agency's most longstanding clients. He lives in his own house in the Bolivia neighborhood, together with his wife and his children who are of school age. He supports the household by himself, so he has to work hard. He is a responsible and dynamic person. His work is driving a moto-taxi and also operating a chain saw. He has pursued the first activity for some three years and the second for around five years. Miguel is very grateful to the institution, because thanks to Emprender, he has been able to acquire the tools he uses in his work. The funds from the loan will be used to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts and repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta L. is 39 and married with 4 children (ages 5 - 16).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Roseta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Roseta joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Roseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Pro Mujer Huayocari Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “PRO- MUJER HUAYOCCARI” está representado por Soledad que es la presidente,  Celia que es la secretaria, Natalia que es la tesorera y Mauro que es el fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Huayocari del distrito D. Huayllbamba D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el VII ciclo y está conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

En la comunidad D. Huayocari los pobladores se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura y ganadería, Huayocari es zona D. tierra fértil y forma parte del valle sagrado D. los Incas donD. se cultiva productos como por ejemplo maíz, zapallo, zanahoria y habas. Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios es por ejemplo; venta D. verduras y maíz, venta D. hortalizas, crianza D. animales D. menores y venta D. flores. 

Aydee Florencia es casada, tiene tres hijos y su actividad principal es la venta D. hortalizas y flores y su actividad complementaria es la crianza D. animales menores, ella venD. en el mercado modelo D. la ciudad D. Urubamba las verduras. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.  

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pro-Mujer Huayocari” is led by Soledad who serves as president, Celia who serves as secretary, Natalia who serves as treasurer, and Mauro who serves as auditor. The members meet every thirty days at the microfinance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. The Communal Bank is currently in its seventh loan cycle and consists of 12 hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and proviD. their children with a better future.

In the community of Huayocari, the inhabitants engage exclusively in farming and raising livestock. Huayocari is an area that has fertile soil and is part of the Sacred Valley of the Incas where various crops are grown such as corn, squash, carrots, and beans. Some examples of the businesses the members are engaged in incluD. selling vegetables and corn, selling potted plants, raising small animals, and selling flowers.

Aydee Florencia is married and has three children. Her main business activity is selling potted plants and flowers, but she also has a siD. business selling small animals. She sells the vegetable seedlings at the market in Urubamba. Aydee Florencia has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of her commitment to her work. She needs a loan to increase her business capital for buying small animals, such as guinea pigs.

The members value and appreciate the loan that has been provided to them and promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 56 years old and has four children. She is a rice farmer and her farm is situated in her town in Agusan Del Sur, Philippines. Maria Fe wants to have the best possible rice to sell. She is happy that her farm provides both food for her family and for their other needs. She wants to continue farming and hopefully increase her harvest. Maria Fe applied to Kiva partner, CEVI, and is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposa Victoria de 25 años y su pequeña hija en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de Pichanaki, además de tener un establecimiento alquilado. El ser una persona humana, hizo que Marlon estudie la especialidad de técnico de enfermería, es entonces que desde hace 6 años ayuda a los pobladores de su comunidad, trabajando en el área asistencial del puesto de salud de la localidad “Las Palmas”, paralelamente a esta actividad tiene un bazar de perfumería en el centro de su ciudad, que es atendido por una joven que contrato. Asimismo su esposa labora en la municipalidad distrital de Pichanaki.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender las emergencias que se suscitan en la zona  a cualquier hora del día y aunque no es del todo rentable le alcanza para vivir sin apuros, además con la ganancias que obtiene del bazar compensa para cubrir sus gastos, es por eso que cuanto antes espera vender CD´s y DVD´s para aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está agradecido por la confianza que le dieron, además  le gusta laborar con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de música en CD, películas en DVD para vender en su local.
texts.en:
Marlon, 26, lives with his wife, Victoria, 25, and his little daughter in his own home located in Pichanaki; he also has a rented locale. Being a humane person motivated Marlon to study nursing and for the last 6 years he has provided assistance to residents of his community working at the “Las Palmas” health center. In addition, he has a perfume sales stall downtown that an employee of his tends to. Also, his wife is employed by the city of Pichanaki. What he enjoys the most about his work is taking care of emergencies that arise in his area at all hours and, although not very profitable, it is enough for him to live care-free. Besides, his profits from sales help cover expenses. For this reason, he wants to start selling CDs and DVDs to increase profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he’s grateful for the trust that was placed in him. He also enjoys working with his fellow communal bank members. He will use the requested funds to buy an assortment of music CDs and movies on DVD to sell in his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy music CDs and DVDs to add to his stock inventory.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola vende en las ferias ropa de mujer y de niños; está separada de su esposos y su única fuente de ingresos es su puesto de venta.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona villa san Antonio Bajo  de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de mercadería, ropa de niños y de mujer).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá aumentar su capital y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paola sells clothes for women and children at the markets. She is separated from her husband and her only income source is her sales stand. She lives in a rented house in the zone of "Villa san Antonio Bajo" of the town of La Paz. The loan will be invested as work capital (purchase of merchandise, garments for children and women). It is the first time she requests a loan with Impro. With this loan she will be able to increase her capital and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for children and women.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo R. is from the village of Talon Gingoog City. He is 42 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living Gerardo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells food and daily use products in the local community. Gerardo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gerardo joined HSPFI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerardo successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which he used to purchase additional products to sell. He is requesting his third loan, for 11000 PHP, which he will use for the same reason. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita A. is from the village of Gusao, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 56 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lita owns & operates a general store. Lita has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Lita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products especially goods to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Gusao, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru:
Faig jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Emu 42 qoda. On pereselenec iz Agdama okuppirovannaya teritoriya Karabaxa i seychas jivet v Baku. Eqo deti uchatsya v shkole i zanimayutsya muzikoy. 

Faig Muxtarov v etom biznese prodaji odejdi uje 7 let. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu odejdu  ved vperedi idet osen i shkola  i on xohceh kupit osenniye veshi i odejdu detyam malchikam dlya shkoli dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Faig is married and has two children. He is 42 years old. He has relocated from Agdam which is an occupied Karabah territory and now lives in Baku. His children go to school and also take music classes. Faig M. has been in the business of selling clothing for seven years. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy new clothing to prepare for the autumn and school season and he wants to buy seasonal school clothes for boys.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine I. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.  She is 42 years old and her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio tiene 42 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niño aprendió a las tareas del campo, es así que siembra papa y maíz principalmente, su esposa y sus hijos son el apoyo principal, y cada cierto tiempo verifican constantemente que los cultivos estén libres de plaga de insectos, pero cuando el trabajo es mas intenso, contrata el servicio de peones. Afirma que le agrada bastante trabajar en el campo porque lo realiza de manera independiente y sin presiones. Aunque su labor es sacrificada  es compensada cuando llega a vender todo lo cosechado, es por esta razón que desea adquirir más terrenos y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita por que sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima temporada de siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. He learned to farm when he was a boy and now raises mainly potatoes and corn. His wife and children help him and periodically check the crops to make sure that they are free of insects and disease. When the requirement for labor increases, he hires additional field hands. He tells us that he enjoys working in the fields very much, because he does it independently and with no pressure. Even though it’s hard work, it’s rewarded when he sells his harvest. This is why he wants to acquire more land and increase his number of animals. This will be his first loan through MFP and he’s very happy to know that he has financial backing. He is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible. He appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer for his next potato planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Intizorhon's Group

texts.en:
Intizorhon M. is the leader of this group loan. She is 31 and married with two sons and two daughters. The sons attend school and the daughters are not yet old enough. Her husband works in a factory and earns 8000 KGS per month. Intizorhon raises poultry and seeks a loan to purchase more chickens and turkeys for breeding.  In the future she plans to build a shed and start repairing the house.

Sanabarhan B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 32 and married with two sons and two daughters.  Her husband works in construction. Sanabarhan breeds farm animals, reselling some animals after fattening, and she earns 2000 KGS per month.  The loan will enable her to purchase some farm animals for breeding and to purchase building materials to start repairing the house.

Talantbek G., age 26, is married. His wife is a teacher at university. Talantbek is building a house for his family and applied for a loan to purchase cement for building the house.

Nargizahon M., age 26, is married. Her husband works in construction and she breeds poultry, earning 900 KGS per month selling eggs and chickens.  She will use the loan to purchase more chickens for breeding.  In the future she plans to start repairing the house.

About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society)
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly)
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously)
MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: The Reincarnates (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Renacientes  está formado por un grupo de 7 mujeres, son amigas y  muy buenas compañeras, trabajan en diferentes actividades  y  con un mismo fin de ayudar a la economía de sus hogares para así salir adelante y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está ubicada al  sur de Ecuador, es capital de la provincia del Azuay y está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

La Señorita Mayra S. vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de juguetes actividad que empezó hace 2 meses y tiene confianza de que le va ir muy bien, vende en una escuelita de la ciudad. También hace 7 meses cuentan con un puesto de comida en la parroquia de Ricaurte, donde vende una variedad de platos. 
La Señorita Mayra es muy joven, tiene 18 años, es soltera y tiene  una bebe de 4 meses de edad. Vive  con sus padres quienes son un gran apoyo para ella, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en su hija ya que necesita ropa.
 
Sus metas son  retomar sus estudios del colegio ya que los abandono cuando estaba en quinto curso y también desea superarse para entregarle a su hija un mejor futuro.

La Señorita. Lorena L. vive en la parroquia de Narancay Alto en la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia tiene de 26 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años y 3 meses de edad. Vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señorita. Lorena  trabaja hace 7 meses en un camal de pollos en donde los pela, los lava etc., labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta que termine con su trabajo y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a su hijo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y vitaminas para su hijo.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Reincarnates" is a group of 7 women. They are friends and very close colleagues. They each have different businesses but they have one goal in common, to contribute to their family's finances, to keep on progressing and to provide a better future for their families. They live in various locations throughout the city of Cuenca. The city is located near Cordillera along the equator. In 1999 Unesco named the city a World Heritage site. Mayra Simbana lives in the district of Miraflores in Cuenca. It is the second loan she requests. This member sells toys, a business she started two months ago but she is very confident of its success. She sells in a small school in the neighborhood. Seven months ago she also set up a food stand in the Ricuarte district, offering a variety of foods to her clients. Mayra is a very young woman. She is 18 years old, she is single and she has a 4-month old baby girl. She lives with her parents and they are a source of great support for her. They rent the place where they are living. The loan will be used to buy some clothes for her baby. Her goal is to go back to school. She stopped going when she was in her fifth semester but she wants to improve herself, to provide her daughter with a better future. Miss Lorena L. lives in the Narancay Alto district in the city of Cuenca. This is the third loan she requests. She is 26 years old, she is single and she has a 3 year old son. She lives with her parents and she contributes to the household economy. They rent the space where they live. Lorena has worked in a chicken farm for the past 7 months. There, she processes the chickens, plucking their feathers, washing etc. She works from 7 in the morning until she has completed the work she was assigned. The rest of the time she dedicates to caring for her son. The funds will be invested in the purchase of clothing and vitamins for her son. Her goal is to have her own home one day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and vitamins.

loans.name: Sanayelen Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANAYELEN sont  quatre femmes  toutes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers en générale tels la vente de tubercules avec  ROKIATOU D., les condiments alimentaires, les habits, du charbon de bois etc.
ROKIATOU D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 chargements de charrette en tubercules (ignames, patate douce, pomme de terre, manioc)
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  dans les villages voisins. Les tubercules sont  vendus en famille et au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sanayelen group are four women who are all married, average 35 years of age and have on average five children each. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their second loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. This group of women sell a variety of general products, such as tubers (this is the case for Rokiatou D.), condiments, clothing, firewood etc.

With her loan Rokiatou D. is planning on buying three barrow loads of tubers (yams, sweet potatoes, ordinary potatoes, cassava). She gets her supplies at the large market and in neighboring villages. She sells the tubers within the family and at the market, on a retail basis for cash and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 65,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase tubers

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat dreams of having his eighteen year old daughter graduate from university.  She attends university in the capital city of Armenia, Yerevan.  Ararat lives in the village of Panick in the Shirak region of Armenia with his wife and three sons. Ararat is a graduate of medical college and is proud of his education.

Due to difficult economic conditions, he has been self-employed as a farmer for the past twenty years. In order to support his daughter, Ararat is looking for a loan to expand his cattle breeding business. With the purchase of additional livestock, he is expecting his family's income to increase by around twenty percent. As a life long resident of Panick, Ararat lives near his extended family and all are involved in the agriculture sector.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel M. Q. tiene 54 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Segundo pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Segundo Manuel M. Q., 54, is married and living with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda, Bolivar province.  He has 5 children.  Segundo belongs to Ventanilla Guantucoto, located a half-hour from the Guaranda area.  Ventanilla, a group that makes its living in agriculture and livestock, in particular planting corn and potatoes in the mountain area and rice in the coastal area, has 25 members.  Segundo has made his living in agriculture for a number of years, planting corn and potatoes, breeding and raising animals for sale as well.  He purchases them in Guaranda and sells them in the main market in the same city.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies to plant corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him to supply the economic necessities of his family.  They encounter challenges such as pests and diseases in the crops.  His dream is to purchase a car and a house.  He loves to participate in sports.

loans.use: Supplies for planting

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es:
Mari Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca,  provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02  hijos. La señora tiene estudios de educación superior.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en los productos de su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de cosméticos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y compartir experiencias.
texts.en:
Mari Luz is a member of the “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román district, in Puno department.  She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She completed her higher education.

Mari Luz has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 1 year.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling beauty products.

She is requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles to invest in products for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a cosmetics store.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the sharing of experiences.

loans.use: To invest in products for her business

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.en:
Guisselle M. L. is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in Caballo Blanco, Cartago, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Guisselle has a business producing handmade woven garments including sweaters, toques, gloves, scarves, socks, etc. She also offers decorating services for special events such as birthdays, communions, and work parties. Her main source of revenue is her garment business, but she involves herself with both activities in order to maintain a steady stream of income. Guisselle has been working in this capacity for the past eight years.  Her revenue generating activities have helped her to provide for her children.

This will be Guisselle's first loan with Fundación Mujer. Guisselle decided to apply for a loan after completing a capacity building course in business administration at the Foundation.  With this loan, Guisselle plans to make investments in both of her productive activities. Specifically, she plans to buy different colors of high quality wool and make repairs to her weaving machine by replacing the cones.  She also plans to use the loan to purchase balloons and party decorations. Currently Guiselle has pending orders in both of her activities.  She lacks sufficient working capital in order to make investments, which would enable her to satisfy the demands of her clients. This loan will help to address this obstacle. 

With two children and a home to take care of, Guisselle is busy most days until 3 PM. She dedicates the hours between 3 and 6 to weaving. If necessary, she will weave after dinner until 11 PM.  When she provides party decoration services, her husband assists her.  Guisselle´s long-term goal is to fulfill her business plan, which includes generating sufficient revenues from her productive activities in order to open a weaving workshop and a gift shop. As mentioned, the main factor inhibiting the growth of her business is a lack of access to working capital. Guisselle plans to use this loan to make bulk purchases of quality raw materials, which will ensure a better price from her suppliers and lower her overall costs of production.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and party decorations and to repair equipment

loans.name: Fredrick Mutunga

texts.en:
Fredrick, age 36, is married to Annastacia and together they have five children who are all in school. He runs a small hotel / food stall in Kiwani, Emali town. Most of his customers are average income earners from the surrounding areas. He has been running this business for 14 years and his income has been good thus far.

Fredrick was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Emali office. This is his third loan from KADET and he intends to use it to buy a better cooking stove and add more kitchenware and foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and rice to sell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business so that he is able to give his children better education and a good life.

loans.use: To buy a cooking stove, kitchenware and foodstuffs for a food stall

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa C. R. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, del municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la educación básica. Su crédito lo va a utilizar para incrementar el inventario de su negocio, ella Inició su negocio hace dos años en la casa donde vive su hermana hay una cancha de fut-bol en la  colonia Abelardo y los jugadores llegaban a preguntar si vendía agua o refrescos, Entonces decidió poner un puesto con una inversión pequeña, comenzó a vender agua y refrescos, El espacio que ocupa actualmente se lo prestó su hermana esta  a un lado del campo de fut-bol de la colonia Abelardo, abre los días sábado y domingo y a veces sus sobrinos le ayuda a atender el negocio entre semana
Antes de dedicares a la venta de abarrotes vendió zapatos por catalogo pero esta actividad no le gusto porque tenía que caminar mucho, y en su negocio esta más descansada, ella va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, botellas de agua, botanas, jugos y dulces que es lo que más vende. Para trasladarse a  su negocio ella se hace 10 min. En transporte público. Considera muy importante su negocio pues de su trabajo obtiene las ganancias suficientes para su manutención además le da gran satisfacción ser la administradora de su propio negocio, además de que a través de su negocio conoce a mucha gente y todos la tratan con respeto. En su negocio atiende principalmente a los jugadores y sus familias, a los aficionados que van a presenciar los partidos. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta en su negocio es la creciente competencia lo que ha hecho que disminuyan sus ventas. Las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para invertir en más producto para su negocio, además de pagar los servicios de su negocio y su hogar. Dentro de sus planes esta comprar productos diferentes  a los que vende para tener más variedad en su negocio. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta establecer en forma s u negocio como una tienda de abarrotes e incrementar el número de clientes.
La señora Tomasa es casada, su esposo es albañil, tiene 3 hijas: Rubí de 17 años, Yesica de 22 años y Jazmín de 20 años, como sus dos hijas están casadas y se dedican al hogar no le pueden ayudar en su negocio y su hija más chica estudia. A veces le  ayuda su sobrino a despachar entre semana  y el sábado y domingo ella atiende personalmente a la clientela. Moyotepec es un pueblo tranquilo, hay campo. La señora Tomasa quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradezco que pueden ayudarnos con este préstamo para mejorar los negocios”
texts.en:
Tomasa C. R. lives in the Moyotepec community in the city of Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 42 years old, and she has an elementary school education.  She will use the loan to increase the inventory in her business.  She started her business two years ago in her sister’s house.  There is a soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood, and the players asked if she sold water or soft drinks.  

She then decided to make a small investment to establish a stand, and she started to sell water and soft drinks.  Her sister lent her the space that she currently uses.  It is on the side of the soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood.  She opens it on Saturdays and Sundays.  Sometimes her sister’s children help her take care of the business during the week. 

 Before she sold food she sold shoes by catalog.  She did not like this business activity very much because she had to walk a lot, and in her new business she is not as tired.  She is going to use the loan to buy soft drinks, bottles of water, snacks, juice, and sweets.  She sells these the most.  It takes her ten minutes using public transportation to get to her business.

She feels that her business is very important because her work gives her enough income for her living expenses.  In addition, it gives her great satisfaction to run her own business.  Also, through her business she knows a lot of people, and they all treat her respectfully.

In her business she primarily waits on the players, their families, and the fans that go to the games.  One of the challenges that her business faces is the growing competition, which has caused her sales to drop.  She uses the income from her business to invest in more products for her business.  She also pays for the utilities at her business and her home.

She plans to buy different products than the ones she sells in order to have more variety in her business.  Her future plans are to set up her business like a grocery store and to increase the number of customers she has.

Tomasa is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  They have three daughters.  Rubí is 17 years old, Yesica is 22 years old, and Jazmín is 20 years old.  As two of her daughters are married, they keep house and are not able to help in her business.  Her youngest daughter goes to school.  Sometimes her nephew helps her take care of the business during the week.  On Saturday and Sunday she personally takes care of the customers.  

Moyotepec is a peaceful village with fields.

Tomasa wants to say thanks to Kiva and to the Fundación Realidad, “I am grateful to those who are able to help us improve our businesses with this loan.”

loans.use: To buy soft drinks like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Jarrito, Squirt, Mirinda, and bottles of  purified water and sweets

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene  40 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria cercana a su casa donde especialmente atiende en tiempo de recreo y salida. En época de vacaciones aprovecha las temporadas de clases vacacionales que dan en diversos centros educativos de su localidad, de esa manera tiene más ventas. Reparte adecuadamente su tiempo en las labores de su casa y la atención de su negocio  que  cada día  realiza,  valiéndose  de su pequeña carreta donde traslada sus dulces de su casa a la escuela. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las ventajas de su negocio, por lo que se ha decidido en mejorar su establecimiento con mayor cantidad  de golosinas. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para mejorar su triciclo y adquirir más mercadería.
texts.en:
Obdulia, 40, lives with her husband and four children in her own house.  For the last three years she has been selling candy and snacks at the entrance of an elementary school near her house, especially during recess and when school lets out.  During school vacation periods she takes advantage of vacation classes carried out at various local schools in order to have more sales.  She divides her time well between her household chores and tending to her business every day for which she relies on a small cart to transport the candy from home to school.  During her time at work she has noticed the advantages her business has so she has decided to improve her establishment with a larger quantity of snacks.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial help.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are people she knows who are responsible and very mutually supportive.

She thanks the people who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to improve her tricycle and to acquire more merchandise.

loans.use: To improve her tricycle and stock up on snacks.

loans.name: Andy Margot

texts.es:
Andy Margot, tiene 20 años, es conviviente y vive con su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno.  Los cría en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio, y los engorda con alimento balanceado, cuando estos ya están en un grado de desarrollo adecuado los vende a sus vecinos y negociantes que visitan la zona.  Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia.

Andy Margot desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado.  Esto le permitirá alimentarlos mejor, para venderlos posteriormente e incrementar sus ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Andy Margot is 20 years old, married common-law, and she lives together with her family in the district of Tambogrande of the Piura region. It is located more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

She is a cattle farmer. She raises her cattle in corrals located near her home, feeding them balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in development she sells them to her neighbors and to merchants who visit the region. She is able to support her family through this business. 

Andy Margot wants to buy more balanced feed for her cattle. She will be able to feed them in a better way and she will earn a better profit when she sells them. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar's husband owns a furniture making workshop. He started producing sitting room, dining room and kitchen furniture five years ago. He wants to expand the business and start producing and selling bedroom furniture.

Entesar took out a loan to help her husband prepare the section by buying needed machines and preparing a space in the workshop to exhibit the furniture.

Entesar has two sons and one daughter. Entesar's husband appears in the photo as she refused to be photographed for religious reasons.

loans.use: To set up a section in the workshop to produce bedroom furniture

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La  señora  Olivia  tiene  un  negocio  de   venta  de   baterías, en este  momento  ella   desea  comprar  baterías  para  maquinaria  pesada  ya  que  por  el  momento   solo   vende  este  producto para carros  y  camionetas,      solicita  este   crédito   ya que  representa  una   manera  en la  que   puede   generar  mayores ingresos  además  de atraer    a  un gran   numero de clientes   ya  que   este  producto  es   muy  demandado  en  su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Olivia has a business selling batteries. At the moment, she only sells batteries for cars and trucks, but she also wants to sell batteries for heavy machinery.

She is requesting this loan because it will help her generate more income and attract a large number of customers since her business experiences high demand for these products.

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of batteries to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school. Ama fries fish and shrimp at Abura near Frami for sale. Her income is used to assist her husband in taking care of the home.  Ama will use the loan to buy fresh fish and shrimp to fry for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaingful education for her children.

In this photograph, she is demonstrating how she fries the fish.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and shrimp to fry for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 64 años, es una mujer servicial y atenta. Es divorciada, tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con una de sus hijas y su yerno. Desde hace 17 años, se dedica a su negocio en su casa, en la venta de productos perecibles y dulces en general. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, porque se mantiene muy ocupada y entretenida, de esa manera olvida de la enfermedad que padece, que es la diabetes. Pero a pesar de no tener presupuesto se las ingenia y compra sólo por docenas los productos que vende, de ese modo logra proveerse de mayor diversidad de productos para su tienda, cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Es por eso que desea abastecerse de más mercadería y, con el tiempo piensa modificar las rejas de su tienda, para ganar mayor espacio en su local, así podrá vender otros productos como útiles escolares y luego ofrecer el servicio de fotocopias por lo que planea comprarse una fotocopiadora y trabajar en sociedad con su hija. Es su 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y como líder de su grupo, agradece a todos ustedes por los reiterados apoyos que recibió y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará los productos perecibles que le hacen falta, para tener siempre atractiva su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 64 years old. She is a helpful and attentive woman. She is divorced with three children, but she only lives with one of her daughters and her son-in-law. 

For the last 17 years she has been dedicated to her store, which she runs from home. She sells perishable goods and all sorts of sweets. She loves her business because it keeps her very busy and entertained and takes her mind off diabetes, an illness she suffers from. Despite having no budget, she manages to buy the goods she sells by the dozen,  so that she can have a great variety of products in her store, which is what her clients demand. That's why she'd like to stock more products for her shop. Eventually she also plans to modify the window bars in her store to increase the space available in her premises so as to be able to sell other products such as school supplies and provide a photocopying service. She is planning to purchase a photocopier and work in partnership with her daughter. 

This is her 16th loan with MFP. As leader of her group, she would like to thank everyone for the support repeatedly received and is committed to repaying back her loan. If she obtains the loan requested she will buy the perishable goods she needs to keep her business running.

loans.use: to buy perishable products.

loans.name: María Belen

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 24  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es electromecánico, además tiene una volqueta en la que transporta material pétreo.
 
Tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende repuestos y refacciones eléctricas para carro, ella también le vende a la gente que llevan sus vehículos para que su esposo les haga algún arreglo. Trabaja de lunes  a sábado. Los productos compra a distribuidores que llegan hasta su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio seis años y le gusta porque le permite ganarse la vida sin tener que salir de su casa y estar al tanto de sus hijos que requieren de sus cuidados.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos eléctricos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque  en el banco a conocido personas que ahora son sus grandes amigas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local más grande y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers make, which are recognized throughout the entire country.  The people there are very warm, kind, and hard-working.

This is the place where we meet María, age 24.  She has two children, ages six and five, and they go to school.  Her husband is an electromechanical technician.  Also, they have a dump truck that they use for transporting rocks.

She has a place in her house where she sells replacement parts and spare parts for cars.  She also sells to people who bring their vehicles to her husband to be fixed.  She works from Mondays through Saturdays.  She buys her products from distributors who come to her place.  She tells us that she has been in her business for six years.  She likes it because it allows her to earn a living without having to leave her house.  This way she can keep up with her children; they need her care.

This loan is to buy electrical replacement parts.  She has been in her communal bank during four cycles.  She likes it because she has gotten to know people in her bank that are now her best friends.

Her dreams are to have a larger place and to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy electrical replacement parts

loans.name: Lucia De Jesus

texts.es:
Lucia, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tamales, quesadilla, conserva y también la agricultura, ella vive en compañía de su esposo y tres hijos, aprendió ayudando a otras personas comerciantes y tiene 12 años de estar dedicada a esta actividad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el pago de alquiler del terreno para cultivar, también comprar abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo le ayudara a tener en buenas condiciones el terreno alquilado para iniciar la siembra.
Ella espera que su producción aumente, y poder proveer para sus hijos los ingresos necesarios y que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She sells tamales, quesadillas and canned goods.  She also farms.  She lives with her husband and three children.  She learned by helping other salespeople and has twelve years experience in this business.

Lucia is currently requesting a loan to pay the rent on her plot of land so that she can grow crops.  She will also buy manure and fertilizers.  This loan will help her to have her rented land in good condition so that she can start sowing.

Lucia hopes that her production will increase.  She hopes that she will be able to provide her children with the income they need and that they will be able to improve themselves.

loans.use: to pay rent on her plot of land so that she can grow crops, and to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: G.s. Bendicion Y Gloria Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Bendición Y Gloria está conformado por Maria Alejandra y Mirna Del Pilar. Maria Alejandra se dedica a la venta de ropa, es una persona muy inteligente ya que siempre está demostrando interés con sus clientes de lo que ellos le solicitan. Ella sabe que tiene que salir a vender todos los días para brindarles el pan de cada día a sus dos hijos que están a su cargo. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: The 'Bendición y Gloria' (Blessing and Glory) community bank is made up of María Alejandra and Mirna Del Pilar.  María Alejandra sells clothes.  She is a very intelligent person as she always shows interest in her customers and what they are requesting.  She knows that she must go out and sell her products every day in order to provide for her two children who are in her care.  She will use this loan to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and other products.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 29 years old. He is married, but has no children. He takes care of 3 relatives. Alfred has owned a spare parts business for three years. His business is well-organized and is open daily from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. He currently employs one person to help him.

Alfred has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more spare parts to sell. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Saresouna Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 12 Juillet 2008. Il compte 40 femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Moumini(debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée, elle prend en charge 11 membres de sa famille. 

Elle vend des condiments du sucre et du thé, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de deux ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner thé et sucre pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’acheter des d la revente et divers marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en: This group was created on July 12, 2008. It comprises 40 women who all live in the same town. They all have small-scale businesses. Moumini (standing second from the right toward the left) is the group’s official. She is 39 years old and married, plus she has eleven family members to support. Moumini sells condiments, sugar, and tea. This is a business she has been operating for two years. Her new loan will enable her to stock up on tea and sugar to be sold. The profits from this business will allow her to purchase resale items and various merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to buy tea and sugar

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Iris has a retail shop that sells snacks, candies & biscuits. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages & snacks to sell.

Iris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Ykua Vera Group

texts.es:
La formación de este comité fue gracias a la señora Antolina de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Ykua Vera, están en el Noveno Ciclo con 14 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor.
La Sra. Ramona se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, con lo cual puede mantener a toda su familia. Ella ha conseguido salir adelante por medio de este trabajo que ella considera muy digno. Lucha de forma incansable para poder tener un mejor porvenir.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas cosméticos, con lo cual podrá adquirir mayor variedad. Esta segura que obteniendo mayor variedad podrá conseguir mas clientes.
texts.en:
The formation of this committee was a result of the work of Sra. Antolina, who is from Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends so that they could start this local committee, which is named “Ykua Vera”. They are in their ninth loan cycle with 14 members. The group is very close, supportive, and responsible. All of the members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit.

Sra. Ramona sells cosmetics so that she can support her entire family. She is able to stay ahead as a result of her work, which she considers to be very dignified. Ramona strives tirelessly to have a better future. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more cosmetics so that she can have greater variety. By having a better variety, Ramona is confident that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, 31, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. He is a provider of motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. Eric has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for utilities.

Eric is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities.

loans.name: Djekafo Vi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO VI est constitué de dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, MINATA  deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The DJEKAFO VI group is made up of married women. They are on a average 44 years old and have an average of 6 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they grow are, among others, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With the loan, Minata, 2nd from the right, standing, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing costs in order to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women.

The group members expect to make an average profit of 15,000 CFA francs each season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, and small equipment

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en:
Anna Mary lives in Uganda, is married and has six children, none of whom are in school. She owns a home that has electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food for the family.

For the past ten years Anna Mary has sold charcoal, working seven days a week. She sells her charcoal at wholesale prices from her home. She also generates additional income by renting rooms.

Anna Mary has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for her include transportation and seasonality.

Anna Mary’s goals and aspirations for her charcoal business are to own a delivery van and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr: Madame Gnima est une femme mariée  de 49 ans qui habite au Sénégal.  Elle s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de miel, de sacs, de chaussures et de boubous traditionnels.  Elle a choisi cette activité dans le souci de pouvoir se prendre en charge et subvenir a ses propres besoins personnels. Elle est sociétaire  de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2000. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’approvisionnement en miel. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité d’achat, de développer son activité de commerce et d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux faire face a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Ms. Gnima is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been active for ten years in the commerce of honey, bags, shoes, and traditional boubous (long flowing clothing). She chose this business out of concern for supporting herself and meeting personal needs. She has been an associate of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since March 2000. She has already repaid seven previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for stocking up on honey. This financing will enable her to increase her purchasing power, to develop her business, and to grow her profits, so as to do better coping with her needs.

loans.use: to buy honey to resell

loans.name: Marymagdaline

texts.en:
Marymagdaline is a hard-working businesswoman who is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. 

For the last five years, she has been growing spinach, tomatoes and kale to bring up her family. She also sells charcoal and paraffin to earn extra income.

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal is 53 years old and has one son, age 28. She lives with her family in the outer Ger district, a district without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has run an auto repair service business for the past few years because the Mongolian aftermarket is very popular.  

She initially rented a small container, which is located at the largest local auto market in Mongolia, with her son operating the business. Nasanjargal purchased her products & auto supplies from other wholesale suppliers and sometimes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 
   
Then her family decided to own this container, bought using their working capital, so they don’t have enough money to purchase necessary products needed by their customers. For this reason Nasanjargal is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase products and improve her business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase products and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 41 years old and his wife Somnang is 42 years old (pictured together), have been married since 1991 and have five children-four sons and one daughter. The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeurn wants buy cows to raise. When the cows give birth, she will be able to get income from selling the calves or when the cows grow to full size, or she will be able to sell the cows for beef. 

Hence Saroeurn is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Jasho Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Jasho SHG Group in Western Kenya! Jackline is the facilitator of the Jasho SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackline takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits, to send her children to school, and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackline had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children and use the same to repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Jasho SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Jackline is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ghiwa

texts.en:
Ghiwa is a 29-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and lives with her husband. She has been selling hand made products, such as wooden sculptures and leather bags, for the past four years. Her business is based at her home.

Ghiwa has had a Kiva-funded loan before, and was a very good client who repaid her loan promptly.  She plans to use this $1,000 from Kiva field partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of new items to sell such as bags, statuettes, carvings etc… . In the future, she plans to open her own retail shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new items to sell such as bags, statuettes, carvings etc…

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 39-year-old married woman with two children (one son and one daughter). She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nhung runs a general store from her house. She began this business five years ago. Her husband also supports the family by working as a mechanic.

Nhung is requesting a loan to buy a greater range and quantity of products, such as basic foods, snacks and beverages to sell from her general store. 

She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater range and quantity of products, such as basic foods, snacks and beverages to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Daajinsuren

texts.en:
Daajinsuren is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia.  Her elder daughter is a college student and the younger one is a school student. 

She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Her garments are very fashionable and cheap. Now that her business is stable enough, she rented another counter in the same market. However, she lacks resources to run a whole counter. 

Daajinsuren is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It's been hard since my husband died. However, my elder daughter made it to college this year. Therefore I can't give up." 

She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  ”SIRENACHAYOC”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jose;  El socio tiene 57 años de edad, El socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 2 hijos de 23, 20 años de edad; El socio tiene su propia empresa, el socio produce maquinas selladoras eléctricas de bolsas plásticas, el socio inicio su empresa con una sola maquina y empezó a ver todo el manejo y la fabricación de la maquina y el hizo un par de maquinas en casa le fue muy bien el negocio por años y ahora el socio a perfeccionado sus maquinarias, ahora el socio fabrica con mejor tecnología y las pinta y tiene ya sus mesitas para apoyar y vienen mejoradas, el socio desea a futuro seguir creciendo y empezar a exportar fuera de Cusco sus maquinarias. El socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de pinturas de metal para pintar el grupo de maquinas que ya tiene hechas y que fueron hechas a pedido de varios clientes.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Jose belongs to the “Sirenachayoc” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Jose is 57 years old.  He has a live-in partner and 2 children, ages 23 and 20.  He has his own business that produces electric machines which vacuum-seal plastic bags.  He started his business with only one machine, and by observing how the machine was manufactured and how it operated he was able to build a couple of machines in his home.  His business has been going well for years, and he has perfected his machinery.  Jose now produces his machines with better technology and paint, and he has worktables to help with future improvements.  He wants to continue growing and to begin exporting his machines outside of Cusco.  

At this time Jose wants to invest the loan in the purchase of metal paints so that he can paint a group of machines that he has already built, which were made at the request of several customers.             

Jose is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in accordance with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase metal paints.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Cosmos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERAL DE COSMOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nanddy es secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Confección de mantas, venta de frutas, fotocopiadora, trenzado de matas, tejido de mantas a máquina, albañilería.

La señora Nanddy,  indica que hace cinco meses trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de mantas que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que comprara de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y el buen humor.

En la fotografìa acompaña la hermana de la señora Esperanza, ella se encuentra vestida con un chaleco rojo sentada
texts.en:
The Esmeral de Cosmos Communal Bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Regional Hub.  It is made up of six members and it is led by a board of directors in which Nanddy is the secretary.  The members of the communal bank work in different fields, such as knitting blankets, selling fruit, making photocopies, weaving blankets, machine-sewing blankets, and building.

Nanddy tells us she has been with Pro Mujer for five months now and that she joined the institution after being invited by a friend.  She currently has a business weaving blankets that she has had for years.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase her capital to buy wool at the July 16th Fair that commemorates the founding of La Paz.  After making her blankets she will sell them as they are ordered.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that she likes the attention and the positive atmosphere.

In the photograph, provided by Esperanza's sister, she is seated, wearing a red vest.

loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: San Isidro Unido Group

texts.es:
