El comité  “San Isidro Unidos'', se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros que oyó hablar acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación e inspirada en la idea de un bien para sus compañeras las invitó. Y actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación.
Graciela es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora. Cuenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo y pedidos, ella se dedica a la carpintería y cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo necesario para el día a día.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de maderas, clavos y terciadas, para utilizar en su taller, ya que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The communal bank “San Isidro Unidos'' was formed at the initiative of one of the members who heard about the Fundacion's Enterprising Women Program.  She was inspired by the idea that this would be good for her friends, and so she invited them to join.  Now this group is in its first loan cycle, and they are learning the importance of working as a team, within a group that is responsible, honest and communicative.

Graciela is one of the members of this group; she is a very hardworking and self-sacrificing woman.  She tells us that she always has a lot of work and orders.  She is a carpenter and thanks to her work, she has been able to support her family and provide for their daily needs.

Graciela requests the help of the Fundacion and Kiva so that she can buy wood, nails and plywood to use in her workshop, since she has orders that she would like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, nails and other supplies

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Don José Angel de 46 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos una casada y los otros pequeños estudiantes por quienes el trabaja en conjunto con su pareja para poyarlos con su educación y puedan culminar una carrera universitaria. Solicita nuevamente crédito para poder comprar bloques, hierro, cemento, arena, zinc, clavos,perlines para nivelar el techo de su casa con el muro del porche, así cada vez está progresando la infraestructura de su casa, ya que cada préstamo los utiliza en realizar mejoras en su vivienda.

loans.use: Para comprar bloques, hierro, cemento, arena, zinc, clavos, perlines.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en: Dilshod is 37 years old. He is an entrepreneur. Dilshod feeds and sells cattle. Dilshod feeds mainly cows. He began this business 12 years ago. Dilshod little by little with passing of the time developed his business. Dilshod’s wife helps him with feeding of cattle. He always tries for well being of his family. He is going to make a plaster of walls. Now, he has not opportunity. He is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy cement, soil and etc. He awaits your support. This loan will help him to improve living condition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement, soil and etc. for repairing house

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad se dedica a la profesión de radiotécnico desde hace 5 años, tiene su taller ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad de su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia  con su esposa, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de variedad de repuestos y herramientas para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi satisfacer a sus clientes y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 45 years old and has worked in the electronics field for five years.  His workshop is located in his home and he has many customers because of the quality of his work.  With his earnings, he is able to get ahead with the household expenses.  He lives in his own home with his wife.  He is requesting another loan to buy various parts and tools to keep doing his work and thereby satisfy his customers and make more income.

loans.use: to buy various parts and tools

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is 24 years old lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. Wesam is ambitious man and example of nosy person, he ‎likes to know and understand everything to help him recognize the requirement of dealing with people or to know the ‎community requirements. He is studying genetic engineering; Wesam believed that his major will help him to know about ‎the secrets of the genetic. His family is facing financial difficulties; therefore he requested an education loan to cover his ‎semester fees, and achieve his goals.‎

loans.use: to cover his ‎semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tomato farming business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is mother of 5 children and 32 years old. She supports her husband in the upkeep of the family by selling cooked rice and stew in front of the family house.

Vida has had no formal education and therefore views the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions as a great opportunity to improve her lot. She thinks that it is a window of great hope and would like to access the KIVA loan to change the environment in which she operates.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 41 years old, and her husband is 46 years old. They have 5 children between the ages of 19 and 2. They have 5000 square meters of growing rice land but the land is very poor and they have no capital to buy fertilizer so productivity is low. Mrs. Thanh's first son works as a daily laborer although he was admitted into a university. Her second, third and four children are going to school.

Mrs. Thanh makes incense at her house and sells it at the local market. She also tends to her land. She does not have enough capital to buy larger quantities of material and pay cash, so she is soliciting a loan of $50. She would like to use the loan to buy cheaper fertilizer in large quantities to help her increase he yield on her rice farm.

Her average income is low, at about $7/person/month. Mrs. Thanh's loan will be used to buy fertilizer, and also to purchase materials to make more incense for her side business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Born in 1952, L. Monica is married to a polygamist and is a mother of nine children. Her difficulties in her life time stemmed from the fact that her husband showed more interest to her maids and had little commitment towards her and her children concerning provision of basic needs. This led her to seek help and to become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all of her loans and has been able to raise money to pay school fees and apprentice fees for her children and to buy food for her family.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to cultivate rice, sell and raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees and to increase her business.

She plans to pay off her loan in 18 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, hire labour, transport

loans.name: Minara

texts.en: Minara is 47 years old and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She has her own orchard and started her business 10 years ago. She now needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Ato

texts.en: Ato A. is one of the new members at the borrowing centre that has just started in the village of Satapuala. She plans to open a BBQ business, which has become quite popular these days. Her loan will be utilized to purchase materials for a BBQ stove and to buy meat for her first attempt. She hopes to make some good money in order to repay this loan and to sustain the business. She further hopes to make use of this assistance again in the future should her business need some support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga came from a family of 8. She is 42 years of age, married with 4 children. Her husband has been a fisherman all his life and this was their only source of income. He used to fish one day a week, but the money they get from selling the 5 or 6 fish he managed to catch could not support them. Talosaga and her husband have always wanted to buy a canoe, but they didn’t have the money to do so. Talosaga heard SPBD was providing small loans to underprivileged women so she was very happy to join. With this loan, they want to use it to buy items they have longed for.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net, fishing spear, fishing rods, and other supplies

loans.name: Sarminah

texts.en: Sarminah, 42, and her husband, S., sell jack fruits everyday. They earn $50 a month. Sarminah requests a loan of $150 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maarifa D Group

texts.en:
Seleman C., age 42, is married with four children ages 17, 11, 6 and 2. He has a one year old fish business that makes a monthly profit of about $22.

In the past, Seleman took out four loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business. He now hopes for a new loan to continue increasing his capital. He will share this loan with his sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling chacoal, shop, clothes and table tops.

In the picture, Seleman is first from the left.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Hammat

texts.en:
Mr. Hammat Y. and his wife, Srifas Mat, have been married for nine years. They have four daughters, one of whom is in school and other three are still young and stay at home. Their house is along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Hammat and his wife have been fishing since they were young. They fish the from Mekong River and then sell the fish at the village market.

Mr. Hammat is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $300 to purchase fishing material for his business.

loans.use: For purchasing fishing materials

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is 39 years old and married, with 4 children. He sells cassava, sweet potatoes and vegetables such as eggplant to wholesalers from Freetown, who then resell the produce. Because he does not sell directly to the customers, Abdul earns very little profit. He would like to expand his business by purchasing and selling the foods directly to Freetown. He needs additional capital so that he can bypass the middleman and go directly to the market in Freetown himself. He is requesting a loan of approximately $350 US for this purpose.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián sells women’s clothing and seasonal household items with his wife, and he has a young son. His home is located in the Sopocachi area of La Paz, and the home belongs to his grandparents.

This is the fourth time that he has asked for a loan through Impro; it will be used to buy merchandise (women’s clothing and some household items). Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fabián trabaja comercializando ropa de mujer y enseres para el hogar con su esposa de acuerdo a la temporada, tiene un hijo pequeño. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona bajo Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, la casa pertenece a sus abuelos.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; el monto solicitado será destinado para compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer, y algunos enseres para el hogar). Debido a la rentabilidad de su negocio, la determinación de este micro empresario y su experiencia en el comercio, el cliente es apto para acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing and household items for his business

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Thắm, 38 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1999. Prior to joining the Fund, she and her husband sold small items at the open market. Their income was very modest. Right after joining the Fund she used the funds from the loans to broaden their business. They buy more goods at the wholesale price then resell to the market stands. The income increases substantially to 100,000 VND a day in average. Their lives are better, their children’s education was provided more adequately. This time she is applying for a loan of 15,000,000 VND to invest more into their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Thắm năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị Thắm T. gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 1999. Khi mới T. gia vào Quỹ, chị Thắm cùng chồng làm nghề buôn nhỏ tại chợ. Vì vốn làm ăn nhỏ nên thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng không được nhiều. Sau khi T. gia vào Quỹ, chị đã bàn với chồng vay thêm vốn để đầu tư, mở rộng kinh doanh. Với các vòng vốn tăng dần gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua hàng về bán buôn cho các cửa hàng trong chợ trung tâm huyện nơi chị đang sinh sống. Vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng lên rõ rệt. Hiện nay thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán của gia đình chị đạt trên 100.000đ/ ngày. Nhờ công việc làm ăn buôn bán thuận lợi, thu nhập ổn định, hai con của chị đều được ăn học đầy đủ, đời sống gia đình ngày càng tăng lên Vòng vốn này chị Thắm muốn vay 15 triệu để đầu tư thêm vốn vào việc buôn bán hoa quả bán lại cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ tại chợ.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Sumina T. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband and two children. Her husband  Raj Kumar T. is a farmer. Their son is studying for his BBS (Bachelor in Business Study) and  their daughter has  received her SLC (School leaving Certificate) this year. 
Sumina sells cow's milk in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She already owns two cows and she has been selling milk in that area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.
Sumina lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells milk door to door daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production so she seeks a $225 loan to purchase a young milk giving cow.

loans.use: To buy young milk giving cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Josephine sells children's clothes and fabric for making clothes, which she has done since 1998. She sells them from a basket that she keeps on her head as she walks from customer to customer. Her husband is currently unemployed.

Josephine uses her income to pay the electricity bill. She will use the loan to purchase more children's wear and fabric. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to buy materials for her tie-dye business.

loans.use: To purchase more children's wear and fabric for re-sale

loans.name: Mensah

texts.en: Mensah Y. is a single parent and has one child. She has never received schooling. Mensah sells food items like gari at Duakor, which is a small town near Elmina, which she has done since 1972. Mensah uses her income to help her husband in the payment of her children's school fees, feeding of the family and the payment of utility bills. Mensah will use the loan to purchase cassava, coconuts and other food to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mensah plans to invest in a building project she has started for herself and child.

loans.use: Mensah will use the loan to purchase cassava, coconuts and other foods to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 27 años, es madre sotera de un hijo que está estudiando y es sus ganas de seguir adelante.  Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), en su casa desde hace 2 años.  Para Anita lo más importante es seguir adelante, ya que su negocio de una u otra forma la hace sentir una persona útil, siempre se manifestó como una mujer activa, atiende durante todo el día, se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y ver sus ingresos diarios. Le va muy bien.  Trabaja para la educación de su hijo y solventar sus gastos diarios.  Con el dinero del préstamo implementará con más productos su negocio. Espera que podamos ayudarlo a cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Anita is 27 years old, a single mother of one son who is studying and who is her impetus for being successful. She has sold cold beverages (beer and soda pop) in her home for 2 years. For Anita the most important thing is getting ahead, as her business in one form or another makes her feel like a useful person. She is always an active woman, attentive to her business all day, she feels happy to have her own business. What she likes about her work is selling and seeing her daily earnings. Her business is going well. She works to pay her child’s education and daily expenses. With the loan she will buy more products for her business. She hopes that we can help her meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her beverage business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. sells drinks and beverages. She has been in this business for the past 2 years. Her store is located along Okhoro road in Benin City. This is a busy area in Benin City. She is the lady standing in the middle in the picture. She has 2 salesgirls who assist her with the sale of drinks.

Mercy hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N90,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah U. is a hair stylist. She also sells hair extensions and hair creams in her shop. She is 26 years old and married. she lives in Afro-Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions and  hair cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions  and hair cream to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her transportation company by purchasing more cars

loans.name: Michelle

texts.fr: Michelle  agée de 44 ans estune femme mariée  et mere de 4 enfants.Elle vit avec son marie et ses enfants .Pour gagner sa vie elle coud des vetements . Son atelier composé d'une seule machine à coudre est intallé dans la maison.Sa clientelle est essentiellement constituée par les voisins.
texts.en:
Michelle is 44 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children, and makes her living as a seamstress. Her workshop consists of one sewing machine in her home. Her clientele for the most part are her neighbors.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.en:
The Libertad (Freedom) Bank of Hope from San Pedro de Macoris is starting their first loan with Esperanza International. These 15 women are very enthusiastic to receive this opportunity and have great plans for their now small businesses.

Jeantilia J. is the coordinator for Group 1. She is married and has two grown children. She owns a colmado, which is a small food market where you can buy different types of groceries. She states that the products with more demand are rice, beans, oil, and canned goods, so she will use her loan money to purchase a quantity to cover her customers' demands. Rice and beans are part of the typical Dominican lunch fare. If it is under the family's financial possibilities, rice and beans are usually served with meat.

Other businesses that the group members have include clothing sales and fried food stands. Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Mary Miyaniko from Mwanza. She is married and has two children between the ages of 10 and 12. Mary has been running a tailoring business since 2006. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides), and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mary currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy vitambaa, vitenge, and kanga. In the future, she plans to add more material to make more clothing for sale. Mary thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make and sell traditional African clothing.

loans.name: Afoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle est mariée et 02 enfants, son mari est un enseignant à la retraite.  Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de bois de chauffe. Elle maîtrise parfaitement ce commerce parce qu’elle a commencé à l’exercer depuis 1993. Au Togo le bois de chauffe est très utilisé pour la préparation de la nourriture surtout les boissons locales. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays précisément à TCHEBEBE. Son stock de bois de chauffe étant épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit chez WAGES pour acheter des bois de chauffe
texts.en:
This is a lady who resides in the Aagoè Assiyéyé district in the north of the city of Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a retired teacher. She earns an income doing commerce in firewood. She has perfect mastery of her business because she has been in it since 1993. In Togo, firewood is used a lot for making food, especially local beverages. She supplies herself from the country's interior, in TCHEBEBE to be precise. Since her stock of firewood is exhausted, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell rice

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Mr. Hao K., 67, is a widower with six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of his children are married and live outside the family home, one son is a teacher, another son assists his father in farming, one daughter is a tailor and the other one is in school. The family lives along national road number one, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Hao has been a farmer for 39 years; he grows tomatoes on his farm near his village. He and his family members live in an old house. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. Ropa, abarrotes en general, cereales, golosinas, verduras, comidas y artesanías
	
Como es el caso D. Nelly que es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Nelly venD. abarrotes en general D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, además Nelly venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
	
Mientras que Susana es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Susana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Susana venD. comida los días lunes en la feria D. las Nazarenas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 6,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, lanas, tintes.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios para el sustento D. sus familias, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión ("New Illusion") Village Bank has 13 members and is currently beginning its third loan cycle. The group members have different businesses, and sell clothing, basic grocery items, grains, candy, vegetables, prepared meals and art. For example, Nelly is 34 years old and married with two children. She sells basic grocery items on foot in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells catalog cosmetics to friends and family members. Another group member, Susana, is 54 years old and married with six children. Susana runs a neighborhood grocery store from her home, which she opens seven days a week. She also sells prepared meals on Mondays at the Nazarenas market. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, such as 300, 600 or 900 soles. In total, the village bank is requesting a loan of 6,700 soles. Group members will use their loans to buy vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothing, wool and dyes. Some of the group members' dreams are to expand their businesses in order to better support their families, to proviD. their children with a good education, and to own their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothing, wool and dyes

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil K. has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work, an ethic which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells cattle and, in this manner, earns income for her family. Sevil does not have a lot of confidence in agricultural production, so she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She hopes to improve the rearing conditions of her young animals and in this way improve her living situation. For this reason she is seeking a loan of $1200. Sevil is married and has two sons who are her everything.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

loans.name: Unida En Accion Group

texts.en:
Esperanza G. is a budding entrepreneur who would like nothing more than to expand her business. Currently, she operates out of her house selling many things, such as women’s clothing, cooking equipment, and baked goods. Through Esperanza’s ambition she organized four other local women from the community into a group in order to approach Esperanza for a loan.

Esperanza is a single mother raising three children. She has two boys, aged thirteen and eight, and one 3 year old daughter. When talking to Esperanza, it was very clear that her family is the number one priority for her, and she would do anything to make sure they were happy. Currently, the two boys are in school and they are doing well, and she would love nothing more than for them to attend college in the future. The three year old daughter is a handful, but is always smiling.

Obtaining a loan is what Esperanza needs in order to expand her business. Along with the ability to expand her inventory, she would like to purchase a cart with which she could travel around her village to sell her goods. In order to sell now, she has to stay in her house, but with a cart it will open up a whole new market of potential customers. The opportunity for obtaining a loan is a very rare opportunity for these women, and all members of the group, not only Esperanza, stressed their intentions to work very hard in order to pay the loan back in the allotted time.

loans.use: clothing, kitchen equipment, and bakery products.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1818071379) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. M. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,600,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. M. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Gladys Esperanza

texts.es: Gladys Esperanza García P. tiene 47 años. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de prendas. Ella dio inicio a su actividad económica porque no tenía un salario para proporcionar a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y además le gusta mucho porque sus clientes siempre le solicitan nuevos productos para su actividad económica. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de oro, plata, oro laminado, líquidos para limpiar las prendas. Sus sueños son de seguir manteniendo su negocio para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Gladys Esperanza García P. is 47 years old. It has been more than 3 years since she dedicated herself to this business. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing. She began this activity because she didn’t have a salary to provide her family with the necessary income. She is a very happy woman, and also enjoys her business because her customers always request new products from her. The reason for requesting this financing is for working capital, to buy gold, silver, plated gold, clothing detergent. Her dream is to continue supporting her business so she can augment her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola buys bread from manufacturers and supplies to shops in her community, she has a vehicle for running this business and has been in the business for over seven years but started borrowing from LAPO two years ago. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more bread to sell. Ola is 39 years old and married with three lovely children who are in a private primary school. She says thank you and promises to repay at due time promptly as she has always done in time past.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Hakimullah Group

texts.en:
Hakimullah, who is the group leader of Hakimullah, is married and has seven children.  There are three members in the group, each one of them busy in different tasks; for instance, a retail shop, a full service shop and a P-C-O (Public Call Office), which provides support in communications to businesses and individuals, such as PCO phones. 

They want to become stronger in their businesses, so they are requesting a group loan. Each of the members needs 10000 Afghani to further their work, and will be good clients for KIVA and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company). With a group loan, the members help and support one another throughout the period of the loan. Hakimulla would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To stock their shops

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Arsenal group. They named their group after the name of their favorite European football club, Arsenal.  They are small scale businesswomen in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each for the very first time to enable them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they can make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve – they will be able to better support their school going children in terms of feeding, clothing and meeting schools expenses. 

Marie C. (left) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in a village about three miles from Magburaka town. She is now thirty-two years old. She is married to a motor-driver and they have three children. Two of Marie’s children are attending primary schools and the last is still sucking. Marie sells cigarettes, biscuits, cans of milk, candles, etc.  She has been a businesswoman for many years now. Marie wants to use this loan to buy cosmetics from Freetown and sells in Magburaka town.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica- 28 years of age, she is married to Mr. Melchor B., who is a driver, they are blessed with 2 children namely; Melvin- 8 years old, grade 2 in primary level, and Ma. Monica- 6 years of age, grade 1. They are presently residing at baranggay San Francisco, Alicia Isabela, a rural and plain area, approximately 4 kilometers away from the national highway.She manages a poultry business (cobb-raising) for almost 3 years, her net income is PHP 2,000.00 when she disposed after 15 days. She plans to avail a loan amount of PHP 4,000.00 for starting capital. She hopes that Kiva will grant her loan immediately. She's been blessed with productive business, because of that she is thankful to those people who support and helped her.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her poultry business

loans.name: Danya-E- Nor Group

texts.en:
Sayad Abdullwaily is the group leader of 'Danya-e-nor' group. There are five members in this group. They want to expand and progress their businesses. They are very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan.

Sayad Abdullwaily and Veyda want to take a loan for their businesses of carpet weaving. They want to improve their businesses. And Mastora and Sayad NorA. want to take a loan for their business of teaching computer programs. They want to buy new computers for their course.

Also Leyda wants to take a loan for her business of bead-working. They thank all lenders of AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: progressing and expanding their businesses

loans.name: Lester Enrique

texts.es: El joven  Lester M. de 25 años de edad,  vive junto con sus padres, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad en su centro de trabajo el nuevo pacto, de día ya que por la noche hay otro que resguarda el colegio, el estudia la universidad  para poder tener un futuro mejor a mucho esfuerzo ya que sus padres no pueden cubrir sus estudios ya que es lo mas caro la educación. Con este préstamo lograra comprar zinc para cambiar el techo del caraje que esta en mal estado. Ya que mientras este con sus padres le ayudara ya que siempre han sido unidos. Sus planes a futuro es poder concluir sus estudios y comenzar a buscar nueva plaza. Da las gracias a la institución por promover el financiamiento a muchas familias para lograr las mejoras de su negocio como vivienda.
texts.en:
Lester M. is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He works as a security guard at the New Covenant Center during the day. At night, he works another security job at a high school. Lester is taking university classes so that he can have a better future. Despite their hard work, his parents could not afford to pay for his educational expenses.

With this loan, Lester will purchase zinc so that he can replace the roof of his house because it is in bad condition. This will be a great help to his parents because they are such a close family. In the future, Lester plans to finish his education so that he can find a new job. He thanks the Institution for providing financing to many families so that they can improve their businesses and their housing situations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa I. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Elsa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa sells bananas in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Jeny May

texts.en:
Jeny May L., from Labo Ozamiz City, is 24 years old, married, and the mother of an infant. To make a living, Jeny May prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jeny May joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor N. is from the village of Maasin Nicdao, Baungon Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Amor owns and runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food and daily use products in the local community.  Amor is just starting this business.

In 2009, Amor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Amor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 
-------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is forty-two years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Regina is a trader, trading in beans and ripe plantain. Regina procures bags of beans and plantain from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and plantain

loans.name: Conny Francis

texts.es: La Sra. Conny Francis E. Gutiérrez trabaja en la alcaldía municipal como asistente de bodega ella es lic. En administración de empresa, tiene cuatro años trabajando en esta institución, el crédito lo solicita para la construcción de su vivienda ya tenía los materiales de construcción solo necesitaba para el pago de la mano de obra para la construcción de su casa ya es el tercer crédito con ceprodel y todos los ha utilizado para construir su casita a ella le ha venido ayudar mucho ya que solo así va a poder cumplir sus sueños es casada no tiene hijos aun y espera que siempre ceprodel le ayude de esta manera otorgándole crédito ya que se siente muy agradecida con estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Conny Francis E. Gutiérrez works in city hall as an assistant. She is licensed in business administration. She has four years experience working in this institution. The loan she's requesting is for the construction of her house. She already has the construction materials. She only needs it to pay for the labor of building her house. This is her third loan with Ceprodel and all of her loans have been used to build her little house. It has helped her a lot since she has been able to achieve her dreams only in this manner. She is married but does not have any children yet and she hopes that Ceprodel will always help her in this way granting her loans since she feels very thankful for this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the labor to build her house.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married lady with two daughters. She runs a general store in Kikuyu. She has been in this business for four years. Her customers are mainly small scale retailers who buy for home consumption. Her husband, John, is also a businessman in Kikuyu, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. 

Naomi was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her third loan. She had no previous credit history with other micro-finance institutions before joining Kadet. She wants to use the money from this loan to add more stock to her retail shop with things like detergent powders, bread, eggs, and much more.

She desires to see her shop grow into a leading wholesale shop in the area. This will improve their livings standards and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: She plans to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad G. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 39 years old. Felicidad is married. To make a living, Felicidad operates a family member's business venture running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad is just starting this business.

In 2007, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her store. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felicidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aída es una laboriosa mujer de 55 años, comparte su vida con su esposo, quien tiene un trabajo bajo contrato, y con sus tres hijos que están estudiando.

La buena sazón heredada de su madre hizo posible que Aída logrará tanto éxito con su negocio de venta de comida, puesto que día a día una gran cantidad de clientes se acerca a su puesto para degustar la gran variedad de platillos que ofrece. Al día prepara un promedio de 4 platos entre los cuales están: “Arroz con pollo”, “Estofado”, “Puré con Papas” y “Menestras”, los cuales son muy demandados por todas la personas que transitan por la zona. La fama de Aída se va extendiendo, lo cual la tiene muy contenta porque se siente felíz al ver las caras de satisfacción que ponen sus comensales después de haber consumido en su puesto. Para el futuro quiere tener un restaurante, pero sabe que para ello necesita más capital es por ello que sigue trabajando mucho para lograr su sueño.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, tal y como lo es en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más bancas, utensilios nuevos e ingredientes para seguir ofreciendo sus platillos con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Aída is a hard working 55-year-old woman. She shares her life with her husband, who works on contract, and their three children who are all in school. The good seasoning she inherited from her mother made it possible for Aida to succeed with her business selling food. Day after day a great many people frequent her stand to taste the variety of dishes she offers. She prepares four dishes a day on average including: rice with chicken, stew, mashed potatoes, and vegetable stew. All of which are in great demand by all of the people who pass through the area. Aída's fame continues to grow which makes her very happy because she enjoys seeing the satisfied looks on her customer's faces after they have eaten at her stand. She would like to have a restaurant in the future but knows that she needs more capital for that so she keeps working hard to make her dream happen. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her payments the same as she is with her business. She will buy more benches, new utensils, and ingredients with the money so she can continue to offer her dishes with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen furniture and utencils

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace algunos años tiene un negocio de venta de todo tipo de artículos, accesorios y repuestos digitales, tales como celulares, cargadores, tarjetas prepago, carcasas entre otros. Su establecimiento queda ubicado en el marcado de la ciudad de Olmos , el se ha hecho conocido en el rubro y ya tiene una clientela fiel debido al tiempo que lleva funcionando, al buen trato y a la calidad de productos que ofrece.

El negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta por lo que Luis Alberto desea ampliarlo y así poder obtener ganancias que le faciliten otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para implementar su negocio.

Luis Alberto es un padre de familia bastante responsable y que gusta mucho de la actividad que realiza. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio con la compra de productos más modernos y expandirse como empresario. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 57, is the father of a family, living with his wife and three children in the Olmos district, located one hour 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For some years he has had a business selling all sorts of articles, accessories, and digital supplies such as cellular phones, chargers, prepaid cards, and cases among other things. His establishment is located in the market in the city of Olmos. He has become known in the area and already has a faithful clientele thanks to the time he has been in business, to his good service, and to the quality of products that he sells. The business is his sole income, so Luis Alberto wants to enlarge it to increase his earnings, allowing him to give his family a better quality of life. Therefore he is requesting a loan of $700 from Edpyme Alternativa that he plans to invest in the purchase of additional merchandise for his business. Luis Alberto is a responsible head of family who very much enjoys his business. His dream is to be able to enlarge his business by purchasing M. up-to-date products and thus grow as an entrepreneur. He has worked before with our institution and has shown responsibility and precise punctuality in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of digital merchandise

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es: Santos Del Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, que ya están casados y viven aparte. Su actividad económica es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, la cual ya tiene 20 años de tenerla, esta pulpería brinda de manutención a ella y a su esposo, que labora  en construcción como albañil, sin embargo no gana lo suficiente para la manutención del hogar. Este negocio empezó hace 20 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Su meta actualmente, es establecer una tienda de ropa usada, ya que se está convirtiendo en un negocio muy rentable.
texts.en:
Santos Del Carmen is 47 years old. She is married and has three children who are all married and live elsewhere. Santos operates a grocery business in her home. She has had this business for 20 years and it helps support her and her husband, who works as a brick mason. However, the business does not earn enough money for the maintenance of the house. She began the business 20 years ago with very little capital as an alternative source of income. This loan will be invested in the purchase of bulk grains, which are currently the main product she sells. Her goal for the future is to start a used clothing store, which is a very profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bulk grains

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly N., 43 years old, owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She has three children and her eldest child is 20.

Rosaly joined CEVI’s program in 2006 and stayed in the program until now because she likes the services. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 30,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store.

By obtaining the loan, Rosaly will be able to attract more customers and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene mucha experiencia con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues además tiene su pequeña pulpería, es así que le proporciona a su hijo lo necesario. Por lo que además tiene mucha competencia, por eso necesita comprar productos más variados. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. Siempre sueña con establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa has lots of experience with financing. She’s been running a small general store for more than 4 years, allowing her to support her son. She has lots of competition, so she needs to buy a greater variety of merchandise. This loan will provide her with working capital. She hopes to open a full store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Mi nombre es: Tomasa, nací y vivo en la ciudad de Iscuchaca, provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco.   
Yo me dedico a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, el cual consiste en comprar animales críos y los alimento y los hago crecer y después los vendo en la feria de Inquilpata, tengo tres años en el negocio y me va muy bien y con las ganancias puedo educar a mis hijos y comprar alimento. Al inicio me fue un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de perteneces al banco comunal de Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar a mejorar mi negocio.
 
Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo necesito mas capital de negocio y requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y chanchos.
texts.en:
My name is Tomasa. I was born and live in the city of Iscuchaca, Anta province, Cusco department. I raise small animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. I buy animals when they are young; I feed them, allow them to grow, and later sell them at the Inquilpata market. I have been in this business three years and am doing well. With the profits, I educate my children and buy food. At the beginning, things were somewhat difficult; I didn't have much capital. At that time, however, the opportunity to join the communal bank of Ararwi arose, enabling me to obtain loans and expand my business. Now, for the growth of my business, I need more capital and require this loan to purchase more guinea pigs and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more guinea pigs and pigs

loans.name: Mizaaj's Group

texts.en:
Mizaaj lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan with her family. She has six children; three of them are getting their education while two of the other three work to support their family and one of them is jobless and looking for a job. 

Mizaaj has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah to financially support her husband who sells animals. He has been doing this business for the last thirty-five years. He buys young animals, goats and buffaloes, raises them, and sells them to earn an income. 

With the loan amount, her husband will buy more animals for selling. Mizaaj is hopeful that this investment will give them good returns and improve their living standard.

loans.use: Purchase animals for reselling

loans.name: Julie's Group

texts.en: Julie M. is from the village of Rizalina Hills, Rizal. She is 30 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Julie is married and has one school-aged child. Julie owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods (products such as textiles, ready-to-wear clothing, and sundries) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Julie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana Vive en la localidad D. el torno distante a 39 km D. la ciudad D. santa cruz, en la comunidad D. Santa Martha, su actividad principal es la venta D. ropa  en el mercado D. el torno, D. forma ambulante, su esposo es chofer D. camiones y se ausenta D. la casa por varias semanas, el cual una vez al mese esta con su familia, tienen que trabar duro ya que tienen 5 hijos en edad escolar lo cual le genera un costo elevado ya sea en el estudio y también en salud, hace 10 año que vive en su propio domicilio el cual han tenido que pasar muchas necesidades para adquirirlo ya que lo compraron con el poco dinero que tenían, el dinero D. crédito lo utilizara en compra D. Chamarras y Chompas ya que esta haciendo mucho frio y la Sra. Tiene muchos pedidos en esta época D. invierno
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana lives in the Santa Martha community of El Torno neighborhood, which is 39 km from the city of Santa Cruz. Her main business is selling clothing as a street vendor in El Torno's market. Her husband is a truck driver and is gone from the house for weeks at a time, returning once a month to be with the family. They have to work hard since they have 5 school-aged children, which is quite costly both in terms of schooling and health care. For ten years they have lived in their own home. They had to give up a lot of necessities in order to acquire their house, which they purchased with the little money they had. The money from the loan will be used to purchase winter coats and sweaters, since it's been very cold and the Sra. has a lot of orders this wintertime.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Francis  Ndichu

texts.en:
Francis K. deals in various types of stationery and office supplies. His business is situated in the town center, and apart from the customers who can access his shop, he also supplies some paper goods to schools. He has been selling stationery for about eight years, and receives an income of about $1040 per month. His other source of income is farming.

This client has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution, and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. This loan of 25,000 KES is his 1st loan with KADET. He plans to use the loan to expand his business and use the extra income to hire one more employee.

K. is 37 years old, married to Hellen Wacheke, and they are blessed with three children. He hopes to relocate to an industrial area where he would be able to get more customers. He is very hardworking .

loans.use: to expand the business and employ one more staff

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 32 años, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 queridos hijos. Para ella es importante salir adelante con su familia, es por ello que vende salchichas y papas fritas en su stand móvil que recorre las diversas calles, ubicando frente a la puesta de algún colegio. Algunas madres de familia le compran este agradable platillo a precios muy módicos que oferta. Durante estos 2 años ha logrado ganar experiencia, además parte favorable de su trabajo es que lo realiza a medio tiempo, de esa manera no descuida de sus hijos. Espera en adelante comprar su terreno y construir su casa, para mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para renovar otros créditos, ya que los considera de gran ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar un balón de gas y materiales que le ayuden a almacenar las papas ya picadas y listas para  freír.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives in her parents’ house, together with her husband and 2 dear children. For her, it is important to get ahead with her family, which is why she sells hot dogs and French fries at her mobile stand with which she travels the different streets, locating herself in front of a school. Some family mothers buy this enjoyable dish from her at the very reasonable prices that she offers. During these 2 years she has been able to gain experience. In addition, a nice part of her job is that she does it part-time, so she does not neglect her children. In the future, she hopes to purchase land and build her house to improve her living conditions and those of her children.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time to receive other loans, since she considers them to be of great help for her business. With the loan requested, she plans to purchase a gas tank and materials to help her store the potatoes that are already chopped and ready to be fried.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A gas tank and materials to help her store the potatoes that are already chopped

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella C. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Estrella is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothing in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Estrella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: 08 - 03 - 03 - Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Loan N. Thị, age 57, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Loan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Đông Vệ.
 
Loan is married and has two adult-aged children. To earn a living, Loan provides repair services to local community members. Loan has been engaged in this business for more than a decade, and she earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.
 
This year, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Loan is requesting her first loan from the organization, requesting 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
 
1.  T. Thị Mai, age 64, is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her livestock business.
 
2.  Lê Thị Lài, age 42, is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3.  N. Thị Hương, age 47, is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Loan N. Thị (8) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Loan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Đông Vệ (08.03.03 Dong Ve).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Loan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Loan kiếm được khoảng 2500000 VND.  Vào 2010, Loan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Loan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  T. Thị Mai (9) là 64 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Lê Thị Lài (10) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  N. Thị Hương (11) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To expand her repair-service business.

loans.name: Chinikul

texts.en:
Chinikul K., a 57-year-old pensioner, lives in At-Bashy village in the mountainous area of Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has six grown children, five of whom live on their own, while the youngest son, in accordance with Kyrgyz national tradition, lives with her and helps with the household. Chinikul and her husband Beyshenaly have been married for over 40 years and support each other.

Chinikul has been engaged in cattle breeding most of her life, and her experience and hardworking personality have enabled her to maintain a successful farm and enlarge her number of cattle. Today she has eight horses and eight cows and sheep which were obtained with her first loan, which was repaid without any delays. She plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her number of cattle for fattening and reselling. In the future, Chinikul plans to renovate her house and hold her son’s wedding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Antasia

texts.en:
Antasia T. is 24 years old, and she is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have two children, one of whom goes to school.

Antasia is currently operating a small business venture in the food sector. Specifically, she sells cassava, yams, and carrots in her community. She is requesting a loan to stock more yams and carrots for re-sale purposes. With the expected additional profits generated by this loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional yams and carrots

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel O., es de 42 años de edad, tiene 10 hijos, de los cuales 4 estan estudiando, trabaja en la artesanía (tejeduría) elaboración de cortes, lo cual viene realizando desde hace mas de 15 años, ha logrado sostener a su familia y sufragar otros gastos gracias al trabajo que tiene y el deseo de superacion tambien le ha sido de mucha ayuda, quiere amopliar su capital de trabajo, se acerca  a esta institución para solicitar un prestamo para compra materia prima y elaborar el producto que realiza.
texts.en: Miguel O. is forty-two and has ten children, four of whom are in school.  He's in the crafts (hand-knit items) business, making shorts, which he's been doing for more than fifteen years.  Thanks to his work, he has succeeded in supporting his family and keeping up with other expenses.  His desire to overcome has also helped him a great deal.  He would like to increase his working capital and has come to this institution seeking a loan so he can buy supplies and produce his goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Possiano

texts.en: Possiano is a 22-year-old married man with a child living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda and his dream is having a stable income to sustain the family. He is into motorcycle transport and has been in the sector for two years now. His major challenge is not owning the motorcycle and this limits his income level. His business desire is to own a motorcycle to avoid remitting the daily income to the boss. Possiano needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benjamin; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ocres pinturas para las paredes de todo color el vende de forma ambulatoria y luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y personas que le solicitan.       

El socio solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a member of the 'Unidos para el Triunfo' (United for Victory) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Benjamin is 40 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling ochre-based wall paints in all colors.  He sells these as a street trader and delivers them to his customers and people who request them.

Benjamin is requesting this loan to keep his business going.  He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep his business going

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widow with seven children – six had graduated from school while one still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Mbeyu faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for sale

loans.name: Mayda Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mayda Enriqueta; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la provincia de Quispicanchis, ella enseña a niños del nivel primario, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Mayda Enriqueta is 62 years old, married, and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher in the province of Quispicanchis, teaching children in elementary school. She wants to have a grocery store and she is requesting the loan for housing maintenance.

Mayda Enriqueta is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Maintenance for her house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 58 años,  es separada de su esposo y vive con sus dos hijos que estudian, en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 11 años, está trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en la puerta de su casa, hasta altas horas de la noche. Es por ello, que todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, realiza sus compras, adquiriendo productos no perecibles como carne de aves, que es el alimento que más acogida tiene. Es un negocio muy exitoso, ya que su buen carácter y su buena atención le han permitido captar muchos clientes de su barrio, y es por eso,  que se siente muy feliz. Sin embargo sufre mucho en temporada de inviernos ya que tiene muchas dolencias en los huesos causada por el frío. Ana está pensando en el futuro vivir del alquiler de su cuarto, y para ello espera terminar de construir su casa. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y  como socia antigua de su banco comunal se siente muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe en los reiterados créditos, por ello se compromete pagar sus cuotas de acuerdo lo establecido en su cronograma. De obtener el crédito solicitado, comprará  toldo de su salchipapera para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana is 58 years old, separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two children, who are in school. For the past 11 years this hard-working woman has made a living selling fast food at her home's front door until the late hours of the evening. She gets up very early to make her purchases, acquiring products like poultry, which is her most popular item. It is a very successful business since her good personality and her good customer service brings in a lot of people from her neighborhood, and for this reason she is very happy. However, she suffers a lot during the winter season because she gets many body pains caused by the cold. Ana is planning in the future to live off of renting out one of her rooms, and for that she hopes to finish construction on her home. This is her 11th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and as a longtime member of her community bank she feels very grateful for all the support she has received with her past loans. She promises to make her payments over the established period. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase an awning to provide her customers with more comfort.

loans.use: Purchase an awning to provide her customers with more comfort.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado de su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria.

Marcos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcos,45, has a live-in spouse and lives with his family in the Tambogrande farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for mango and lemon production, that belongs to Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises sheep in enclosures near his home.  Once they reach a good level of development he sells them in the local market.  The business helps him support his family’s daily needs.

Marcos wants to expand the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed so that they will develop better and can then be sold at a better price.  To reach his objective, therefore, he has requested a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn S., 30, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells dessert and other food, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of about $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $22 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to expand her current business of selling food. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.
