loans.use: expand her food selling business

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Rene; El socio tiene 48 años de edad, el socio es casado, el socio trabaja en el I.N.C (Instituto Nacional de Cultura), y también tiene un taller de carpintería, el socio tiene este taller porque es su pasión; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio desea en esta oportunidad el crédito para invertir  en la carpintería y poder comprar una maquinaria para la carpintería. el socio requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rene belongs to the Patron San Sebastian village bank, located in the Huanchac district of Cusco, Peru.

Rene is 48 years old, married, and works in the National Institute of Culture; he also runs a small carpentry shop which is his passion.  He has 2 children.  He would like to use this loan to invest in his carpentry workshop and buy machinery for it.  This is for her own personal use.

He is happy for the opportunity to receive this loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es empleada pública, trabaja como abogada; el crédito lo necesita para cancelar un diplomado relacionado a su profesión y así seguir superándose. Vive  en casa de sus Padres ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, es Divorciada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: Cecilia is a public worker, she is a lawyer. She will use the loan she is requesting to pay off the expenses of a certified course relevant to her profession, which she attended to keep on improving herself. She lives in her parents’ house located in Miraflores, a neighborhood of the city of La Paz, she is divorced and she has two children.

loans.use: To pay for a certified course relevant to her profession.

loans.name: Ramber

texts.es:
El señor Ramber O. M., tiene 22 años de edad, es una persona joven trabajador es soltero, vive con sus padres y les apoya a sus dos hermanas que estudian en el colegio, viven en la comunidad de sauces del municipio de mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja junto a su padre en la agricultura, producen cebolla, zanahoria y frejol; y los venden en el mismo lugar.
Es una persona muy respetado en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el respozable del estudio de sus dos hermanas, 
Ramber, esta solicitando el presente credito para comprar mas semillas e insumos y aumentar mas superficie de sus cultivos y asi aumentar sus ingresos, apoyar mas a sus hermanas y mejorar la condicion de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramber O. M., 22, is a young, hard working, single man living with his parents; he helps them with expenses for his two sisters who are in school.  They live in the Sauces community in the municipality of Mizque in Cochabamba Department.

He works farming alongside his father; they grow onion, carrots and broad beans that they sell there as well.

He is a much respected person in his community because of his dedication to work ad for being responsible for the education of his two sisters.

Ramber is asking for this loan to buy more seed and farming supplies and to increase the surface of his plantations to increase his income, support his sisters more and improve the living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ildefonso

texts.en:
Mr. Ildefonso R. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, married and blessed with two school-age children. To make a living, he has a hog-raising business. He also is engaged in seaweed production (commonly known Guso seaweed). He has been engaged in these businesses for more than five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Just this year, Ildefonso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting his first loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for building an additional pigpen. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially for their basic needs, savings, insurance and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build an additional pigpen

loans.name: Fualili

texts.en:
Fualili is 29 years of age and married with three children. She has a business catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has two years of experience in this business. Fualili needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks and nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Fualili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fualili's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipments such as hooks & nets

loans.name: G.s. Los Mismos Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario Los Mismos está conformado por Víctor, Maria Concepción y Susana. Víctor tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su actividad es una carpintería. Tiene más de  8 años en este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes, llegan a solicitarle diferentes encargos el siempre está buscando como brindarles la mejor atención y el mejor servicio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera, cepillos, lijas, entre otras herramientas. Todos son personas responsables trabajadores que en muchos casos sacan adelante a su familia, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The group Los Mismos is made up of Victor, Maria Concepción and Susana. Victor has 4 young children and he works as a carpenter. He has been doing this work for more than 8 years. Most of his clients come to him with different projects and he is always looking to give them the best attention and service. The loan he is requesting is to buy wood, brushes, sandpaper and other tools. All of the group members are responsible and hard-working. They are very grateful to the Leon Foundation for the support it has given them, which has helped them to take care of their families.

loans.use: to buy wood, brushes, sandpaper and other tools.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 36 years old.  He has 5 children who are between 2 and 15 years old.  All except the youngest are in school.  Jean Bosco owns a store in which he sells foodstuffs such as beans, sugar, and cooking oil.  He has been doing this business for 8 years, and from this business he has been able to meet the needs of his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy items such as toilet paper, soap, sugar, etc. to fill his store and make more profits.  He intends to save the additional profits.

loans.use: to buy items such as toilet paper, soap, sugar, etc. for his shop.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Florinda is one of the members of her group named Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3. It is s a group made by 15 businesswomen dedicated to do different businesses in their houses and by walking. They are located in a rural area outside La Romana, between sugarcane fields. She is a married woman with 5 children, and four of them still live together with her in their simple structure home. 

Florinda has been operating her Comedor (a kind of local restaurant for lunch) around 4 years, where many people from the community attend to have lunch. She started with her savings 5 years ago. She is exciting to receive her second loan with Esperanza, because after she joined the program, she has felt more committed to her business. She plans to use this loan to buy rice, meat, seasoning, canned meals, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.  

She will use her profits to reinvest in her businnes because she wants to have an improved business and to have her dream come true (to have her own house). Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, canned meals, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years old, married to Kennedy and the mother of three school-going children. She has run a salon in Tassia, Nairobi for the last two years and earns an income of 10,000 KES monthly.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend and this is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the funds to buy more chemicals, hairpieces and shampoos. She plans to use the generated profits to open another salon.

In future, Damaris desires to grow her business and own a beauty parlor. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and hairpieces for the business

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She attended school and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband is a teacher.  They have five children, all of whom go to school except for the youngest one who is only two years old.  

Sonnie sells dried goods including rice, oil, and salt, as well as water and soft drinks.  She is proud that her business is going well.  She started the business with money from her husband.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more goods for resale. She would like enlarge her business and run her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Chandara

texts.en:
Chandara, 44 year old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $2 per day. She has five children: one is studying and the other four are working with $11 per day earned by all.

Every month, she has to spend $77 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 school fees, and $30 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to feed for selling so that she can make more income for supporting her family. Her family has been doing this since they married until now, and the income is only for supporting the family (they never have any money left). That’s why she wants to raise pigs to sell for more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs for selling

loans.name: Okada Riders Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Okada Riders” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 each in order to invest in their business. 

Osman, the 25-year-old  leader of this team, is married and has one child. Osman and his teammates are all Okada (motor-bike taxi) drivers, he for the past three years. With the help of this loan, they will each buy a new motor-bike. 

(Also included on the left in the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, shown handing over the loan to the Okada Riders)

loans.use: to buy a new motor-bike.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 52 years old, is married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. For the past seventeen years he has practiced mixed farming, i.e., rearing sheep and goats as well as growing maize.

Wilson learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He is applying for a second KADET loan of 80,000 KES which he plans to use part of on his maize crop and the remaining portion to purchase more animals.

Wilson hopes to use all profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farm.

loans.use: to use part of on his crops and part to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Matza Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  matza y se integra D. tres señoras y cada una se dedica a diferente actividad,

     L. señora quien  se le tomo L. entrevista se llama  Romelia y  solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en L. compra D.  mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes con aceite, jabon, azucar, productos enlatados, etc., en donD. lleva practicando  un año  y nos cometa que le va bien ya que  atenido  muy buen resultado.

  Para inspirarse a esta actividad  lo motivo su esposo  quien le dio unos ahorritos para  dedicarse a algo que le deje ingresos y gracias a dios le va muy bien.
  
    Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda mejorar un poco más sus  ingresos para así  apoyar a sus  hijos que están estudiando.

  Las persona que integran en el grupo son L. señora  Noemí quien invertirá e préstamo en L. compra D. ingredientes para L. elaboración D. tacos, como también compra sabritas y dulces para vender y por otro lado L. señora Segunda  quiem  invertirá en L. compra D. insumo para L. elaboración D. tortilL..
texts.en:
This group is called “Matza” and it is maD. up of three women, each of whom has a different business.

Sra. Romelia is featured here.  She is requesting a loan to  purchase  merchandise to supply her grocery store, such as oil, soap, sugar, tinned goods, etc. She has had her business for one year and notes that it has gone well and she has had a good income.

Her husband inspired her to start the business and gave her some savings so that she could start something that would proviD. an income and, thanks to God, it is doing very well.

What she most wishes is that her small business will be able to increase her income even more so she can help her children who are in school.

The other members of the group are Sra. Noemi, who will purchase ingredients to make tacos, and also buy Sabritas (chips) and sweets to sell, and Sra. Segunda, who will buy supplies to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, such as oil, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: In the photo is Samuel, 43. He is married and blessed with five children who are still in school. For the last 10 years, he has been operating a cafeteria. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and employ more people. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a fifty-one-year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming for ten years. Formerly he was into banana farming and later diversified to growing coffee, cassava, cabbages and beans. 

His hardship is limited financial resources and his vision is to have higher yields plus a permanent house. Julius needs the loan facility to buy beans and till the land.

loans.use: to buy beans and till the land.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mr. Long is 52 years old, a married man and a father of seven lovely kids, two of whom are already married and have started to live in separate houses. The other five of them are living on his income and are attending in school. Mr. Long is a hard-working person who supports his family’s needs. Presently, he is a good teacher in secondary school level. He has been in this field for many years. Taking time from this business, he also a rice cultivator, located in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meancheay Province, Cambodia. It is the one skill which he had learned more from his parents and ancestors since he was young. He has planted it for a few months but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop plague. Because of this, Mr. Long would like to request in amount of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for making his product grow well. He said that this fund is very useful for his family because it is the main source of his income. He is hoping that all kind donors will take pity on his family. He said that he is an easygoing person, conscientious and will pay back punctually. In the future, he will send his children to get a good education at university and get a good job for each.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: La socia tiene 57 años de edad, la socia continua con sus negocios y ella sigue comprando animales vacunos; la socia en esta ocasión desea el credito para invertir en la comrpa de 2 toros, la socia dice que los toritos tiernos cuestan entre 450 a 600 soles cada uno, la socia desea comprar dos animales vacunos y la socia manifiesta que ella desde que tiene el credito en cada desembolso suele invertir en sus negocios, algunos meses lo ha estado invirtiendo en la compra de chanchos, cuyes, en su terreno de cultivo, en la compra d evacas, y en esta ocasión desea aumentar sus ganados vacunos, ella con todo lo que le genera sus diferentes actividades suele mejorar su vivienda con las mejoras de los acabados, el baño, y comprando terrenos de cultivo. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de 2 toritos tiernos.
texts.en: The member is 57 years old and continues with her businesses; she continues to buy cattle.  On this occasion she wants the loan to buy two bulls.  She says that young bullocks cost between 450 and 600 soles each.  She wants to buy two bulls and she says that since she’s had the loan she invests each disbursement in her business.  Some months she’s invested it in purchasing pigs or guinea pigs, in her fields and in the purchase of cows.  On this occasion she wants to increase her cattle herd.  With what all her various activities earn she tends to improve her house making improvements to the finishing, bathroom and also buying farmland.  She is asking for the loan to buy two young bullocks.

loans.use: to buy two young bullocks.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s really ambitious and looking for a good future. In 2004, he started to work as a farmer on his own land. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will certainly increase his production and therefore enhance his way of living. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her three sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a labourer in the construction field. She has operated a cafe in front of her house for one year.

Diep would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Diep also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Gloria has a general store business. She earns about 3,700 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Gloria has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock of products to sell.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mila

texts.es: Luz Mila de 56 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Luz se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, creativa y sobre todo carismática. Tiene varios años de poseer un salón de belleza el cual con mucho  trabajo  y dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo activo por mucho tiempo y gracias a Dios  le ha proporcionado los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y por ella hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para contribuir con la economía de su hogar ya que cada día son más las necesidades que se presentan. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su salón de belleza ya que es lo más importante que ella posee y su deseo es mantenerlo activo por muchos más años. El crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de artículos tales como: cremas, tintes, cosméticos, secadora, entre otros productos que ayuden a atraer a más clientes al negocio. De esta manera espera poder cumplir su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Mila, 56, lives in her own home with her family, which includes her husband and her three children.  Luz describes herself as an enterprising, creative, and above all charismatic woman.

For several years she has had a beauty salon, which with much work and dedication she has managed to keep active for a long time.  And, with thanks to God, it has provided her with the necessary income to get her family ahead.  For her the most important thing is her family, and she does everything in her power to contribute to the household finances, since every day there are more necessities that come up.

She has made the decision to request this loan from Integral to invest in her beauty salon because it is the most important thing she possesses.  Her desire is to keep doing it for many more years.

She wants to invest the loan in buying such articles as creams, dyes, cosmetics, a dryer, and other products that help attract more customers to her business.  In this way she hopes to be able to realize her dream of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy creams, dyes, cosmetics, a dryer, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan, she is married and has six children.

For the past forty years Martha has been involved with business. She started this business of selling coal bags, and currently she is selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora, esta separa del que fue su esposo por muchos años, tiene dos hijas de 20 y 16 años quienes estudian y son la razón por el cual ella trabaja para brindarles una buena educación. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde también comparten sus días a lado de sus sobrinos. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, entre los productos que vende tiene de cuidado personal, cuidado facial, colonias, perfumes, ropa, y mas, todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa. Cuando se inicio en este trabajo que fue hace aproximadamente 6 años le era complicado poder realizarlo ya que no sabia muy bien el negocio, pero con el tiempo pudo salir adelante y así logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede tener tiempo para poder hacer todas las actividades que desee, además de poder también brindar atención a sus hijas quienes estudian y están en edad de necesitar muchas cosas. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene dos ingresos, uno la venta de cosméticos y la otra como trabajadora de salud en un hospital de su ciudad. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero lo que por ahora desea es seguir creciendo y aumentar la mercadería que tiene. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Además se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos de belleza para tener en stock, así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, is a very good, friendly and hardworking woman. She separated from the man who was her husband many years ago. She has two daughters, 20 and 16, who are students and who are the reason she is working: to give them a good education. They live together in their own house where they also share their days with their cousins. 

Maria’s work involves the sale of beauty products. She sells items like personal care and facial care products, colognes, perfumes, clothing and more and she does her work from her home. When she started this work approximately 6 years ago, it was complicated for her to do since she did not know the business very well. However, with time she was able to get ahead and become a successful saleswoman. What she enjoys about her work is having time to do all the things she wants to do, as well as care for her daughters who are students and are at an age when they need so many things. Things are going well since she has two incomes, one from the sale of cosmetics and the other as a health worker in a hospital in her city.

Maria has many plans for the future but what she wants to do now is to continue expanding her merchandise. This will be her second loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know that she will have financial support for in this way she will feel more certain of advancing in her work. As well, she promises once again to meet her payments on time, as she has on earlier loans. With the sum requested, 1000 soles, she will purchase beauty products to have in stock so that she will be able to offer a greater variety of goods to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Cliente de 62 ans, elle est veuve et a 7 enfants plus et grand mère de 5 petits enfants ,A la mort de son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de des enfants ,elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais au marche.

Quand elle commence a Hope, elle vendait ses vivres frais sur un étalage,et depuis qu'elle a bénéficie de prêts de Hope, son activite a grandi, elle ne vend plus sur les étalages, a l'heure actuelle elle loue une chambre froide et elle achete en gros.
Les differents prêts ont fait eu de l'impact dans sa vie sociale et économique et familiale ,elle épargne constamment et fait ses remboursements sans difficultés et avec ses benefices elle prend soin de sa famille et elle assure la scolarité de ses petits enfants.

Elle a pour ambition de continuer d'aller vers l'avant et être une grossiste renommée des vivres frais.
texts.en:
Helene is a 62 year old client. She is a widow with seven children and five grandchildren. After the death of her husband, she began to sell fresh food at the market in order to support her family.

When she first started with Hope, she was selling her fresh food from a stand. After receiving loans from Hope, her business grew. She no longer sells from a stall, but rents a cold storage room and buys her products in bulk.

The loans have made an impact on her social, economic, and family life. Her savings are growing, and she pays back her loans without difficulty. With her profits, she takes care of her family and ensures the education of her grandchildren.

Her plan is to keep going and become a renowned wholesaler of fresh food.

loans.use: to buy boxes of beef, pork, oxtail

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: La señora María tiene 58 años de edad, ella cuenta con domicilio propio en la localidad de Sacaba, ella tiene 2 hijos los cuales son independientes y casados. La señora María se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas en su domicilio dos veces por semana, ya que el sueldo que percibe como maestra no le alcanza para sustentarse, la señora vende los días de feria en sacaba jueves y domingo, solo elabora empanadas dos veces a la semana debido a que tiene como segunda actividad de profesión maestra de inicial El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de insumos por cantidad  como harina y azúcar, ya que por estas épocas empieza a subir el pecio de estos productos, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida  por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Señora Maria is 58 years old. She has her own home in Sacaba. She has two children who are independent and are married. Señora Maria makes empanadas in her home two times a week since the salary she receives as a teacher is not sufficient for her to support herself. She sells them on the market days in Sacaba, Thursday and Sunday. She only makes empanadas twice a week because she has a second professional job as a preschool teacher. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of quantities of ingredients such as flour and sugar, because at this time the prices of these products are beginning to go up. Sra. Maria is a very hard-working person and is grateful for the opportunity that is offered to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make empanadas

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama operates a business selling cold water and soda in Ebubonko, near Cape Coast. Ama is divorced and supports four children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ama will use her loan funds to purchase a larger number of beverages to offer for sale. This will allow her to improve her overall sales. 

She plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Gideon is a 50 year old married man and a father of 3, living in Teshi, at the greater Accra region of Ghana. Gideon is the man among the women in the photo. He is a fashion designer, engaged in dress making. Gideon is a member of a group called ‘Universal’. He has been in the business for eight years. HE has four apprentices who are understudying and working for him.

Gideon is also engaged in selling of clothing materials in the community for complementary income. He and his group have a challenge in term of inadequacy of capital to operate effectively. As a result, they have requested a loan of GHC 8,600.00, out of which Gideon’s share is GHC 1,200.00. He intends to use part of his loan to buy sewing materials and the rest for cloths for sales. He wants to earn more income to pay off this loan and support his children’s education. Meanwhile he dreams to see his business grow for him to become independent of loans.
Gideon is very grateful for the support he and his group get from Kiva for which he thanks his lenders.

loans.use: to use part of his loan to buy sewing materials and the rest for cloths for sales.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi K. is a young woman who has been married since 1995. She is the mother of four. Besides her four children, she also takes care of her retired elderly parents. Her husband, a farmer, does not have a steady income that would allow him to effectively support the family. The children are often sent home from class because the tuition goes unpaid. Ms. K. is compelled to diversify her business because she must cover a big share of household expenses. So, aside from her work in the fields, she makes rope and sells it at the marketplace. She would now like to improve her business, which she names "La Fileuse du Village" (The Village Weaver) but lacks the money to acquire the materials for her work. She is requesting a loan of $600 for raw materials in sizable amounts to make rope.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Ablavi est une jeune dame mariée depuis 1995 et mère de quatre (04) enfants. En dehors de ses enfants, elle prend en charge ses parents inactifs à cause de leur âge avancé. Son mari qui est un cultivateur n’a pas un revenu fixe qui lui permet de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de la famille. Les enfants sont souvent renvoyés de l’école pour non payement des frais de scolarité. Madame K. qui doit prendre une grande part dans les charges du ménage est obligée de diversifier ses activités. Ainsi, en dehors des travaux champêtres, elle tisse des cordes qu’elle vend au marché.

Aujourd’hui elle veut améliorer cette activité mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour l’acquisition du matériel de travail. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $600 qui va servir à l’acquisition en quantité du matériel nécessaire pour le tissage des cordes.

loans.use: To acquire materials to make rope

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran N. (employee pictured) is a farmer on the outskirts of the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Karman wants to invest in his farm by purchasing more trees and to hire another farm hand to help him with the tractor work.

loans.use: To purchase trees and to hire an employee to help with tractor work

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra has a small store where she sells a variety of foods including snacks and ice cream. She has borrowed from Kiva and Mifex before, using the loan to invest in more toys right before the busy Christmas season. With the profits she generated from her investment, she decided to start a new operation adjacent to her store. She is now selling lunch from a very humble diner next to her mini mart.

Alexandra needs the loan in order buy utensils, tables and chairs for her new business. She is confident that with the help of a loan her diner will flourish, as she already has a loyal client base. She has also noticed that both businesses support one another, as they draw attention to each other.

Alexandra is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is her right hand man in business and in life. They are a very united family and believe firmly in the value of education for the children.

loans.use: Invest in tables, chairs and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Balbina Cornelia

texts.en:
Balbina Cornelia N. has a tough time pronouncing her own name! She has been very productive in the businesses she has started. Her former husband cares for two of her five children, and three of the children are in her care.

This, her latest venture, is a general convenience store. She says that most of her sales are derived from the sale of rum and beer, together with rice. I mentioned that this was the same combination of goods that other merchants were requesting a loan for to sell in the same community. I asked why many women would be stocking the same products to increase sales capability, as opposed to having a different strategy. Balbina mentioned that there are quite a few general stores in the area, but that they all have good businesses. Each and everyone has their customer base already built up, and are sufficiently patronized to bring in a reasonable level of business activity. Many of these businesses, if not all of them, do business not only by selling the products, but also by giving credit to their customers. This is one reason why most of these small entrepreneurs have knowledge of the “financing” art; they do it themselves! It’s a customer retention practice!

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and rum!

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Mr. Elbrus is a 37-year-old farmer.  He lives with his family in the village of Saatli which is situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1999, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. Since then Elbrus collected up to seven cows. He buys calves, breeds them, quarters them, then sells them to the butcher, who works in the local big market. Elbrus has collected enough customers but needs more animals in his herd. This project requires investment. For this purpose Elbrus applied for $700 loan from Normicro to buy five calves.  He hopes eventually to expand his business using this loan.

loans.use: To buy more calves

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar A. is 41 years old and the father of one child. He is from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory in the Lachin region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city, with his family. He is the only breadwinner in his family. 

His business consists of video filming. He makes video films in ceremonies of weddings and meetings. He loves his business very much. Yashar wants to buy a computer, but he does not have enough money for this purpose. If he has a computer, he can develop his business further. 

Yashar would like to receive a $500 loan in order to buy a computer and the necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. Yashar will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a computer and necessary tools and equipments

loans.name: Gulmukhor

texts.en: Gulmukhor S. lives in Mastchokh. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005, and the loan sums are permanently increased, which shows the business stability and income increase. She describes herself as a  serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She is engaged in the commercial services and trade. She works in the bazaar, where her shop is located, at the men's wear and shoe sales. Gulmukhor S. has the wide assortment that allows her to work with clients of the different income levels and permanent clients, but she wants to import new models demanded among the population today. She requires a loan in 1000 STJ to broaden the existing assortment and to develop her business of men's wear and shoes.

loans.use: To widen the existing assortment and develop the business.

loans.name: Anor

texts.en: S. Anor lives in the Nausky region, is married and has 4 children. She has been an active client of  MicroInvest since 2005. She is an executive client who repays her loans on time. Mrs.S. is engaged in  commercial service and trade. She started the business from the small wares selling but now she has her own trade outlet in the flea bazaar. She sells mens and children shoes. She has a direct supplier that allows her prices of goods sold to be lower than the bazaar prices. Mrs.S. is very polite and has many repeat customers. Now Mrs.S. requests the loan of 1700 STJ to expand her assortment (she also wants to purchase layettes because it is one of the high-turnover products).

loans.use: To increase her  assortment of goods

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa G. is 33 years old, single, and the mother of two children. She has had this photocopy booth for almost two years. The income from her business is used mostly for repairing the photocopier, which is out-dated. She would like to use this loan to acquire a new photocopier and to buy 10 cartons of paper in order to meet strong customer demand and thus to provide for her own needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Yawa G. est âgée de33 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Elle tient cette cabine de photocopie bientôt 02 ans. Les revenus issus de son activité sont utilisés dans en majorité pour le dépannage de la photocopieuse étant donné que cette dernière est une vieillerie. Madame Yawa souhaite par ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse et acheter 10 cartons de papiers rames afin de répondre à la forte demande de la clientèle et par là subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopier and 10 cartons of paper

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey S. and her husband work together catching fish which they then sell to a market. They earn around $3 a day of profit. They will use this loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer their fish to the market.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to transport their catch

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 42 years old and married, with 10 children. He has a small farm where his family grows food mainly for their own consumption. He also has a business buying and selling local produce. John is requesting a loan of approximately $1050 US to increase the amount of local produce he can buy and sell. With the increased profits from produce sales, he will be able to invest more in the family farm. He would like to train his children to do agribusiness.

loans.use: Purchase produce to sell, then invest profits in the family farm.

loans.name: Hussein David's Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Hussein D., age 28, is married with a one year old daughter. He sells spare parts, which he started one year ago. He opens his business from 2am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $146.

Hussein has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase capital for his business. He hopes to get a new loan to help increase business. Hussein will share this loan with his subgroup members selling clothes, soft drinks, beer, and clothes.

In the picture Hussein is 1st on the right back row

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi L., 52 years old, currently lived with her husband and 2 younger children (her two elder children have grown up and moved out). From 1997 to 2002, all of her loans have been used on breeding pgs and cows. During 2002, her family turned their focuses to forest products, with more than 2 hecta of land. Her family sell woods as well as wood-product and have been fairly successfully. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 15 millions VND to invest more into this project. Her family monthly income is 4 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Lợi 52 tuổi, chị có 4 người con, 2 con đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng anh chị. Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997 đến năm 2002 các vòng vốn gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lơn nái, bò sinh sản, với dự án này gia đình chị đã từng bước thay đổi. Năm 2002 gia đình chị đã chuyển hướng vào đầu tư chồng rừng, với diện tích hơn 2 hét ta kết hợp với việc chồng rừng gia đình chị còn kinh doanh gia công chế biến lâm sản, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi, với mô hình làm ăn đó gia đình chị đã được nhiều người dân trong vùng học tập và nhân rộng.Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 15.000.000 đầu tư vào chế biến gỗ lâm sản. Thu nhập bình quân . 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Forest Product

loans.name: Sily

texts.en:
Sily Y., 42, and her husband, Pha Sim, 45, a farmer, live in a small village on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River. Married for 18 years, the couple has one son and one daughter.

For the past decade, Sily has earned a living by weaving silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished goods to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in the capital city of Phnom Penh, which is about 10 miles away. In addition to her weaving business, hard-working Sily also runs a small grocery shop in the front of her home.

To grow her businesses, Sily is requesting a loan of $700 U.S. dollars to purchase more food to sell and silk to weave.

loans.use: To buy goods for a small grocery store and silk for weaving

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Dame A. Elise est née vers 1968 à BOPA dans le département du MONO. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants que sont Elodie 16 ans et en apprentissage, Natacha 13 ans est au cours secondaire et Lucas est au cours élémentaire 2. Dame A. Elise est revendeuse des tubercules d'igname séchées dont la farine sert à préparer de la pâte appelée au Bénin "TELIBO". Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son volume d'activité et pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elise A. was born around 1968 in BOPA in the department of MONO. She is married and has three children : Elodie, 16 years old, is an apprentice, Natacha, 13 years old, is in secondary school, and Lucas is in elementary school. Mrs. Elise A. is a retailer of dried yam tubers, which can be made into flour and used to make a paste called "TELIBO" in Benin. She is asking for this loan to increase the volume of her business and to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of dried yam tubers and various other products

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa A., 36 ans, mariée, avec ses 3 sœurs qui sont à l’école à sa charge  est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter  des pièces de tissus qu’elle va revendre au marché Boucotte ou elle a deux cantines. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Awa A., 36, is married and has her three sisters who are enrolled in school to care for. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for two years. Her business consists in buying lengths of cloth which she re-sells in the Boucotte market where she has two little shops. The income from her business allows her to improve living conditions for her family. She is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cloth

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Koeurn K. grows vegetables to sell in Kdey Dong Commune, Kampong Thom Province. Besides vegetable growing she also makes Khmer food to sell in her village. She has been running the business since 1980 and earns around $3 per day. Koeurn is married with three children, and all her children live at home and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Nhanh Sem, is a construction worker who earns around $3 per day for the family. Because of the increasing cost of transportation for her family, Koeurn would like to have a motorcycle to help reduce costs and make it easier to quickly transport her vegetable crop to sell in the market. However, Koeurn lacks the money to carry out her plan. In this situation, she has requested a loan of $1,050 to purchase a motorcycle and also a pump machine to use for her vegetable growing. For her future plan, she aims to have a large farm to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and water pump

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She is a hair stylist. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. The frequent power outages have affected her business negatively. She is losing her customers to competitors who have generators.

Josephine needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase a generator that will help her to retain her customers. She also wants to buy more hair extensions to sell. This, she says, will enable her to retain her customers. She is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a generator and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Herlinda Susana

texts.en: Herlinda is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. Herlinda travels to regional fairs three times per week to buy grains, cheeses, animals, and anything else that she finds. She then brings her wares back with her to Ayacucho to sell wholesale. Herlinda also sells clothing in local markets. Herlinda is requesting a loan to buy grains and potatoes.  Her dreams are to have her own home, a stable business, and enough money to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy grains and potatoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que apoya económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 compró lana para confeccionar prendas para vender en su puesto de artesanía. Tiene casi un año y medio trabajando con el banco comunal. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará más lana y productos para venderlos en su puesto.
Francisca continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca G. is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) microfinance group in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a 43-year-old married mother of 3 children whom she supports financially.

With the first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased wool to make knitwear to sell in her handicraft stand. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase wool and handicrafts to sell in her stand.

Francisca continues to work in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and handicrafts

loans.name: Amtul Aziz M. Hafiz Group

texts.en:
My name is Amtul aziz and I’m 23 years old. I have lived in a mid-size city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. My husband's name is M. H., and he runs a grocery shop in the community. People are used to coming to him to buy groceries. He has a good reputation for dealing well with people. I have three sons, and all of them are enrolled in a school located near our house. As we all know, inflation is increasing day by day, and to survive I help my husband by making embroidered clothes. I charge $3 per dress. I use the amount I make to pay the school fees for my children. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand my husband’s grocery shop. 

I’m a group leader of some more women. Sugran baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Saba baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for her donkey cart. Iram baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Florence G. est une jeune femme très vaillante de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient depuis quelques mois une baraque de produits d’alimentation générale au bord de la route à Lomé. Avec ce crédit Florence souhaite acheter louer un magasin et l’approvisionner afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. A partir de ceci, elle gagnera plus d’argent pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Florence G. is a courageous young woman of 43, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been running a little general store for some months in a shed on the roadside in Lomé. With this loan, Florence hopes to buy or rent a little store and stock it so that she can respond to the needs of her clientele. In that way, she will earn more money to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rent a store and stock it

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chorn S. is a 51-year-old villager in Prasat village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. He gets a small income from this plantation, which he uses to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Choup Sophat (pictured at left), breeds pigs, chickens, and ducks to earn income. The couple has one child, who is a laborer.

Mr. Chorn S. is requesting a loan to buy two cows, which will be used for breeding and for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and for plowing.

loans.name: Vaimalu

texts.en: Vaimalu P., 47, is married with five children.  She has five years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala (~23 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaimalu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaimalu's loan will be used to purchase things to improve her business like sacks of fertilizer, knifes, chemicals and a wheelbarraow to make work easier for her. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, knifes, chemicals and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny owns a computer center where he types documents for his customers. He is 49 years old and married with 3 children. He hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase a printing machine. This he says will enable him retain his customers. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one printing machine

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P., age fifty, and his wife, Mrs. Seng Veng, age fifty-one, were married in 1979 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, three are garment factory workers and one is still in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Heng has been a fisherman for thirty years. His wife sells the fish in Takhmao market.  Because his fishing materials are old and broken, Heng is asking for a loan to purchase seine and bamboo to make traps for his fishing business. He will also buy materials to build a structure at the side of his house where he can raise cows.

loans.use: To buy materials to make traps for his fishing business and for building a structure by his house.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula pertenece al banco comunal “Las Fronterizas”,  del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, y es madre de 03 hijos, con estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercer grado de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas con S/. 300.00 nuevos soles como capital inicial.
En la actualidad su negocio viene superando la demanda proyectada, por ello requiere un capital adicional de S/. 2000.00 soles para aumentar su mercadería y comprar golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, enlatados frescos, etc., con la mira de convertirse en distribuidora al por mayor y con ello obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia, 
Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y bien surtida, así podría distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Paula belongs to the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Puno department. She is 36 and has three children. She went to high school for three years. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. She started her business of selling sweets with 300 PEN as her initial capital. Currently her business is going very well and demand for her products have exceeded her projections, therefore she needs additional capital for 2,000 PEN to increase her merchandise and buy candy, sodas, cookies, fresh canned goods, etc. She is looking to become a wholesale distributor so she can get better income to help her family. Her dream is to have a large, well stocked store. This way she could distribute wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, soft drinks, caramels, canned goods

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị N. is a 49 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 adult aged children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. N. is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa sells sachet mineral water in bulk. She buys the sachet water from suppliers and stores it in a fridge. She mostly carries it in a small pan on top of her head and sells through hawking. She has been in this business for five years now. She needs a loan to buy more bags of sachet water to upgrade her shop.

Yaa is 40 years old, married and the mother of five children. All her children are in elementary and junior high schools. She lives with her husband in the community of Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Prayer is the key’.

loans.use: To buy sachet water in bulk

loans.name: Santos Demetrio

texts.es: El señor Santos Demetrio M. Hernández, tiene la edad de 61 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, ubicado en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene seis hijos , ya todos casados e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Santos desde hace 41 años , se dedica a  la agricultura el inicio esta actividad agrícola con esfuerzos propios , los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una mejor producción, lo cual espera vender a buen precio en el M. y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Demetrio M. H. is 61 years old, lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood, located in the Ticuantepe community. He shares his home with his wife who helps with the household expenses. They have 6 children, all of whom are married and independent. His present goal is to improve his family's living conditions. For the past 41 years he has been involved in agriculture, an activity which he began with his own resources. His plans now are to diversify his crops. With this loan he intends to buy raw materials and fertilizers which he will use to improve production which he hopes to be able to sell at a better market price thereby obtaining greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles Martínez es una mujer casada tiene 4 hijos  a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta de abarrotería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener esta actividad. María es  una mujer muy responsable y que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Por lo que muchas veces sus vecinos recurren a ella para ciertos consejos. El dinero que solicita será destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, pan, jugos y refrescos naturales. En un futuro ella desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esto será para sus hijos y que el día de mañana no tengan necesidad de un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles Martínez is married with 4 children in her care. She dedicates herself to the sale of groceries. She has devoted herself to this business for more than 10 years. She has maintained this activity with great effort. María is a very responsible woman and enjoys interacting with her customers. Thus, many times her neigbors come to her for certain advice. The loan she is requesting will be used for working capital to purchase candy, basic grains, bread, juice and natural soft drinks. In the future, María wants to make improvements to her home to benefit her children, and so that in the future they will not want for a dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: 18 De Agosto Group

texts.es: El Grupo “18 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Marcela y conformado por 13 miembros entre los cuales 10 son mujeres y 3 varones. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como a la venta D. comida, empanadas y refrescos, cerámicas, zapatos, ropa y a la prestación D. diferentes servicios. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group “18 D. Agosto” (August 18th) is led by Sra. Marcela and consists of 13 members (10 women and 3 men). Most of the members have retail businesses selling products such as food, empanadas, soft drinks, ceramics, shoes, and clothing, as well as providing different services. The level of business competition is high, but the members are experienced enough to know that they must offer a variety of high-quality products in order for their businesses to succeed.

The loan they are requesting will be used to augment their working capital and expand their small businesses so that they can increase their earnings. This translates into a better quality of life for their families, which continues to improve each day. They are grateful for the confidence placed in them to continue working harder. The members are starting their first loan cycle together, but they have previous experience working in solidarity groups. Therefore, they promise to give it their all and move forward with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: La señora Claribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción - Picota”, Distrito D. Picota, Provincia D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años y 01 hijo, ya independiente.Claribel, lleva 20 años dedicándose al Alquiler D. Habitaciones, decidió sacar un préstamo en Manuela Ramos y con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00, siguió implemetanto y mejorando sus habitaciones. En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará cemento en bolsas, enchufes y pintura, para remodelar y dar una buena atención a sus clientes.Claribel, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Claribel belongs to the Mujeres en Acción – Picota Community Bank, Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 52, married, and has one independent child. Claribel has spent 20 years renting rooms. She decided to get a loan from Manuela Ramos. With her first loan for 300 PEN she set up and improved her rooms. She currently continues with the same business. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy bags of cement, electrical sockets, and paint in order to give good attention to her customers. Claribel is very pleased with what she has accomplished. She is happy that her business is going very well. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Amanda Lissette

texts.es:
La señora Amanda G. es una dama muy esforzada porque se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a su hogar por medio de la venta de golosinas, frutas y algunos comestibles y bebidas los cuales son ofertadas en un lugarcito a la intemperie en el colegio María Begoña en el municipio El Viejo.

Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los comestibles y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar por medio del trabajo digno y esforzado.

loans.use: Compra de los comestibles

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40 years old Frida L. from Mbozi. She is marriedwith 3 children, between the ages of 12  and 18. Frida has been running a shop  business since 2006. Client’s business is She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Frida currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase shop items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve quality and range of product. Frida thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 61 years old and a widow with four children. She sells sarongs and plastics of various colors and shapes. She is a hard working woman. She sells daily in her stall from 8am-6pm. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more sarongs and plastics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and plastics to sell

loans.name: Grover Alberto

texts.es: El señor Grover es un cliente antiguo que trabajo con el Grupo solidario "Angeles" desde el año 2002 y desde el 2006 comenzo a trabajar con credito individual en cuatro secuencias, hoy el cliente vuelve despues de 2 años de descanso. Hace un par de años el señor Grover se dedicaba a la peluqueria pero como el negocio no iba muy bien decidio cambiar de aires y comenzo un nuevo trabajo, por recomendacion de un amigo en una empresa que se dedica a la jardineria, paisajismo y mantenimiento de ambientes. Tras dos años trabajando con esa empresa el señor Grover vio en este rubro una gran oportunidad y que con sacrificio y su creatividad este podria llegar a ser una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya van 7 meses que Grover se independizo y hoy cuenta con cuatro clientes fijos, tiene un contrato con un Hotel  y este mes de noviembre comenzo a trabajar por recomendacion de uno de sus jefes en otro Hotel de cinco estrellas, es por eso que el cliente vino a solicitar un prestamo para invertir en herramientas y maquinaria que le serviran para agilizar sus servicios y asi poder atender mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Grover is a former client who has worked with the communal bank "Angeles" since 2002. Also, since 2006 he began to take out loans on an individual basis and he completed 4 loan cycles; today he returns after an interval of two years. For 2 years Señor Grover worked as a hairdresser but since that business was not doing well he decided on a change of pace and started a new job on the recommendation of a friend, in a company that does gardening, landscaping and other outdoor maintenance. After 2 years working with this firm Señor Grover saw a great opportunity in this line of work, and that with some sacrifice and creativity this could end up being a good source of income for his family. It's now been 7 months that Grover has been working independently, and today he has 4 regular customers. He has a contract with a hotel, and in this month of November he started to work for another five star hotel, based on the recommendation of one of his former bosses. For this reason he has come to request a loan to invest in tools and machinery that will help to speed up his services so that he can serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy machinery and tools for his trade as a gardener

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne M. is married and is the 32-year-old mother of two school-aged kids. She is a resident of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

Yvonne and her husband are both expert in making Nipa roofs (thatched roofs made from the leaves of the Nipa palm) and make this activity their major source of income. Their finished products are distributed to various places in Misamis Occidental. Yvonne and her husband are really working hard in order for them to support their family needs and to enable their children to pursue their studies in the future.

In 2008, Yvonne decided to join PMPC to gain access to financial services and now she is already on her third loan of 7,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional Nipa leaves because their customer numbers are now increasing.

loans.use: To purchase Nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, buli (raffia), nylon and other materials to make Nipa roofs

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhem C., age 37, is a local tailor who has been skilled in the enterprise since 2004, sewing both traditional and modern clothes for men and ladies who need them for parties and ceremonies. Her husband ( who appears in the picture above) is a Khmer musician who plays for wedding parties. The family lives with their two children, both of whom attend the local public school. Chhem C.'s husband now needs more instruments to perform his musical services, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.  She purposes to use the rest of the loan to buy an old vehicle for her traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy Khmer instruments and a vehicle for traveling needs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Estrella is widowed and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is forty-four years old. She is widowed and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Abena prepares and sells rice with beans from a table top by the roadside in her community. Abena buys the rice and beans from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans to prepare and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying mechanics supplies and equipment

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: A. Céline est née vers 1955 à Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle réside toujours.  Céline est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés.  Elle vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille.  Céline n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Céline vend les produits divers et les condiments à son domicile.  C’est à Dantopka, marché international du Bénin, que Céline s’approvisionne.  Céline a 30 ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité.  Céline a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle voudrait renforcer le stock de ses produits.  C’est pour ça qu’elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Céline A. was born around 1955 in the Zogbo neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she still lives. She is a widow and the mother of four children, all provided with schooling. Céline lives alone with her children and provides alone for them. She never attended school. To provide for her needs, Céline sells various products and condiments in her home-based store. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has an experience of 30 years' standing in this activity. So far Céline benefitted from two loans from Alidé which she repaid on schedule. She would like to expand her inventory. This is why she came to Alidé and applied for a third loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products and condiments

loans.name: Chyibylova Aysalkyn`s Group

texts.en:
Our first member of this solidarity group is Aysalkyn. She is a widow with two children. Both of the children are married and have their own children. Her only son lives with her and they have a common business. They fatten cattle and sheep and they keep some poultry. This loan will be used to buy five sheep. Her family started this business soon after the collapse of the USSR. Although this a little business, it is quite enough to cover the family expenses and that is the most important thing for Aysalkyn. 

Now let us introduce Jeken. She is 65 years. She is married and the loved mother of 10! children. She has also dozens of grandchildren. As she says, they are all her biggest achievement in her life. She has a livestock business. She started this business in 1994 with 4 cows and 20 sheep. Her average income per month is about $250 US. She also produces milk products. Her loan will be used to buy fodder.

Saliyahon, 73, is a married pensioner. Her husband is also a pensioner. She has five children: three daughters and two sons. She is involved in farming and livestock. They usually raise wheat and corn. Her loan will be used to buy one milking cow with a calf. 

Perizat is the youngest member of this group. She is just 22 years old. She has one infant. Her husband has a little yard where he fattens animals.  Also he resells them at the local animal market. Her loan will be used to buy fodder. She also wants to start farming and raise vegetables.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy five sheep

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Martha Elizabeth T. es una dama que se dedica a atender su pulpería en Managua donde ofrece todo tipo de productos principalmente comestibles tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, avena, galletas, pollo, entre otros.

Ella está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los comestibles para suplir los estantes de la pulpería y de esta manera seguir mejorando las condiciones del negocio.

Ella espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para salir adelante en el negocio y convertirse en una gran comerciante.
texts.en:
Martha is a very dedicated woman who runs a general store in Managua, where she sells all sorts of items, primarily food items such as rice, beans, sugar, oatmeal, gelatin, chicken, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in foods to stock her store's shelves and continue improving her business. She hopes that the loan will be granted in order to move her business forward and help her to become a great businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Kamuli A Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Moses, shown in the photo with his hand on his hat, is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a hardworking man who sells produce in Nyenge center, Lugazi, to meet his family’s requirements. The humorous 36-year-old has six kids who all go to school.

In a week, Moses reportedly makes 100,000 shillings out of his ten-year-old enterprise. With the loan he plans to purchase supplementary produce and to educate his kids even further. He sells beans, maize, coffee and millet to retail shop owners and employs one person in his business.

At first, Moses was employed by someone else in the same business, from which he got experience to do his own business. Moses is a polite, respectable man and a leader. His dream is to see all his children attend the best education.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, coffee and millet and to educate his children

loans.name: Florinda Paulina

texts.es: La Sra. Florinda tine 44 años de edad, ella es casada tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su conyugue se dedica  a la venta de zapatos como  recorredor,ella vive en casa propia de material noble en cual continuan construyendo  la parte de atrás, ella se inicio en este negocio con capital propio hace 8 años, ella cuenta con una bodega bien surtida y ubica en un lugar estrategico. La Sra. Florinda tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su casa bien construida, con el dinero que solicita invertira en la culminacion de la construccion de su casa.
texts.en:
Florinda is 44 years old, married and has a 7-year-old son. Her husband makes a living selling shoes. Florinda lives in a home she owns made of quality material, and construction is continuing on the home's backside. She started her business eight years ago with her own money and now has a well-stocked convenience store in a strategic location. Florinda has a lot of dreams and goals, one of which is to finish construction on her home. She plans to use the money she is requesting to fulfill that objective.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
