loans.use: Finish construction on her home.

loans.name: Magielyn's Group

texts.en:
Magielyn V. is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal Proper, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Magielyn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Magielyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Magielyn owns & operates a furniture making business, and she sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Magielyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Magielyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magielyn repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Magielyn is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Magielyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao M., 37, is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat temples. She sells groceries and raises pigs for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her son is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to buy more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia P. vive en el sector del Cruce del Carmen, perteneciente a la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte, con la parroquia Chiquintad, al este y al sur, con la ciudad de Cuenca, y al oeste, con la parroquia Sayausí. Dentro de Sinincay, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial es tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la colonial imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella, es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.

Nuestra socia  tiene una papelería hace 10 años en su casa, trabaja de domingo a domingo, también se dedica a la pastelería, la cual aprendió gracias a un curso hace 6 años y realiza solo bajo pedido
.
Doña Julia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija esta cursando los estudios universitarios y su segundo hijo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 12 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio, ahora con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su papelería, su meta es de crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia P. lives in Cruce del Carmen, which is part of the Sinincay Parish. This parish is located northeast of the Cuenca Canton. It's border to the north is the Chiquintad Parish; to the east and south, the city of Cuenca; and to the west, the Sayausí Parish. Within Sinicay, local artisans specialize in marble production and brick and tile manufacture. Some women make panama hats. The parish's church is traditional in its architectural beauty and its colonial image of the Virgin Mary of the Visitation, who is buried there. The Virgin's grave is the parish's most important attraction and is visited by many tourists. Our partner has run a school supply store from her home for the past ten years. She works seven days a week. In addition, Julia bakes. She learned six years ago after taking a course on cake-making and now bakes to order. Julia is 34 years old. She is married with two children, who are 19 and 12 years old. Her eldest daughter is currently pursuing a college education, while her younger son is still in school. Her husband is a bricklayer. The family does not have its own house, because they live with Julia's mother. Julia has been part of her community bank for 12 years. The loans she has received in the past have allowed her to build her business. With her new loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her school supply store. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, ballpoint pens, books, pencils, paper

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann M., who lives in Srei Chey village in Takeo province, is 38 years old. She has two positions: she is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family, and she owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money to support her family. 

Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sarann M. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries for resale. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a pure water seller, while the other is studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: La solicitante se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas teniendo como ingreso semanal s/250.00, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando. El destino del dinero es para incrementar su capital y necesidad personal
texts.en:
The applicant sells hamburgers. Her weekly income is 250 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and personal neeed

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Nana sells cassava and plantain at Elmina and has been in this business for thirty years. She uses the revenue she is able to gather from her sales to support her husband in taking care of her dependents.

Nana will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Jenta

texts.en: Jenta Mkamburi is a 26-year-old secondhand clothing hawker, a mother of two children, and married to Johnson Mwafuwe, who owns a garage in Jomvu where they reside. She has been in this business for the past three years and intends to add more stock of secondhand clothes to sell and boost her business with the anticipated profit. Being her first loan with KADET, she hopes to be successful in her business and in her life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Gina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gina; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos se dedica al comercio minorista y la socia vende ropa, La socia trae pedidos de la ciudad de Lima y de Juliaca, ella necesita aumentar su mercadería, ya que tiene pedidos de una institución de pantalones y chompas de cuello tortuga. La socia solicita el préstamo para  aumentar  su mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco department. Gina is 28 years old and a single mother with two children. She runs a small clothing business and fills her orders by bringing her merchandise from Lima and Juliaca. She needs to increase her inventory because she has an order for pants and turtle neck sweaters from an institution. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to increase her inventory. She is grateful to those who participate in this dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mr. Dy S., 58, is a general doctor who works in the community hospital. He owns a small clinic in his home where he sells medicine and examines patients who live nearby. Married to Teng Khorn, a 42-year-old who assists him in selling medicine, they are blessed with one young child who is enrolled in school. 

Dy S. faces difficulty traveling to work or anywhere else because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for transportation needs. As he lacks money to buy one, Dy S. decided to request a loan of US$1,200 to be used to purchase a new motorcycle. With the remainder of the loan, he will meet some of the requirements for his clinic.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosesa

texts.en:
Rosesa L. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Rosesa is single. To make a living, Rosesa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosesa has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosesa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun P. is a 25-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is married to Orl, age 30, who shares responsibility for the family by driving a car taxi. Her husband appears in the photo. He runs his business very well, because he has good communication skills which he uses with his customers. Unfortunately, the car is often broken down, and they spend a lot of money on repairs. She hopes to help her husband get a second-hand car, but she does not have enough money to make that possible. So, Khoeun P. requests a loan to purchase a used car for her husband to begin a service business.

loans.use: To purchase a used car for her husband to begin a service business

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya D. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 15 year old daughter in the Tuv province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local high school while Amarzaya and her husband operate the family business. They own a small car repair business which they began in 2004. They run a small tire and car repair and car washing center. The also  sell parts, oil, tires and wheel components through their repair center. Their business has grown quickly over the years and their earnings have enabled them to purchase a building that can be used as a service center and living accommodation. They also plan to pay for their daughter's tuition fees with their earnings. In the future, they hope to expand their business and establish a larger car repair center. 

Amarzaya is a very honest, modest and hardworking person. She is requesting an 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more lubricants and oils in wholesale quantities.

loans.use: To purchase more lubricants and oils

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana T., tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones,oficios domésticos, trabaja en la microempresa, en la producción y confección de ropa, dicho trabajo lo ha estado realizando desde hace mas de 3 años,con dicho trabajo a logrado sostener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera, quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se acerca a las instalaciones de ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de mas materia prima, quiere un negocio grande por esos hace esta inversión, solo asi podrá dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Juana T. is 30 years old, single, and has two sons.  She works at a small business making clothing and has been in this line of work for more than three years.  With her job, she has been able to support her two children, as she is a single mother.  She wants to increase her working capital, which is why she went to the ASDIR offices to request a loan for the purchase of more raw materials.  She wants to have a large business which is why she is making this investment because it is the only way that she will be able to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen María es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo y reside junto a su familia en el sector Túpac Amaru del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella prepara diversos platos de comida y chicha (bebida típica de la zona que se prepara a base de un tipo especial de harina de maíz), y los vende todos los fines de semana en un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio, adicionalmente vende cerveza. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por ello ha decidido ampliarlo con la preparación de más platos, para lograrlo ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes.

Carmen es una mujer responsable y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen María is a mother who is 24 years old, she has one child and resides with her family in the Túpac Amaru sector of the agricultural district called Tambogrande. This area is located in the Piura region, situated more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capitol of the Lambayeque region.

She prepares and sells diverse dishes of food and chicha (a typical drink of this area, which is prepared from a base of a special type of corn flour). She sells these things from a small room in her home every weekend. Additionally, she sells beer. With the income she earns from this activity, she helps her husband to sustain the daily economic well-being of their family. 

The business has had a very good reception by their customers and thus Carmen has decided to expand with the preparation of more dishes. To do this, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in the purchase of consumables and ingredients.

Carmen is a responsible woman and home-loving person. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and ingredients to expand her business of production and sale of food.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gerardo es un hombre muy esforzado y trabajador pues le ha tocado trabajar  a pequeñas empresas realizando cuentas contables a su negocio. 
Ya que su oficio es de contabilidad y que ha venido realizando desde hace años para lograr pagar sus gastos.
Hoy en día vive solo, con un hijo a quien apoya con sus estudios. Su mayor meta es la realización de su vivienda que está bien deteriorada por ser la madera ya muy vieja,  y que ha venido comprando materiales de construcción, con los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado, y que espera iniciar con este nuevo financiamiento ya que tiene piedras, arena, piedrín comprados y que comprara cemento, zinc, reglones, clavos, bloques para comenzar el arranque de dicha obra. En donde está contento porque será posible una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard working, dedicated man.  He has worked as an Accountant for small firms.  He is an Accountant and has worked as such for many years to cover expenses.

He currently lives alone with his son for whom he pays school costs.  His greatest goal is to fix up his house because it’s old and made of wood and is quite deteriorated.

He has been buying building materials and supplies with the loans that Afodenic has granted him. He hopes to start the project with this new loan.  He already has purchased stone, sand and gravel and now will buy cement, zinc metal sheeting, mason's levels, nails and concrete blocks to start the projects. He is happy because this will make a better dwelling possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Debora Antonia

texts.es: Debora Antonia tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida. Cuando el inicio fue con el apoyo de su esposo pues no tenía los suficientes gastos para sufragar su hogar ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, adornos, toallas, perfumes y calzado. Sueña con ampliar su vivienda y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Debora Antonia is 36 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has had her business for more than 13 years.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her work.  She started her business with her husband's support since he didn't earn enough to cover their household expenses.  Debora Antonia has two dependent children and is requesting a loan to buy products such as sheets, decorations, towels, perfumes and footwear.  She dreams of extending her home and improving her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Consuelo; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la administración de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en el primer piso y ella acondicionó para tener ahí una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia vende todo tipo de productos en especial arroz, leche, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar víveres para implementar la tienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the "MINKA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Consuelo is 45 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her business is running her grocery store.  She has a small store in her home, on the first floor.  She remodeled her home so that she could have a store there where she could sell essentials.  She sells all sorts of products, especially rice, milk, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.  She is requesting this loan to buy food products to stock her store.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy food products to stock her store

loans.name: Omar René

texts.es: El Señor Omar se dedica a la venta de mochilas, maletas y también juguetes, el desde muy temprana edad realiza esta actividad por que de esta forma él genera ingresos para la manutención de su Mama y sus hermanos, el es huérfano de padre desde hace varios años.  Lamentablemente en la zona que estaba su domicilio hubo una falla geológica y tuvieron que desalojar su vivienda por que así lo dispuso la Alcaldía pero entonces adquirieron una casa cerca de su anterior vivienda donde no había ningún problema con el suelo y esto fue para ellos una situación muy difícil, ya que dejar su casa en estas condiciones, pero lo superaron y ahora se encuentran muy bien, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mochilas por cantidad ya que están empezando la época de clases y tendrá mucha venta, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Omar sells book bags, suitcases, and toys.  He began doing this at an early age because it allowed him to earn an income to help support his mother and brothers.  He's been without a father for several years.

Unfortunately, there was a geologic fault in the zone where his home was located, and they had to raise the house by order of the town council.  They later acquired a house close to their old one, where there were no problems with the ground.  This was a difficult situation for them, having to leave their home under these circumstances, but they managed to get through it and are doing well now.

They will use the money from this loan to buy book bags in quantity, now that classes are starting and he will have more sales.  He is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 56, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on small plot of a land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. 

She began her food and consumer goods trading business in 2000. She operates a grocery store where she also sells other goods. She has received six previous loans from our bank and she always pays her loans back on time. 

Tungalag wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more food and other goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and other goods for resale

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen V., 30, resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. is a farmer and grows vegetables, earning an income of aproximately $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more vegetable seeds to improve his farming business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more vegetable seeds to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Iris Cecibel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Iris, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores que estudian en universidad y la menor de 17  años que estudian en colegio, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una escuela en Higuerón.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Trabaja tres días a la semana por las mañanas. Ella  deja a crédito los productos a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil, nos cuenta que lleva 1 año y seis meses y que empezó su negocio con el primer crédito y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de temporada playera como trajes de baños de hombres y mujeres, camisetas, bermudas entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque a través de estos créditos empezó su negocio que le permite ganarse la vida honradamente. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres Organizadas Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte Canton. This place is known for the delicious sweets that are prepared by the locals and are well-known throughout the country.

This is where we met Iris. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage. The two older children are in college and the youngest is 17 years old and is in high school. They all still live with her. Her husband works at a school in Higuerón.

She works selling all types of clothing from door to door and from her house when her customers need something. She works three days each week in the mornings. She leaves the products with her customers on credit and collects the money each weekend. Iris buys the clothing in Guayaquil. She tells us that she has had the business for 1 year and 6 months, and she started her business with the first loan. It has gone well for her.

This loan is to purchase seasonal beach clothing like men’s and women’s bathing suits, T-shirts, Bermuda shorts, and other items. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she enjoys it because as a result of these loans, she started her business which allows her to earn a living honorably. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy bathing suits, T-shirts, Bermuda shorts, and other clothing items for the beach season.

loans.name: Diosnel Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Diosnel tiene 61 años de edad, es separado, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes a él, vive en el barrio denominado Calle Yvate de la ciudad de Itá, posee un puesto comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad hace mas de 20 años, allí realiza la venta de diversos artículos como ser bazar, regalos, juguetes, bijouteri y artículos de  santería.
Solicita el préstamo en esta ocasión para surtir sus artículos de juguetería con la compra de camioncitos, pelotas, muñecas, mochilas y otros juguetes y artículos de santería.
El señor Diosnel demuestra ser una persona muy seria, responsable y trabajadora, manifiesta que dicha ganas de trabajar lo trae desde muy joven ya que proviene de una familia muy humilde que siempre le inculcó la responsabilidad.
Gracias a esta profesión mejoró su nivel de vida y ayudó a sus hijos a estudiar para que puedan ser personas útiles a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Diosnel is 61 years old, separated, and his children are grown and independent.  He lives in the Calle Yvate neighborhood of Itá. For more than 20 years he has had a shop in the city marketplace where he sells a wide variety of items such as household goods, gifts, toys, jewelry and trinkets, and santería items (santería is a blend of traditional African beliefs with Christianity).

He is requesting the loan at this time in order to increase his stock of toys by purchasing toy trucks, balls, dolls, backpacks and other toys, and santería items. 

Sr. Diosnel has shown himself to be a very serious, responsible and hardworking person. He has been working since he was very young, and comes from a very humble family who instilled him with responsibility. 

Thanks to his profession he improved his quality of life and helped his children study so they could be useful members of the community.

loans.use: Compra de juguetes y artículos de santería

loans.name: Hilda Marisella

texts.es: Hilda Marisella P.: es una señorita de 25 años de edad es soltera y nos cuenta que desde muy pequeña empeso a trabajar ahora cuenta con un negocio propio desde hace años, ella solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos en bariedad y al mismo tiempo agrandar mas su negocio ya que para la semana santa empieza la buena venta ella quiere comprar,bolsas,carteras para dama,cosmeticos y joyeria,ella confia en que fape le dara la oportunidad de superarse ya que hasta la fecha ella se a esforsado sola para superarse el sueño de ella es seguir estudiando y espera lograrlo con el apoyo que fape le pueda brindar para poder trabajar en el dia y estudiar en la noche.
texts.en: Hilda Marisella P. is a 25 year old young woman. She is single and tells us that since she was very little she has worked. Now she has had her own business for some years. She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of cosmetics and at the same time enlarge her business, since during Holy Week sales are good. She wants to buy women's bags and wallets, cosmetics and jewelry. She trusts that Fape will give her the chance to get ahead since so far she has worked alone to get ahead. Her dream is to keep going to school and she hopes to attain this with the support that Fape can give her to be able to work during the day and study at night.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics and to buy gold jewelry

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B. is 60 years old and lives in a home she owns with her husband and four children. She makes a living by raising livestock while her husband works in construction. 

In 2007, Mercedita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid six previous loans and is applying for a new one, for PHP 14,000, to buy feed for her livestock.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 33 years old and married with three children, and one child is in school. Raquel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, etc. in her variety store.

Raquel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other grocery items. 

In the future Raquel would like to save enough money so she can send all her children to school.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hede

texts.en: For the past 12 years, Hede has been selling corn dough, cloth and cooking utensils at Elmina near Ntranoa, a village in Cape Coast. She is married to a prison officer and together they live with their two children. Hede wants to expand her cloth business and so needs a loan  to buy cloth on a larger scale so she can supply her customers. The profit that will be realized from the sale of the cloth will be used to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth on a larger scale so she can supply her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been farming in Kitale, western Kenya, for 20 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and fruits which are sold to the local market. She earns additional income from her business selling secondhand clothes and paraffin to the local market.

Jane is 39 years old and married with 6 school-aged children who all attend school. She has made a loan request of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase chickens and chicken feed. She says that this will enable her to expand her poultry farm and practice commercial poultry farming. The income generated from this project will enable her to pay her children's school fees and improve her family's livelihood. She hopes that in the next 5 years her poultry farm will have expanded and that she will be able to venture into the breeding business.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nieve Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Nieves, tiene 64 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias, su hija menor es quien aun vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Para ganarse la vida y así poder colaborar con su esposo en los gastos del hogar ella instaló un pequeño puesto de comida en el sector por donde ella vive, allí trabaja todas las tardes en la venta de sus deliciosos platos y en las mañanas se dedica a preparar todo lo que va a vender. Además de comida prepara y vende ricos corviches y empanadas que a sus clientes les encantan, nos cuenta que su especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada. Lleva en su negocio por más de 10 años ya que a la gente le encanta sus platos.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, maní, plátano, pescado entre otros ingredientes necesarios para los deliciosos platos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gustan los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y gozar de mucha salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a place where many of the people work in agriculture and livestock production, the communal bank "Quiroga" meets every 15 days. 

Here we meet Nieves, 64, who is married and has 6 children who are now grown and have their own families.  Her youngest daughter still lives with her and her husband is a farmer.

In order to make a living and help her husband with the household expenses, she set up a small food stand in the neighborhood where she lives.  There she works every afternoon selling her delicious dishes.  In the mornings she makes everything that she is going to sell.  In addition to prepared meals, she sells corviche (an Ecuadorian dish made of fried banana dough and seafood) and empanadas that her customers love.  She tells us that her specialty is rice and beans and carne asada.  She has been running her business for 10 years, since the people love her cooking.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, peanuts, bananas, fish and other ingredients that she needs to make her delicious dishes.  She has been with her communal bank almost from the start, and she enjoys the benefits she receives from the institution.

Her dreams are to have a big restaurant and to see herself and her loved ones enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, peanuts, bananas, fish and other ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester is 38 years old. He is a dairy farmer and married to Mary, who is a mixed-crop farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 14 and 10. He has been in the farming business for the past nine years, with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family members.   

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying previous loans successfully. Silvester will use the loan to purchase more dairy cows. With the anticipated profit, he will expand more on the dairy farming. 

His hope is to venture into poultry and pig farming and educate his children to their satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella preparar platos como sopas, estofado de pollo, pollo al horno entre otros platos, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Nueva Generacion III" community bank in the district of Cusco, Peru. She is 54 years old, married and has a son. She splits her time between her household responsibilities and her restaurant, where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner. She makes items such as soups, chicken dishes and other meals. She works from 9 a.m. until 8 p.m. and in this way makes headway for her family. She wants to expand her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients like meat, chicken and vegetables. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 53 years old, sells gruel. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. She has five children. Three are studying and two are working in the factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $7 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fish, meat and vegetables to sell in her village. She has not sold those things before, but she wants to start selling them to make more income. Her current career can make only a small income, so she wants to get two careers to support each other. 

And if the new career can work well, she will stop selling gruel and extend her second career instead.

loans.use: To buy fish, meat and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Renzo Edemir

texts.es:
Renzo, vive con esposa y una hija, es casado, cría cerdos y trabaja en albañilería, el negocio lo aprendió en su casa ya que vive frente a un lugar donde compran, venden y matan cerdos, no tiene horario fijo en su negocio.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos y engordarlos, esta compra le ayudara en crecer y ampliar el negocio.
Tiene por objetivo aumentar la granja, en numero de cerdos y en terreno, para que esten más comodos y que este crecimiento le traiga mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Renzo is married and lives with his wife and daughter. He raises pigs and also does masonry work. Renzo learned his business at home since he lives in front of a place that buys, sells, and butchers pigs. He does not work on a fixed schedule when running his business.

Renzo is requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed for their diet so that he can fatten them. This purchase will help to grow and expand his business. His goal is to expand his farm, in terms of the number of pigs and the amount of land that he owns. With this growth, he will be able to improve his income and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a mechanic. Nga earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. 

Nga would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages to stock her general store

loans.name: Nancy Amanda

texts.es: la señora Nancy desde hace cinco años se dedica al comercio de calzados vendiendo estos al por mayor y menor, dicha actividad lo realiza con la colaboración de su hermana, compran la mercadería en la ciudad de Oruro trasladan la mercadería hasta Cochabamba  donde es distribuida la mercadería tanto a los comerciantes en los mercados como también a personas particulares, viven en domicilio en alquiler ambas hermanas, durante la visita se pudo observar que han incrementado su capital de trabajo gracias al crédito que anteriormente obtuvieron  y con este nuevo crédito desean mejorar aun mas su situación económica con la compra de calzados por mayor para esta temporada de fin de año ya que tienen muchos pedidos, la Sra. Nancy es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su deseo es el de poder distribuir mercadería  por cantidad a todos los mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy has been selling shoes wholesale and retail for the past five years. She runs this business in collaboration with her sister. They buy the merchandise in the city of Oruro and move it to Cochabamba where it is distributed to merchants in the markets as well as to private individuals.  

The two sisters live in a rented home. During a visit we could see that they have increased their working capital thanks to the loan that they obtained earlier. With this new loan they want to improve their economic situation even more by buying shoes wholesale for this end-of-the-year season, since they have already had many orders.

Sra. Nancy is a responsible and hardworking person. She wants to be able to distribute merchandise in large quantities to all the markets in the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale for the end of the year.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Banku is made from fermented corn dough and cassava dough. Araba makes banku at Essiam near Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Araba has been selling banku for 10 years. She helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to help make banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant. She is showing the pot she uses for the preparation of the banku.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make banku.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Salif habite au sud du sénégal.Agé de 31 ans célibataire sans enfant.Depuis 2007,il s'est lancé dans le commerce d'alimentation,qui fonctionne trés bien avec l'emplacement de sa boutique au centre de la ville.
Salif démare sa jounée de 08h termine à 23h.Il est trés actif dans son commerce,avec ses bénéfices ,il soutiends sa famille étant le fils aine de la famille.Dans les prochaines années ,il veut ouvrir une autre boutique pour associer ses petits frére dans son commerce pour mieux gérer leur famille.
texts.en: Salif lives in southern Senegal. He is 31 years old, single and has no children. He has been selling food from his shop, favourably located in the center of town, since 2007. He is very industrious; his workdays start at 8 am and end at 11 pm. Being the eldest child, he uses his profits to support his family. In the coming years he would like to open another store and, in order to better manage the family´s needs, he plans to employ his younger brothers.

loans.use: to restock on products including drinks (Coke, Fanta and fruit juices), pineapple and eggs.

loans.name: Kishimjan's Group

texts.en:
Kishimjan is the leader of this group. She is 25 years old. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 50000 soms, she started her own business. She sells women's clothes made of Kyrgyz national fabrics and materials. Her mother helps her in running the business. In two years, Kishimjan has achieved good results. She increased the commodity turnover, and now her monthly profit is about 20000 soms. At the moment, Kishimjan has decided to invest money in livestock. She wants to purchase lambs for breeding, but she needs some additional funds. Thus, she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase lambs for breeding. In the future, she dreams of opening her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase lambs for breeding.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono) y pago de mano de obra, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas, este su segundo prestamo, en el primer compro insumos agricolas, los cuales dieron buen resultado para la produccion, logrando vender una parte para poder pagar el prestamo.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar ingresos económicos y llevar a su familia a mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Martin is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer) and pay laborers.  This will help him to improve his harvests.  This is Martin's second loan.  He used his first loan to buy agricultural supplies which gave him good results with his production.  He managed to sell part of his harvest to repay his loan.

Martin's biggest dream is to continue working so that he can improve his financial income and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 60 years old and married to Mary. Together they have four children, aged 18, 16, 14 and 10 years old. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from his business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase cloth materials to add more clothes.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into his business. His dream is to improve his family's welfare and have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase material.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 41-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of seven children.

Kawthar is a tailor. She operates from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business such as needles, fabric and thread.

Kawthar is looking to increase her income so that she can finance her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as needles, thread and fabric

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda is 46 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She is single.

Gerarda is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and medicines for her pig business.

Gerarda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Gerarda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for pig-growing business

loans.name: C9249 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en: Drocella is 35 years old and has one child who is 10 years old. She sells bananas. Her business is open from 6am until 6pm every day. She is the leader of the group, called "C9249 Abadahemuka" in the local language. Drocella has two years of experience in this work. Drocella has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more quantities of bananas to sell. With this profit, she expects to save money for buying the families food, to save money and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of bananas.

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Nimasac Group

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian en el nivel primario, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos de diferentes diseños, inició con un pequeño capital y los prestos nada mas y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para tricotado y tejidos de cortes típicos, espera ene el futuro contar con un negocio grande y con operarios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al tejido de cortes típicos, elaboración de candelas y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Andrea, age 28, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has three children, two of whom are in elementary school. Andrea weaves traditional clothing. She started off with only a small amount of capital and some loans, and she now has eight years' experience.
She has organized a group to request a loan which she will use for the purchase of threads for knitting and weaving traditional clothing. She hopes to have a big business with employees in the future. Some other group members also weave traditional clothing; others make candles or raise small animals.

loans.use: to buy threads for weaving traditional clothing.

loans.name: Karina Jaqueline

texts.es:
Karina de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora ya que es vendedora ambulante de joyería y bisutería. Comenzó su trabajo vendiendo por revista y catálogos ahora tiene un grupo de clientes estables. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo la joyería y bisutería. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su familia por eso quiere continuar trabajando vendiendo joyas.  El préstamo lo quiere comprar bisutería y joyas y así poder tener más ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los pagos de la casa ya que el trabaja en mantenimiento de locales.
texts.en:
Karina, age 35, is a hardworking woman. She sells jewelry and costume jewelry door-to-door. She began selling through magazines and catalogues. Now, she has a group of established customers. Currently, she works from very early in the day selling jewelry and costume jewelry.

Karina has a lot of aspirations for her family. That’s why she wants to continue her work selling jewelry. The loan she wants is for the purchase of jewelry and costume jewelry. It will enable her to have more income in order to help her husband with household expenses. He does maintenance work in businesses.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La socia Catalina continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras en los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco la soica también continua con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra tarwi, quinua, trigo para abatecer su mercado, la socia comprara tarwi, trigo, quinua y los llevara a vender a los mercados diversos en la ciudad de Cusco, de esta manera la socia desea continuar con su crecimiento economico y mejorar la calida de vida.
texts.en: Catalina continues with her business buying and selling vegetables in markets in the city of Cusco.  She also continues raising small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs and sheep.  On this occasion, she wants to use the loan to buy tarwi [lupine], quinoa and wheat to supply her market.  She will buy tarwi, wheat and quinoa and will take them to sell in various markets in the city of Cusco.  In this way, she wishes to continue her economic growth and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tarwi, wheat and quinoa.

loans.name: Rina Luz

texts.es:
Rina es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años Rina se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Carnero para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Rina puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, en las mañanas vende desayunos y en las tardes vende unos deliciosos pollipapas, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para su negocios, tales como: papas, aceite, panes, embases, cubiertos descartables, entre otros y rodo en cantidad para abastecer su negocio; de esta manera Rina podrá seguir trabajando, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su restaurant campestre.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos par su negocio.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a mom, who is ready and raring to go to face the world and have a full life thanks to her efforts. She is a 54-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small rural town in Central Kenya. Esther and her husband have been blessed with four children. For 10 years, Esther has been a mixed-farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden. Any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Esther, however, is taking this a little step further. Esther is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 45 years old married and mother of two children, she lives in one of the under privileged areas called Dairalla. ‎Nawal has started her own business for five years ago to be able to help her husband expenses and insure a good life for ‎her children.‎
She sells clothes at her house beside her job in public sector to have another income and improve her life with her kids. ‎Now Nawal is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell and increase her incomes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and increase her incomes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy more packs of sweets, biscuits, cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Twenty years ago Josefina started her store with the help of her husband and children. She is a ery hard working and active person and has watched her business grow little by little. Sadly, her husband died and josefina is working her her store alone. She currently is receiving financial help from her children but Josefina wants to continue with her business. She doesn't have enough money to invest in merchandise. In order to do this, she needs a loan of $650.

For Josefina, it is difficult to start again without her husband. She knows that with her children's help, she can continue on with her business. You can help Josefina in these difficult times when she needs help and care. She sincerely thanks you for any help you can give.

Hace veinte años, L. señora Josefina inició su negocio D. abarrotes con ayuda D. su esposo y D. sus hijos, elL. es una persona muy activa y trabajadora, y ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco. Lamentablemente murió su esposo y elL. se quedó soL. al frente D. su tienda, ahora recibe el apoyo económico D. sus hijos, pero elL. quiere continuar con su negocio, no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para surtirse D. mercancía, por lo que necesita D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 650 dólares que empleara con este fin.

Para Josefina es difícil iniciar D. nuevo sin su esposo, pero con L. ayuda D. sus hijos sabe que podrá sacar adelante su negocio. Tú puedes ayudar a Josefina en estos momentos difíciles, elL. necesita D. tu apoyo y cariño, y agradece sinceramente toda L. ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use:
Purchase Merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Dilcia Maria

texts.en:
My name is Dilicia A. and I make women's clothing. I have been doing this for four years and right now I need to buy a lot of material to make some graduation outfits for a school. I would use the earnings to buy myself another sewing machine and to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dilcia A. me dedico a la produccion de vestidos y trajes para damas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, en estos momentos necesito comprar mucha tela para hacer unos uniformes de graduacion de un colegio, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otra maquina de cocer y alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy material, needle, thread and sewing machine equipment/compra de telas, hilos, agujas, repuestos para maquinas de cocer.

loans.name: Mary Ngwen

texts.en:
Born in 1975, Mary Ngwen is married to a polygamist, Nde Christain and is the mother of six children. Given the heavy burden on her husband to provide basic needs for her children and those of her maids, she saw the need to start a business of selling tomatoes. However, this business did not succeed because she lacked capital to start off. This led her to seek help from GHAPE and she became a member in 2007. She was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to continue in her line of business and raise money to pay school fess and provide food for her children. She plans to pay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.ru:
Born in 1960, Mehman N. is married and has 3 children. In 2003, he opened a food mini market. Healthy sales helped Mehman to grow his business. This year, Mehman turned to NorMicro for help financing renovation of his store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нагиев Мехман, 1960 года рождения. Женат, имеет троих детей. 2003 году он открыл свой мини маркет.С хороший торговли начал развиваться.В этом году он обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала за помощью.Мехман хочеть ремонтировать свой мини маркет.

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is originally from Igbelerin, a rural part in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is married and has five children. She travels to other neighboring villages to buy cassava for processing local food.  She has been in business since 1997.  She is a LAPO member.  She needs the loan of $400 to buy more cassava to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for the processing of Santana

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married mother of 36 years of age and she has four children. Through the years they have lived on fishing as their main source of income. Her husband is a very supportive man who has always loved fishing and he is always thinking of a way to develop it into a different standard. In the past they have used fishing nets, but with her first loan she will be buying a canoe for fishing. Maria is one happy mother who appreciates the chance given to her with which she will be able to develop her business as well as provide for her family.

loans.use: Maria would like to buy fishing gear for her family's fishing business.

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en: I am Imtiaz A. D.. I live in a brick house in Multan, Pakistan, with husband and son, who is 12 years old. My son attends school and is in grade three. I embroider clothes and want to expand this business. I have a flair for this work, and I feel I can do well. With the profits I plan to remodel my house .I have few friends who are my neighbors, and we would like to borrow as a group. We are responsible for each other's loans. Hajran B., Sakina B., and Shakila B. need loans for their furniture business. Shamim B. needs this loan to buy a rickshaw. These are very hard-working entrepreneurs and need loans to improve their businesses.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Eyitayo

texts.en: Eyitayo O. is 50 years old, has three children and is divorced. She lives in Lyanuran, Lagos state. She produces and supplies bread to surrounding communities and markets. She is soliciting for a loan of $1200 to enable her to increase her production unit limit.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, and yeast in bulk in order to increase production.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati R. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, a son and a daughter. Her son is studying for a BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) and her daughter is in grade 12.

Mrs. R. and her husband, Mr. Samundra Man Rangit, opened their small hotel 8 years ago. Their children help them at their hotel. They also sell Newari foods as well as dal, and bhat (Nepali food) in their shop. The local demand for Newari foods is increasing rapidly because they are tasty, and in order to meet this demand, Mrs. R. is asking for her fourth loan. She will use it to buy food, material, and furniture for their hotel. The economic conditions of their family are not that good, so she wants to invest in the hotel to increase their income and upgrade the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy food, material, and furniture

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia R., native to Chinandega, Nicaragua, lives in the town of Somotillo, where she runs her own business selling clothes in small quantities. This is her only source of income and is able to support her two sons who attend school.

Like all Nicaraguan women, Mrs. Lucia is a hard-working person, and despite some hardships is always looking for work in order to sustain her home and family. Ceprodel has greatly supported her business through the disbursement of some previous loans, which have enabled her to acquire merchandise which she was able to sell to various customers.

Once again, she is confident that this new loan will be granted, and is therefore confidentally awaiting its disbursement.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Lucia R. es originaria del departamento de Chinandega en Nicaragua y vive en el municipio de Somotillo en el cual tiene su propio negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa en menores cantidades siendo este su único ingreso con el que sustenta a sus dos hijos escolares.

Como toda mujer nicaragüense, la señora Lucía es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las adversidades siempre está en pie buscando el trabajo para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Ceprodel ha apoyado grandemente su negocio por medio de la entrega de créditos que le han permitido adquirir su mercadería para ofertarla a los diferentes clientes. Una vez más confía en que su crédito será otorgado y por esta razón es que espera confiadamente en la institución.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise  (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Ebo

texts.en:
Ebo Q. sells both alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. He is married and has 5 children. His income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is going very well, so he wishes to increase sales to improve his income, but he is running out of stock.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 43 years old, joined the fund in 1996. Her family put their first loans towards the difficult and dingy business of brick making. After many years in the business, her family was able to reduce their hardships, although the income from the brick-making business was not much compared to a number of other more strenuous professions. 

After careful consideration, Mrs. Nguyễn and her husband decided to completely changed their family business. They established a breakfast shop. Their sales skills, care and cleanliness attract a lot of customers to their shop which provides a steady source of income. Mrs. Nguyễn and her husband have two children – one attends school and the other is employed with an income of 1,500,000 VND a month. 

They want to raise 15,000,000 VND to invest in their breakfast shop business. Their average monthly income is 3,500,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer. 

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng 43 Tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1996, qua các vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào dự án thủ công nghề gốm, làm gạch, với việc vay vốn đầu tư vào nghề này sau nhiều năm gia đình chị cũng đã bớt đi những khó khăn, tuy nhiên việc thu nhâp từ nghề này lại không được cao so với một số nghề khác mà lại vất vả hơn, sau khi tính toán kỹ anh và chị đã mạnh giạn chuyển hướng kinh doanh sang bán hàng ăn sáng, với cái duyên bán hàng của anh chị cùng với sự cận thận, sạch sẽ nên khách hàng đến quán chị ăn rât đông nguồn thu nhâp cao hơn và đều đặn hàng ngày, anh chị có 2 con, 1 con đang đi học, 1 con đi làm công nhân thu nhâp 1.500.000đ/ tháng. 

Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ. đầu tư thêm vốn vào bán hàng ăn sáng. Thu nhập bình quân gia đình: 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea K., 32, lives in a small village on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River, about 10 miles from the capital city of Phnom Penh. She is single and resides with her aging parents and one brother.

Since she was 15, Sophea has supported herself and her family by weaving silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in their village, who then resells it in Phnom Penh. To help grow her business, Sophea is requesting a loan of $200 U.S. dollars to buy more silk to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is married. She worked for a time as a market vendor. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual outerwear for women in one of the local markets. Moreover, Lyubov also owns a hairdressing business offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her clients. She has been in this business for about 2 years.

Lyubov is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Lyubov would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise and re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her clothing trade. Lyubov believes that having an assortment of women's outerwear that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase necessary merchandise

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une couturière encore célibataire qui travaille dans un atelier avec d'autres. Elle a plus de cinq ans d'expérience dans cet activité, elle sollicite ce crédit de 150 000 fcfa pour acheter une machine pour faire face à ses nombreuses commandes. Ce qui va lui permettre d'augmenter ses gains, aider ses parents, et de s'occuper de lui.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a dressmaker. She is single and works in a salon with other dressmakers. She has more than five years experience in dressmaking and she is asking for this 150,000 FCFA loan ($350) to buy a sewing machine to fulfill her many orders. This will allow her to increase her profit, help her parents and look after herself.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is 45 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the south of Lebanon. Abbas owns a shop where he sells artificial flowers and decorative items for the home. Abbas is an energetic and active man who has always found new ways to grow and advertise his business. Most recently, Abbas requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to help purchase a diverse array of new decorative items and flowers. Abbas wants to create an impressive flower display in front of his store to attract more clients. Abbas has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua Al Majmoua for the past five years and has always repaid his loans in full and on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase artificial flowers

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana and her husband (who is pictured) have two children. Tarana is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Karimbayli village. Tarana was born in 1976.

Tarana's husband has been making doors and windows for four years. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) for buying necessary materials for making doors and windows.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Giovanny

texts.es:
Giovanny forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II”, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Giovanny tiene 38 años de edad. Comenta que junto a su esposo y a sus 02 hijos ha podido mantenerse tranquila en su vida sin muchos problemas difíciles que afrontar. Ambos empezaron su negocio con poca inversión y que ahora tienen invertido un promedio de S/.10,000 en todo su negocio. Vende ambulatoriamente costales, rafias (hilos para cocer en canastas y sacos) y agujas. Todos los lunes vende en la feria de Huaraz y los jueves cerca al puente Bolívar. También comenta que ha crecido y que en la actualidad todo le va bien porque incluso ella y su esposo han podido construir su casa gracias a este negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de costales y costalillos en cantidad porque ya empiezan las cosechas en esta zona.
 
A Giovanny le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también poder mejorar tanto su vida personal como familiar.
texts.en:
Giovanny belongs to the community bank of Senor del Cautivo II, district of Independence, and department of Ancash. Giovanny is 38 years old, she lives with her husband and 2 children. They both started a business with a small investment, that now has about S/.10,000 of investment. They sell sawing supplies: treads, needles. They sell every Monday at the Huaraz market and on Thursdays near the Bolivar Bridge. The business keeps on growing very well, and it helped them pay for their house. With the loan of S/.1,200 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will invest buying supplies because harvest time is almost in. Giovanny wants to study to improve her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Romel González Group

texts.es:
G/s ABORIGEN de la comarca san francisco de la comunidad de Nindiri, compuesto por personas de bajos recursos económicos y que lo único que necesitan es un financiamiento de adim para hacer crecer sus negocios, ellos su créditos lo utilizan en capital de trabajo compran en el mercado municipal de Masaya por mayor y venden al detalle en su casa de habitación, quieren fortalecer sus negocios por que dicen que tenerlo en sus casas le permite cuidar de sus hijos y de su hogar.
Don Maylorc vende tarjetas de celulares de movistar y claro , el comenzó su negocio con un pequeño capital que le obsequiaron sus padres, por ser una persona bien trabajadoras y honesta con los prestamos de adim logro que  la empresa claro le diera la oportunidad de tener  un teléfono móvil en su casa y hoy presta este otro servicio.  Doña Elisa tiene la oportunidad de contar con la ayuda de su esposo, los cuales entre los dos preparan los nacatamales y los comercializan en el mercado de Masaya. Su mayor sueño es de llegar a tener un negocio en el mercado municipal de Masaya, pues ellos tienen experiencia en la comercialización de frutas.
texts.en:
The “Aborigen” group from the San Francisco area of Nindiri is made up of people with few economic resources who need funding from Kiva's partner ADIM to help their businesses grow. They will use the money as working capital to buy wholesale merchandise at the Masaya municipal market. They will then sell the merchandise at retail prices from their homes, which allows them to work while taking care of their children and homes.

Maylorc sells Movistar and Claro brand prepaid cellular phone cards. His parents gave him a small amount of capital to start his business. Since he is a very hardworking and has been responsible with previous loans from ADIM, the Claro company gave him the opportunity to have a mobile phone at his home. He has now expanded his business to include the sale of prepaid cards.

Elisa works with her husband making pork tamales steamed in banana leaves and selling them at the Masaya market. Her dream is to have her own stand in the market, since she and her husband have experience selling fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to invest in more and better products

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 20 años de edad, hace un año empezó a vivir con su pareja con la que tiene un bebe de 8 meses, vienen viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Desde que vive en casa de su suegra se dedica a pastar las vacas de ella, pero hay días en que trabaja en la chacra con su esposo, entonces, en esos días tiene que levantarse temprano para cocinar el almuerzo y llevarlo a la chacra, de paso va llevando los animales para sujetarlos en un lugar donde haya mucho pasto para que puedan comer. Miriam y su esposo en esta oportunidad han sembrado arvejas en chacras alquiladas que les cobran por cada cultivo realizado, lo bueno es que son terreno con acceso a la movilidad y cuando va caminando de su casa a la chacra lo hace en solo media hora. Ella está contenta con su trabajo, ya sea trabajar en la chacra o pastar a los animales, la única dificultad que tienen es cuando llueve en exceso, como lleva su bebé en la espalda debe cubrirlo muy bien, ya que una vez se mojó y se resfrió, debido a ello cuando llueve muy fuerte lo sujeta y regresa a su casa. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene Miriam con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha asistido a todas las reuniones que realiza el asesor de crédito, y sobre todo los pagos, los efectúa en los días señalados sin caer en morosidad. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de semillas de arvejas que sembrará en esta temporada con la esperanza de tener una buena cosecha en el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
Miriam is 20 years old, and as of a year ago she began to live with her partner which whom she has an 8 month year old baby. They are currently living in her mother-in-law’s house. Since she began living at her mother-in-law’s home she dedicates herself to taking her cows to pasture, but there are also days that she works on the small farm with her husband, on those days she wakes up early to cook lunch and takes it into the fields. On her way she also takes the animals and ties them to places where there is a lot of pasture for them to eat. Miriam and her husband have taken this opportunity to plant peas on rented small plots of land that charge them for each cultivated crop. The good thing is that they are plots of land with good road access, and when she walks from her home to the fields she can do it in only half an hour. She is happy with her work, be it working on the small farm or putting the animals to pasture, the only difficulty is that it when it rains a great deal because she carries her baby on her back she has to cover him very well, given that once he got wet and caught a cold. As such when it rains hard she gets a hold of him and returns home. This is the 4th loan that Miriam has with the MFP bank, and in all this time she has attended all the meetings that the loan adviser carries out. Especially when it comes to payments, she always makes them on the assigned days and has never had a delinquent payment. Miriam will invest the loan requested in the purchase of 3 sacks of pea seeds, which she will plant this season with the hope of having a good crop yield in the month of May.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba I. is sixty five years old. She is a widow and has eight children. Due to financial constraints, after the death of her husband, all her children dropped out of school. Currently all of her children are learning trades. She is a food vendor and sells waakye and has been selling for the past thirty years to take care of her home. Waakye is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all the tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye.
