She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, fish etc. She belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. He hopes to receive GH¢800 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans and fish etc.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana A. is a rice grower. Her husband died from an illness, and she knows how hard it is to be alone especially with her two children to feed, clothe and educate. She is 48-years old and she hopes that someday she will see her children graduate from college and find a good paying jobs.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes this loan will bring her a  good harvest. She is also looking for some other income possibilities to help her family.

CEVI gives her credit assistance, trainings and insurance and coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides for the farm

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: `El Cliente Victoriano M. de 60 años de edad.  El es casado y residente en la ciudad de San Ignacio. Vive en domicilio propio con su familia-- el es padre de 2 hijos menores. El Sr. M. es propietario de una despensa y un gimnasio, ubicado sobre la ruta 1 de la mencionada ciudad, con una antigüedad de mas de 11 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías para la despensa debido a que en esta temporada de calor posee mucha venta de bebidas y comestibles. De esta manera incrementar sus ingresos ya que de este negocio depende el estudio y la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano M. is 60 years old. He is married and lives in the city of San Ignacio. He lives in a home he owns with his family: he has two young children. Mr. M. owns a grocery store and a fitness centre located on Route 1 of the above-mentioned city and has been established in this industry for more than 11 years. The loan will be used to buy merchandise because in this season, due to the heat, refreshments and drinks sell very well. He will increase his income thanks to the loan because his children's studies and the health of his family depend on his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for the grocery store and materials for the fitness centre

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Madame  Koura Dembélé   est âgée de 44 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une  famille  polygame avec son mari, ses enfants et sa coépouse à Ségou Médine (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle commença les activités commerciales auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière elle maîtrisa les rouages du commerce. C’est ainsi que sur l’initiative et l’appui d’une cousine elle embrassa le commerce de bois de construction, activité qu’elle mène depuis 4 ans au marché de Médine. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une notoriété. Ses clients sont les entreprises de construction, les maçons et les propriétaires de maisons, il est à noter que la ville de Ségou est en pleine construction. 
Dans le souci  de faire face à cette demande croissante des clients, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 1er prêt individuel tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel pour un montant de  400 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 6 000 unités de bois de construction. Elle s’approvisionne dans la forêt de la fayiha sur la route de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Madame  Koura Dembélé  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales et  payer ses dettes.
texts.en:
Ms. Koura Dembélé, age 44, is married and the mother of five. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, children, and co-wives in Ségou Médine (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not have gone to school, she started working in commerce with her mother, who used to sell condiments. After several years at her mother's side, Koura learned all the ins and outs of the business.

And through the initiative and support of a cousin, she embraced commerce in timber, which has been her work for four years at the Médine marketplace. She enjoys a large customer base and some distinction. Her customers are construction enterprises, masons, and homeowners. It should be noted that the city of Ségou is in the middle of being built up.

Concerned about coping with the growing demands of her customers, Koura turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 30 months ago. After three solidarity loans and one individual loan, all repaid, she is now on her second individual loan in the amount of 400,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to buy 6,000 units of timber. Supplies are gotten from the Fayiha forest on the road to Bamako (the capital of Mali). Sales are made to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering certain family expenses and for paying her debts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for construction

loans.name: Kosimhudja

texts.ru: Наджадуллоев Косимхуджа житель города Яван. Уже около семи лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин на  центральном рынке города. Торгует продуктами питания. Решил получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом он привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительные доходы. Косимхуджа женат и имеет пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Kosimhudja N. lives in the town of Yavan. He has been in retail for about seven years. He has a store on the central town market where he sells food. He decided to apply for a loan to increase the variety of the merchandise. This way he can attract new customers and it will bring him additional profit. Kosimhudja is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es casada, vive con su esposo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de verduras por las mañanas hasta el medio día en un pequeño mercado de su localidad, y por las tardes cuida de su granja de cerdos para que estén en buen estado y adecuadamente alimentados para venderlos a un precio que le otorgue buenas ganancias. Ruth también está empezando a dedicarse a la crianza de vacas, ya que la venta de animales es un negocio rentable, por ello ha planificado para el futuro tener un establo más grande, donde pueda criar a mayor cantidad de animales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y el dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de alimento para sus cerdos y verduras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruth is married; she and her husband live in her parents’ house. She sells vegetables in the mornings until the middle of the day. She sells in a small market in her area. In the afternoons she takes care of her pig farm. She makes sure that they are in good shape and adequately fed so that she can sell them for a good price that will give her good earnings. Ruth is also starting to raise cattle because selling animals is a profitable business. In the future she plans to have a bigger stable where she can raise a larger quantity of animals. This is her first loan with MFP. The money is to buy food for the pigs and to buy wholesale vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 22-year-old man. He has owned an air-conditioning car-repair shop since 2006, from which he services the neighboring areas. Today, Rabih is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an electric motor to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase an electric motor

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 31 years old. She is a married woman with two children who are in the elementary school. She lives at Sefwi in the western part of Ghana with the family. She has been a baker for eight years now. She bakes and supplies them to her customers who come to buy from her stand. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers. She has managed to increase her market share through hard work and commitment. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she wants to buy sugar, flour, margarine, yeast, firewood etc. with which she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘God’s time is the best.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old. She is a married woman with four children, and all her children are in school. Mary works hard to help her husband to provide food for the children. Because of the hard work she is admired by many people. She has been a baker for five years now. She bakes bread and supplies it to her customers who come to buy in bulk.

She supplies it by herself, sometimes in the market center to her customers. She has managed to increase her market share through hard work and commitment. Her only problem now has to do with inadequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. With the loan she wants to buy sugar, flour, margarine, yeast, firewood etc. so that she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora Baltazara P. tiene 37 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos: su hijo menor tiene 1 año y su hijo mayor tiene 18. Ella cultiva frutas, verduras, y también legumbres como papas y cebollas en su terreno. Ahora mismo  está por cosechar papas. Lleva toda la vida trabajando en eso, porque es un negocio familiar; sus padres también se dedican al trabajo de campo. Ella vive con sus papás y trabaja la chacra con ellos,  su hermano, su esposo y su hija mayor. 

Está pidiendo un crédito  para invertir en la compra de semillas de legumbres para cosechar el próximo año. Su meta para el futuro es comprar su propia casa para que sus hijos puedan vivir allá y criar a sus propios hijos algún día. 

La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, el cual se reúne cada 2 semanas en Jipijapa, Manabí, cerca de la costa ecuatoriana. Es un grupo grande que ya tiene bastante tiempo trabajando con la fundación, y las socias se llevan muy bien entre ellas. Sra. Baltazara lleva 4 años con la fundación. Unas amigas le trajeron al inicio, y le gustó el trabajo en banco comunal, entonces se quedó.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara P. is 37 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Her youngest child is 1 year old, and her oldest child is 18 years old. She grows fruit, vegetables and legumes, like potatoes and onions on her land. Now she is harvesting potatoes. She has spent her whole life working on this because this is the family business. Her parents also work on the farm. She lives with her parents and works on the farm with them, her brother, her husband, and her older daughter. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of legume seeds to harvest next year. Her goal for the future is to buy her own house so that her children can live there and so that she can take care of her children someday. She is a member of the New Horizons (Nuevos Horizontes) Community Bank, which meets every two weeks in Jipijapa, Manabí, near the Ecuadorian coast. It is a big group that has already spent a lot of time working with the foundation, and the members get along with each other very well. Mrs. Baltazara has spent four years with the foundation. Some friends brought her to the foundation at the beginning, and she liked working in the community bank, so she stayed.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy legume seeds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. All of her children are still in school. She says she works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the central region of Ghana.

Esther is a petty trader. She runs a provisions store in her community. She sells all kinds of canned foods. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for resale

loans.name: Mith

texts.en:
Mith L., 27, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia, where she has owned a plot of land since 2000. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year.

Mith L. is a good mother to her two school-aged children. Her husband sells wood carvings that he makes using wood from the forest.

In view of the fact that rice growing is Mith L.'s main source of income to sustain her famiL.’s living conditions, and in order to help her meet the hard physical labor demanded by farming work, Mith L. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to use for plowing the fields and also to raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use for plowing the fields and also to raise its offspring

loans.name: Janet Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz, es madre soltera, tiene 37 años, dos hijos de 15 y 6 años que están estudiando en el escuela estatal.
Maribel termino la escuela y se puso a trabajar en ventas de productos por catálogo, empezó a tener muchas clientas y a crecer en el negocio, cuando decidió vender menú a una empresa de trasporte San Judas Tadeo, vende 50 menús diarios y también con sus ahorros ha podido comprar un carro que lo da  en alquiler para taxi.
En Finca Perú Maribel aprendió ahorrar, a  separar su ganancias y hacer solidarias con su amigas del Bancomunal, entender cuando el negocio está bajo y poderse ayudar.  
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El sueño de Maribel es tener una empresa de Taxi, y cree que con empeño lo logrará, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: llantas para su carro

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 33 years old who resides in the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Rolando, a known carpenter in their village. They have two school-aged children; Rose Anne and Spencer. The couple has a dream of providing complete education to their children through the income they gain from their business. She hopes that their dreams will do come true with the help of God whom they trust. 
 Her husband Rolando is the one responsible in making furniture which is their main source of income. It has been their main source of income for five years already. Gina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP4,000 for the improvement of their business. They need capital to purchase more needed materials for the development of their business. She is praying that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase materials for making furniture

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 68 años, vive con su hijo D. 20 años en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez ha estado muy ligada a las diversas tareas agrícolas, y con el paso D. los años sigue siendo ésta, su fuente D. ingresos. D. esta manera también tiene disponible algunos alimentos que guarda en su despensa para el consumo D. su familia y así sus gastos son menores en la alimentación. 
Hilda siembra maíz, papa y también la alfalfa, la cual le sirve tanto para alimentar a sus animales, como para la venta. En algunas ocasiones su hijo la apoya con las tareas que requieren D. mayor esfuerzo físico. Asimismo, en algunas oportunidades Hilda trabaja recogiendo cosechas D. otras personas, pues desea incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta a futuro más cercana es D. mejorar su granja D. cuyes y aumentar la cantidad D. animales que cría.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es una integrante D. su banco comunal muy comprometida con su grupo, ya que es parte D. la junta directiva. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. galpones o jaulas para su granja D. cuyes.
texts.en:
Hilda is 68 years old. She lives with her 20-year-old daughter in her own house. Since childhood she has been closely linked to farming tasks and over the years it has remained her source of income. This way she also has food available to her, which she stores in her pantry for her familiy´s consumption and this lowers her food costs. Hilda sows corn, potatoes and also alfalfa, which she uses to feed her animals as well as sells. Sometimes her son helps her out for the tasks that require more physical effort. Also, on some occasions Hilda picks crops for others because she wants to increase her income. Her goal for the near future is to improve her guinea pig farm and increase the number of animals she raises. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a very committed member of her communal bank and is part of the board of directors. The loan she is requesting now will be invested in purchasing sheds or cages for her guinea pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the cages for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 31, is a widow with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of selling hand-made products (bags and small flat baskets), earning approximately an income of US $6 per day. She is  the primary source of income for the family to help cover the family expenses.  

Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $900 to purchase Cambodian hand-made products for resale.

loans.use: To buy supplies of Cambodian hand-made products for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhorn Chham Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field and make the crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Huong Hoeung, is a construction worker. This couple has two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Sokhorn C. is the village bank president. This village bank loan is for 16 people located in Barkou village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a twenty-six year-old Palestinian woman, married with four children. She and her husband own a bakery shop where they sell sweets like cakes, cookies, Swiss roll, eclairs, etc. Their business is located at Al-Najah University street, a very bustling area in Nablus city Northern West Bank. Nablus is considered the commercial capital for the West Bank and it is the biggest Palestinian city.

Reem and her husband started this business six years ago and it is growing very fast. They both work very hard in this business as it is the only source of income for the family. Reem's husband is involved in the baking and decoration of the sweets while she sells the products to the customers in the shop.

Reem and husband requested 3000 USD from FATEN to buy raw materials as demand is high for sweets during the holiday season. Reem's husband appears in the picture while preparing some sweets.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for producing sweets

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene V., 40, is a vegetable, meat, and fish vendor. She was born in Camarines Sur, Bicol, a province down south of Luzon. Today, she lives with her husband and family in Pasay, Metro Manila. Blessed with five children, she and her husband Rolando are teaming up to expand their business for their family. Arlene has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all of the money she borrowed to buy assorted vegetables for her business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 48,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business with additional assorted vegetables, meat, and fish.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that when the time comes, they can have the resources to buy a lot or a market space where they can put up their own vegetable/meat store.  

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional assorted vegetables, meat and fish.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works very hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Sophia is a baker. She bakes bread and pastries and sells them to retailers in her community. Sophia buys bags of flour from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buyflour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Unidos Podemos 9 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group Unidos Podemos (United We Can), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, a rural town where the economy is dominated by agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Maritza is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small colmado or cornerstore, by supplying it with cooking oil, rice, beans, powdered milk and other basic necessities. She will use the profits to save towards investing in a separate location for her colmado, which she currently runs out of her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy, cooking oil, vegetables, powedered milk, beans

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married to Philip, and they have a five-year-old child. They live in Kikuyu, a peri-urban town which has a great deal of business potential. Nancy runs a retail shop, selling goods including juices, biscuits, chocolates and sweets to a steady network of customers who live within her area of business. She also supplies her goods to other retail shops.

Nancy has never borrowed from other institutions apart from KADET, which she was introduced to by her friends, and this will be her third loan with which she will add more stocks of the chocolates and sweets in her shop. Nancy plans to expand her trade in order to supply to a wider area and thus increase her daily sales.

loans.use: Nancy plans to add more boxes of chocolates and other sweets.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich S., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is has a business selling soup in her village, earning a gross income of US$ 14 per day. Her husband operates a business of producing rice wine at home, earning an income of US$ 7 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially on the children’s education. She has been with this job since 2004. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more various kinds of beverage to stock her food store. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy beverage to stock the store

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo, el banco comunal esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. comida, venta D. comestibles, venta D. artesanía, venta D. jora y pasto, venta D. verduras, venta D. animales menores,  venta D. lácteo y venta D. granos secos y otros ofrecen servicios D. cuidado D. ancianos, limpieza D. hoteles y secretariado. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Isabel forma parte del banco comunal “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla”, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Isabel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. chicha (La chicha D. jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.), ella tiene su propio local denominada picantería que esta ubicado en la plaza D. armas del distrito D. San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco. La picantería se diferencia D. los demás negocios pues a la puerta D. ingreso del local se le coloca una bandera D. color rojo amarrada con una planta. Isabel nos cuenta como realiza su actividad comercial, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar la chicha D. jora y empieza a venderla a partir del medio día, a partir D. las tres la tarD., ella reparte a sus clientes D. forma gratuita una pequeña comida llamada “picante”, ella atienD. su negocio hasta las 10 D. la noche y después D. terminar su jornal laboral se va a descansar para mañana volver a comenzar su trabajo. Ya son 16 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar leña, jora y cerveza.                  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA” communal bank is in its 5th loan cycle. It is composed of 15 hard-working, enterprising members who constantly seek ways to get ahead and proviD., through their daily efforts, a better future for their children. It is a communal bank maD. up of residents of Cusco. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Among these are: sale of food, prepared meals, crafts, jora (alcoholic beverage maD. from fermented corn), pasturage, vegetables, small farm animals, dairy products, grains; others care for senior citizens, work as hotel housekeepers and as secretaries. The communal bank has undergone several cycles and, as the members state, they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings, and the training. They especially appreciate the accrued value that they can obtain by leaving their funds in a common account. Isabel is a member of the “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla” communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 6 children. Isabel is a hard-working, enterprising woman who devised a way to open her own business: she sells chicha (chicha D. jora is an ancestral Peruvian and American beverage maD. from jora, fermented corn). She has her own store, called Picantería, located in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood’s main square. Picantería is unique among the other businesses because a red flag is tied to a plant at the entrance. Isabel tells us how she does her work: she rises very early to prepare the chicha D. jora and then begins her sales around noon. Starting at three in the afternoon, she provides a free snack, called “picante” to her customers. She is open for business until 10pm. When she completes her work day, she goes home to rest in order to start all over the next day. She has been in this line of work for 16 years and has done well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. She needs funding to buy firewood, jora and beer. The group members, as a whole, are grateful for the opportunity offered and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, jora (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) and beer.

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gambwa Group 1, Mityana

texts.en:
B. Silvester is the leader of his lending in Mityana. He is a hardworking and very devoted man with a business buying produce like beans, maize, tea and coffee from the farmers in Mityana villages and selling to the retailers and shop owners as well as other customers in Mubende, Mityana and Kampala.

Over his years in business, Silvester has developed a strong bond with his suppliers in a way that they always keep produce for him even when it is scarce. He is able to make 80,000/= as weekly profits.

Silvester is grateful that his loans have always enabled him to have enough stock, hence being able to pay his children’s school fees and expand his businesses. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, coffee and so on for increased stock

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista ella vende en un stand de desayunos ambulantes, mates de todo tipo medicinales (mates de cebada, de cola de caballo, de hinojo, de manzanilla, y así de todas las plantas, hierbas medicinales naturales). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para volver a comprar los insumos y servicios necesarios para su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Las Amistosas" (Friendly Women) village bank. She is a native of the Urcos District, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco, one hour from the city of Cusco. Our member is twenty-seven-years-old, lives with her partner and has two children. She goes between her personal life and and her retail business activities. She has a cart where she sells breakfast as well as medicinal infusions (made from barley, horse tail, fennel, chamomile, and all sorts of other plants, herbs, and natural medicines). Juana is seeking a loan to pay for more goods and services for her business. She appreciates and values the loan, and promises to make all her payments in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is seeking a loan to buy more goods and services she needs for her business.

loans.name: Ladu

texts.en:
Ladu M. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a hotel and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of cassava flour and dried fish.  Ladu is 30 years old and is married to a nurse. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava flour and dried fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a tough woman, who has surmounted a lot of problems being a wife, mother, and businesswoman. The challenges she went through have not stopped her from improving her family's lifestyle and giving her four children a better future. Though her husband is in prison, she has not surrendered to life and accepted poverty. Instead she has gone beyond the very few opportunities offered by her poor life and there she found ASHI. 

It was in the year 2000 when Erlinda first received a loan through ASHI. She started a small “sari-sari” (convenience) store selling a small inventory of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages. As the years went on, the amounts of her loans have increased and helped her sustain and expand her business. The profits she occasionally makes from her business are such a great help for her to support the needs of her children, whose ages range from 10 to 18. She also supports the needs of her husband in prison. 

Erlinda is happy for having achieved her business. However, she still needs to have other sources of income for a back up in case her store has problems and her family needs a larger amount of financial assistance, especially for the children's education. Erlinda is requesting a larger amount to borrow to enable her to finance a transportation service which will be managed by a hired driver.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business

loans.name: Keatha

texts.en: Mrs. Keatha P., age 27, lives in Bos village in Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice, which she sells to support her family. She has encountered a problem in that her field contains infertile soil. In addition, it is far away from any irrigation system. For this reason, to improve production, Mrs. Keatha P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine. Her husband, Mr. Sothey Phen, pictured with her here, is a construction worker. They have two small children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine for her rice field

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally K. and her family live in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she can cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, it has a lot of insects, and it is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Phally K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla Gnet, is a fisherman and a farming laborer, too. She is a mother of four children of whom all are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad B. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Trinidad is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Trinidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Trinidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Install security bars around her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more lappas and dishes to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa S. is a widow who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general store and making snare structures for crabs. Adelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelfa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general (sari-sari) store so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children. Adelfa S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kimbat

texts.en:
Kimbat P. is a single mother of two daughters.  She graduated from Trade college and worked as an accountant for four years. As it was very hard to bring up the children by herself on a low wage, Kimbat decided to start her own business in trade. 

Starting in 2007, she managed to broaden her business by renting a small shop and achieving success. Her loyal customers were attracted by her careful attitude and cheerfulness. 

But in June 2010, violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh. Kimbat lost her business, which was burned to ashes.

Kimbat doesn’t give up, however, and she is ready to resume her lost business and to continue to work. That is why Kimbat is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to rent a selling point at the local market to sell womens clothing. 

Kimbat is a very optimistic person who believes that giving a small chance to another person can inspire them for a great future.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for retail

loans.name: Renamie

texts.en: Renamie B. is from the village of Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old. Renamie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renamie buys and sells a variety of vegetables in the local community. Renamie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Renamie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renamie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Renamie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is married and has three kids. To help her husband with family expenses she started a farming business. Jumagul is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce for her family’s sustenance by planting and tending her crops. Despite the difficulties that Jumagul and her husband have suffered, they persevere; motivated by their desire for a better life. That is why Jumagul is asking for a loan to buy apples wholesale and sell them later, when the prices for them will increase. She wants to expand her business, a success that will bring a better quality of life for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards purchasing apples wholesale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda F. buys and sells different curtain and tarpaulin items. She was encouraged to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, because of the high value it places on helping women to prove their skills by lending them working capital for their businesses as micro-entrepreneurs. When she joined ASHI in 2007, she started to dream, hope, and discover a way to get herself out from under the hardship of poverty. To make a better income, Yolanda is interested in continuing and improving her business.
 
Yolanda would like to receive a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP in order to purchase a larger inventory of tarpaulins and other supplies. As a proud member of ASHI, one of the first Kiva microfinance partners in the Philippines, Yolanda is thankful to be able to obtain secured capital to support her goals in life. Her long-term goals are to build a profitable buying and selling business, send her children to college, and invest in her home. With the support of this Kiva partner, she is dedicated to expanding her business and is determined to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of tarpaulins and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y tiene 10 hijos (02 dependientes). La señora solo tiene estudios D. educación primaria.

Rosa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su  préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. comida D. la Región.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando ganados para luego venderlos.

Su sueño es mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women), which is located in the District of Cabanilla, Lampa Province, Department of Puno. She is 76 years old, widowed, and has ten children (two of whom are dependents). Sra. Rosa has an elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and used to increase her business capital for selling regional foods.

Rosa is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of cattle that she will sell later. Her dream is to improve her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is from the village of Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married and has four adult children. She is involved in banana production. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 1,500 a month.

In 2002, Aurelio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Aurelio is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for her banana garden

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es: Yecenia tiene 31 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años vende chanchos, para comprar y cría en su casa, prefiere comprar hembras para que pueda aparearlas, para luego vender las crías en las ferias comerciales de su zona. Le agrada vender cerdos, lo considera un negocio rentable, porque  su ciclo de reproducción es rápido, además que se reproducen en cantidad. Paralelo a esta actividad trabaja de manera dependiente, por lo que así puede tener más ingresos. Su deseo es mejorar su establo y aumentar la cantidad de cerdos que tiene. Es el crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos e incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Yecenia is 31 years old and lives with her four children in her own home.  

For more than seven years, she has sold pigs.  She buys them and raises them in her home.  She prefers to buy females because they can be bred, and then the offspring can be sold at markets in her area.  She considers this a profitable business because the pig's reproductive cycle is fast and they reproduce in a large quantity.  In addition, she also works as a salesclerk so she can earn more income.  

She would like to improve her stable and increase the number of pigs she owns.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is happy to be part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is thankful to all of the people who will make this loan possible because it will be very useful to the progress of her business.  

With this loan, she will purchase more pigs and increase her capital.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: José David Everinos

texts.es:
José David, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en Yoloaiquin departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y una hija de un año de edad, José lleva 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de hortalizas trabajando para un vecino, pero desde hace 4 años se ha dedicado a sembrar en lo propio chile, tomates, ejotes y pepino.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono orgánico y tratamiento para plagas, este préstamo le permitirá contar con lo necesario para poder sembrar y aumentar el área de producción obteniendo mayor cantidad de frutos, además tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer productos frescos a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha, poder venderla a buen precio y generar ingresos para su familia, uno de sus sueños es que su hija pueda crecer sanamente y logre ser profesional.
texts.en:
José David is a vegetable farmer. He is 25 years old and lives in Yoloaiquin in the Morazán department with his wife and his 1-year-old daughter. José has been growing vegetables for a neighbor for ten years now. Four years ago, he began planting chili peppers, tomatoes, green beans, and cucumbers on his own property. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase farm supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers and pest control treatment. This loan will help him to obtain the supplies he needs in order to plant his crops and to expand the area that he cultivates, thereby increasing his yield. This will give him the opportunity to offer fresh produce to his customers.

His goal is to obtain a good harvest so that he can sell it at a decent price and generate income for his family. One of his dreams is that his daughter will be able to grow up healthy and one day get a good job.

loans.use: Purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers and pest control treatment

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: Baatarsuren B. is 21 years old and lives with his parents in Hovd province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His mother is a teacher in the local school and his father operates a clothes trading business at the local market. Baatarsuren operates an Internet café in his town. He started his business in 2009 after building his own workplace next to the local market, a popular spot where he attracts many customers. He has established himself in the local business community and has a steady operation. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling a variety of cellphone parts. Baatarsuren is a talkative and open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cellphone parts and tools for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cellphone parts and tools

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene 67 años. Es madre soltera y vive junto a su 1 hijo que ha luchado para salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que labora con esta actividad, por lo que es importante para ella. Ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. El financiamiento que solicita es parar capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes entre otras cosas. En un futuro le gustaría tener su propia distribuidora para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Juana is 67 years old.  She is a single mother and lives alone with her son who has fought to get ahead.  Juana’s business is a grocery store that she has worked at for more than five years, which is why it is important to her.  She likes her work a lot because she meets a lot of people and forms good relationships.  This helps her to increase her list of customers and as a result, her sales continue increasing.  The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase general sweets, drinks, sodas, and detergents, among other things.  In the future, she would like to have her own wholesale business to supply her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Bold, 27, is married and lives with his wife and two-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He works as a computer program developer. He now earns money from a computer program he recently developed called Message Messy by cooperating with TV channels. It is a program that TV channels can use to communicate with the public through mobile texting. People can send texts while the channel is on and participate in TV games or order their favorite music. 

Now he is working on other programs and his previous work helps him to earn an income that supports his family. He wants to improve his developing skills and expand his business operation. He is a hard-working, sociable and dedicated person who wants to operate his own TV channel in the future. Bold is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to prepare new broadcast in C1 TV.

loans.use: To prepare a  new broadcast

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has five children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Festo has a retail shop, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Festo has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soap for washing clothes and maize flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Festo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Festo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase soap for washing clothes and maize flour for food for resale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells palm oil at Abura near Watreso. Araba has been through junior high school. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Araba has been selling palm oil for just two years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial working capital to buy more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale. She hopes to further educate her dependents with the new profit.

loans.use: to produce more oil for sale.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: El señor Valerio F. P. tiene 28 años de edad y vive en una casa de su propiedad, vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Simon Bolivar de esta ciudad de Tarija. Valerio es padre de 1 hijo, a quien cuida y apoya en su educación, junto con su esposa la señora Claudia Banesa Espinoza Farfan. Ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo y  esposa. Valerio se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años al servicio de transporte de aridos ( arena, ripio, grava, gravilla, etc.) Los cuales entrega en las diferentes construcciones de la ciudad. Teniendo buena clientela que prefieren ocupar sus servicios por ser una persona puntual y responsable. Valerio quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto su esposa e hijo , pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar ruedas nuevas para su volqueta, es por eso que el credito sera destinado para la compra de ruedas. Que son de gran necesidad para su volqueta y de esa forma poder realizar sin problemas el servicio de transporte de aridos. De ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos que mucha falta le hacen.                                                                                                                                                                                                        Valerio nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Valerio Fernández P. is 28 years old and lives in a house he own located in the city of Tarija’s Simon Bolívar neighborhood.  Valerio is the father of a son whom he cares for and educates together with his wife, Mrs. Claudia Banesa Espinoza Farfán.  He must work to support his wife and child.

For over six years Valerio has worked transporting “aridos” (all kinds of ground matter used in construction – gravel, sand, rock, etc) to various construction sites in the city.  Because he is a punctual and responsible person his services are preferred by many good customers.

Valerio wants to earn better income to get ahead with his wife and child but he tells us that he needs to buy new tires for his dump truck so the loan will be used for this purpose.  The tires are greatly needed for the dump truck so that he can continue to perform his transport jobs problem free.  This will make it possible for him to increase his income which he very much needs to do.

Valerio tells us that he wants to improve the living conditions they have so he mentions that he plans to use the next loan he requests to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Richmond

texts.en:
Richmond A. is from the town of East. Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Richmond is married and has three school-aged children. He is a fisherman who sells his catch in the local community. Richmond has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Richmond joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Richmond is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Richmond from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

* Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two adult children. She lives in Melitopol and sells jewelry in one of the local markets. She offers a wide variety of merchandise for sale in her vending location. Alla has been in this business for 15 years. She has 50,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her monthly net income is about 6,000 UAH. 

Alla lives with her husband and eldest daughter, a single mother raising a 3 year old daughter. Four years ago, Alla helped her daughter to start her own business selling similar products. Both businesses are developing well, bringing a stable income to this hard working family.

Alla is seeking a loan of 18,000 UAH to purchase assorted items to add to the inventory that she already offers for retail sale. She is hoping to continue developing her trade in the future and to see it flourish even more.

loans.use: to purchase assorted items for inventory.

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Elba del Carmen  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 49 años quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con unos ahorros con la venta de gaseosa, chiverías…etc. con el préstamo ha ido surtiendo su negocio. Además ella vende ropa, zapatos, plata etc. en lo cual invertirá el crédito.

Elba tiene seis hijos mores de edad de los cuales su hija Iveth es quien le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elba del Carmen is a hard working, enterprising, 49-year-old woman who has a grocery store that she started out with some savings from selling soft drinks, snacks, etc.  With the loan she’s been stocking her store.  She also sells clothes, shoes, silver, etc. which is what she’ll invest the loan in.  

She has six minor children.  Her daughter Iveth is the one that helps her in the business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, clothes, shoes and silver.

loans.name: Nzambe Malamu Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzambe Malamu Plus is a group of 13 owners of small businesses chaired by Marcel. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Marcel, 49, is married and operates a general store in an area located north of the capital city of Kinshasa. He has been running his business for years. He has acquired solid experience in this area. Marcel has already used seven Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of his inventory and he paid them back correctly. Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet clients demand and generate additional profit. This will help him to achieve his plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of US$122 per week. Marcel’s ambition is to expand his store. He is the father of two children whose ages are 8 and 14 years old. Both go to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for his store for resale at a profit

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two daughters, age 11 and 15, go to a local secondary school. She manages a mobile meat-trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 2007 and has been able to stabilize her business. They collect meat and livestock from herders and sell them to city residents or to workers at the mining industry. 

With years of business operation she gained much experience and is planning to expand her business in the future. In addition, she manages a grocery trading business in order to supplement to her earnings. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I want to have a car with my earnings." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and livestock for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 43 years old, is a firewood seller. Her husband is a guard.  Their income is $3 per day. They have 4 children, two of whom are studying and two of whom sell souvenirs at Angor Wat temple in Siemreap.   Their income is $9 per day.  Every month, Him has to spend around $70 for all the expenses of the family. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy farmland for doing farming. In the future, she wants to have a small store to sell groceries and firewood.  She will try harder to send her last two children to study so that they can get a good job in the future.

loans.use: To buy farmland to do farming

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.en:
Yaquelin is 27 years old and was born in Urubamba where she still currently lives.  She has one child and a partner whom she does not live with.  She has been a teacher for six years at a pre-school in Yucay and she works everyday there from 8 am to 2 pm. 

She also has a grocery store in her house that has been open for one year and Yaquelin wishes to expand it.  With the 1,000 dollar loan, Yaquelin plans on buying more products for her store such as rice, sugar, and oil.  With her increased success from the loan, her dream is to buy her own house because at the moment she lives with her father.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
At the age of 53, Rodrigo has worked for over 30 years in farming in order to meet his family's needs. He is married and is a responsible father to his four children. He is doing the best in farming to improve his crop production.  He wants to give his children an education.

Rodrigo is asking for a loan to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizers from animal manure, rice seeds and herbicides. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the service of the laborers he hired for his land preparation.

In the future, Rodrigo hopes to increase his business for his family to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy farming products like organic fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Norma Yamileth

texts.en:
Norma lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras, with her husband. She operates a small shop out of her home, selling shrimp, dairy products and basic groceries. 

Twice a week Norma leaves the shop in the care of her daughter-in-law while she travels around neighboring villages selling shrimp and dairy products.

Norma is requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 to purchase a bulk quantity of shrimp.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk amount of shrimp.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a hardworking 31-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, he has been running a beauty salon so as to make a living. He also uses his premises to operate a barber shop. In the next 5 years he wants to have a well-established salon in the town centre.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy dryers and a shaving machine. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances easily to access.

loans.use: to buy dryers and shaving machine

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Rachel, administra un comedor, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, este negocio de Rachel fue heredado por su madre, lleva 11 años trabajando en él, lo atiende de 7:00am a 5:00pm de lunes a domingo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo construir una galera en el solar, para cocinar en un lugar más amplio, comprara laminas, madera, clavos, alambre, arena y cemento, mano de obra, para poder realizar el trabajo.
Este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ampliándolo y mejorando así su condición de microempresaria.
texts.en:
Rachel runs a small eatery. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 11. 

Rachel's business was inherited by her mother. She has been working there for 11 years, and her hours of business are from 7:00am to 5:00pm, Monday to Sunday.  

Now she is applying for a loan to build a shed on the lot, in order to have a larger space to cook in.  To carry out this work, she will buy metal sheeting, wood, nails, wire, sand, cement and labor. This loan will help her to make her business better; enlarging it and improving her status as a small business owner.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, nails, wire, sand, cement and labor.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, a 33-year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Oanh requests a loan to purchase more products such as soap, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as soap, candies, toilet paper and shampoo to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en:
Ramy is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and only sibling. Since he was very young, he was obsessed with everything related to music, so he got involved in this field six years ago and he finally opened his own store. His job consists in selling CD’s and organizing music for weddings, social events, etc. In parallel, he works in a local university to earn more income. 

Today, Ramy is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to enlarge his business operation by purchasing additional musical instruments etc. He is very positive and hopes to apply for more Kiva loans in the future.

loans.use: purchasing additional musical instruments, etc.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian, 32 years old, is a tailor who earns $10 per day. Her husband buys and resells motorbikes earning about $15 per day. They have three children, all of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $53 on food, $5 on electricity, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy plastic material to sell. This loan will help her to have another career to earn money. She plans to buy a plot of land to build a house for her family because right now they live with their parents.

loans.use: To buy plastic material to sell

loans.name: Rosenda Maria

texts.es:
Rosenda, vive con sus dos hijos, es administradora y propietaria de un comedor donde le ofrece a los clientes comida como desayunos, almuerzos y antojitos, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende todos los días a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad en su negocio como carnes, verduras, pollo,aceite, sal esta compra le ayudar a mejorar y surtir su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio para tener mayores ingresos económicos y darle la educación adecuada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosenda lives with her two children. She is the administrator and owner of a café where she offers her customers food such as breakfasts, lunches, and snacks. She says that the business emerged as a result of her own initiatives. She works at it every day full time.

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase basic goods need for her business such as meats, vegetables, chicken, oil and salt. These purchases will help her improve and stock her business. Her biggest dream is to improve her business in order to have greater income and give an adequate education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables, chicken, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Basemah

texts.en:
Basemah is a 45-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Basemah is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

An aspiration of Basemah's is to open another branch of her business.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Basemah's son.

loans.use: to puchase clothes to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who lives in the Kongowea, Kenya, is a water vendor. He is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. He supplies water to neighborhoods. This idea came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. In addition to this, he also owns a motorcycle that he uses to transport people around the area. He is employed as a chef and has rental houses.

A loan of 40,000 KES will help John add more water kiosks. Although the high cost of living has reduced the disposable income of many customers needing transportation services, John intends to purchase more motorcycles in the future. He believes the income from the business will improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To add more water kiosks i.e pay fees/levy and intall selling points

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 53 года, замужем и имеет двух взрослых детей . В 1996 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Рыскан начала заниматься торговлей хозяйственными товарами на местном рынке. Высокий спрос на хороший ассортимент товара Рыскан,  сделавшей основным направлением своей торговли электротовары, позволяет получать прибыль в сумме около 40,000 сом в месяц. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности позволили Рыскан приобрести торговый павильон на рынке. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует направить на расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Ryskan is 53 years old and married with two adult children. In 1996, in search of a source of income for her family, Ryskan began to sell household goods at the local market. There is high demand for a good variety of products. Ryskan made electronics her main products and is able to make a profit of around 40,000 som a month. The income from her business activities enabled Ryskan to purchase a shopping pavilion in the market. To further grow her business, Ryskan has approached Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som to expand the range of her products. With the income from the loan Ryskan plans to expand her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Yulisa Rosanna

texts.es:
YULISA ROSANNA tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Yulisa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 13 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan . Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar semillas. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a los hijos.
texts.en:
Yulisa Rosanna is 30 years old and lives in the Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos settlement, with her two children, ages 14 and 10, and her husband.  She’s a member of the San Juan communal bank, located in the San Fransisco part of the San Juan parish.  They are farmers.

Yulisa has been raising rice and corn for more than 13 years.  She buys and sells in San Juan and is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizers and urea.  The loan will be of great help and will allow her to buy seeds.  She hasn’t had any problems and she hopes to have her own land in the future.

She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Estrellita Azul Group

texts.es:
El comité Estrellita Azul nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Vicenta, tesorera del grupo está casada, tiene 2 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación; asi como también ser una líder ejemplar para las demás integrantes de su comité. Ella nos comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días trabaja duramente y la cual es el sustento de su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Estrellita Azul communal bank was created through the management and support that it received from another communal bank that was working in that place. 

This communal bank is in San Lorenzo city. The members of the communal bank set as their main goal the personal development of each one of them. Within the institution, they are known as hard working women.

Vicenta, the group's treasurer, is married and has 2 children. She is an enterprising, innovative woman who has shown an eagerness for self-improvement throughout all these loan cycles. She has also demonstrated that she is a great leader for the other members of the communal bank.

She says she owns a little grocery store where she works hard every day and which helps her to support her family.

She seeks help from Fundación Paraguaya to buy groceries, beverages, dairy products and other goods for her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages, dairy products and other goods.

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
Asenati is married, 28 years of age with five children.

Asenati owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Asenati needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 200 or USD $83 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Asenati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Asenati's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Jhoana Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora.
